content:
OUT! IN THE AIR AND GONE! All over for England! India break the Edgbaston hoodoo as they register their first Test win at this venue. On a nagging length, on off, Brydon Carse clears his front leg and has a swing at it. Skies it up towards cover where Shubman Gill settles under it and catches it around his waist. 10 WICKETS in the game for Akash Deep! India win by 336 runs and draw level in the series!
Brydon Carse c S Gill b A Deep 38 (48b 5x4 1x6)
Short and on off, Bashir makes room and chops it down towards backward point.
Beaten! Slower through the air, fuller and outside off, Shoaib Bashir gets down for the slog sweep but fails to connect.
Pitched way outside leg, and much slower through the air. It lands and spins sharply into the batter to hit the splice of the bat as Bashir leans ahead to defend.
Much slower and the length is pulled back, on middle, Shoaib Bashir lunges and is beaten on the inside edge.
Fuller and around leg, Bashir defends it off the front foot.
Just over the stumps! Turning away, landing around leg. Bashir backs away to defend. Spins past the bat and goes over the off stump.
Spots Carse backing away and Akash bowls it well away from the batter's reach on the off side. Brydon Carse cannot reach and lets it go.
Slanting into the right-hander, on a back of a length, Carse has a swipe across the line but fails to lay any bat on it. Gets hit near the box.

NO BALL AND FOUR! On a nagging length, outside off, Brydon Carse swings for the hills as he looks to park it down the ground. Gets an outside edge that flies over the slip cordon for a boundary. Deep has overstepped.
On a length, on the pads, tickled down to deep fine leg for a single but no run taken.

FOUR! Gets it away this time! Deep does well to follow the batter with a slower short ball. Brydon Carse is early into the shot again and one hand comes off the bat but gets a good enough connection this time. Hits it to the left of deep square leg for a boundary.
Another slower delivery but this is bowled into the wicket, over middle, Brydon Carse is early into the shot and ends up dragging it off the inner half to deep fine leg but does not take the single.
Pace taken off by Deep, full and wide on off, Brydon Carse defends it out.
Full and around leg, blocked out by Shoaib Bashir.
Fuller and on off, Shoaib Bashir gets forward and knocks it through the vacant mid off region for a couple of runs.
Short and around leg, Shoaib Bashir pads it away.

Lobbed to first slip and taken! Given out but successfully overturned by Shoaib Bashir. Pushed through from around the wicket, landing outside the line of the leg stump, Shoaib Bashir gets inside the line for the scoop. The ball sneaks past the bat and lobs off the pad towards first slip where KL Rahul takes it. The finger is raised but Bashir takes the review straight away. The UltraEdge shows no bat and the decision is overturned.
Short and on middle, tucked past mid-wicket for a single by Carse.
Spinning away sharply, short and around off, Brydon Carse lets it be.

SIX! Launched down the ground and the English dressing room enjoyed that! Right in the slot by Deep, a bit too full, on middle, Bashir holds his shape and tonks it flat over the long on fence for a six.

PUT DOWN BY SIRAJ! On a length, on off, Brydon Carse gets the front leg out of the way and swings to go down the ground. Skies it straight up towards mid on where Mohammed Siraj never really settled under it. Siraj tried to arche back and take it behind his head but the ball clipped his fingertips and rolled behind with Siraj falling on his back.
Dug in short, around leg, Brydon Carse ducks under it.
On a hard length, following the batter as he threatens to back away, Brydon Carse hops and tucks it to deep square leg but does not take the single.
Pace taken off, fuller and wider on off, left alone by Carse.
Deep bangs it in short, over middle and leg, Brydon Carse backs away to go through the off side but seeing the length, he drops his wrists and lets the ball go.

FOUR! Shoaib Bashir brings out the reverse on the very first ball! Very full, around leg, Bashir gets his hands through the ball quickly and reverse sweeps it uppishly but to the left of backward point for a boundary.

OUT! TAKEN! GONE! A one-handed screamer from Siraj at mid-wicket! He cannot quite believe it and lies on the ground. Jadeja gets a wicket to his name! Jadeja fires it and slides it on middle. It is a bit too full in length and Josh Tongue goes for the flick shot. He, though, fails to keep it down and hits it flat and low to the right of Siraj at mid-wicket. Siraj there, throws himself to the right and dives low, and just manages to scoop the ball before the grass with his right hand. All the Indian players run towards him in celebration as England are 246/9, just one wicket away from scripting history in Edgbaston.
Josh Tongue c M Siraj b R Jadeja 2 (29b 0x4 0x6)
Fuller delivery, on middle, Josh Tongue blocks it to the left of the bowler.
Around the stumps, slowish delivery on a length. Slides on middle with some bounce and Josh negotiates well to dab it on the pitch.
Flat and full, on leg, Brydon Carse sweeps it behind square on the leg side for a single.
Outside leg, turning away on a length. Carse hangs back and pads it away.
Good length, just outside off, left alone.

Slips in a full toss, just below the waist height, Josh Tongue's bottom hand comes off the bat as the ball hits the splice of the willow before rolling on the off side. An instant apology from Siraj to the batter.
Good-length delivery, on off, Josh Tongue blocks it on the bounce to Siraj who grabs it over his head.
Short and going down leg. Josh ducks at it.
Sharp bouncer to follow now, angling down leg, Brydon Carse aerially pulls it and the deep square leg fielder collects it on the bounce. A single taken.
Back of a length, on top of off. Carse hops off and stabs it on the surface.
Tossed up outside leg, and it sharply turns away from the batter. Josh Tongue defends it off the inside half of the bat beside short leg.
Fuller ball, on leg, Josh Tongue eases it back to Jadeja.
Pushed through, on the leg stump, Tongue keeps it out to the leg side.
BEATEN! Lands on the leg stump, and it rips across the batter to beat the bat of Tongue.
Dropped fuller and around middle and off, Josh Tongue drills it to the right of mid off and runs for the second easily.
Much fuller, on the leg stump line. Tongue gets forward and gently pushes it to short mid-wicket.
Straight and full, on off, Carse leans on and blocks it out safely.
On the fullish length again, around off, Brydon Carse strides ahead to drive to the off side, but gets it off the inside half of the bat to short mid on.
Fuller, and angling into the batter, Brydon Carse tries to push it straight but inside edges onto the front pad.
Too full, tailing a bit in on off, Brydon Carse takes a giant stride ahead and forces the drive to mid off.
Nagging length, nipping away from outside off, Brydon Carse taps it away to short cover.
FOUR! Great shot! Outside off, on a length. Brydon Carse stretches forward and slaps that through point for a boundary.
Fuller and around leg, Josh Tongue leans on to block it to the right of the bowler.

One more that bites off the rough, outside leg, and spins across the stumps. It beats the bat of Josh Tongue who goes back and across to deal with it and is rapped on the pad. A gentle appeal for LBW, but the umpire Chris Gaffaney denies with a smile on his face.
That spun prodigiously! Lands it outside leg, giving the ball more air, and it spins across the batter and beats Josh on the outside edge.
Fuller now, on the leg stump, pushed back to the bowler.
Length, outside leg, tapped with soft hands to the right of short leg.
Lifts off the rough, outside leg, spinning away from the batter. Josh Tongue just about manages to fend it to the off side with soft hands.
Length and on off, punched to point.

Slower one, just around off and full. Brydon Carse stretches forward to reach at it and gets a thick outside edge as he pushes hard on the ball. It catches the outside edge and lands on the bounce towards the gully fielder.
Short and outside leg, Brydon Carse ducks under it to dodge.
SIX! Just sails over! Around the stumps, short and on the body. sits up nicely for someone tall like Brydon Carse. He swings through the line and nails the pull shot behind deep mid-wicket for a six.
Length, on off, dabbed to wide gully.
Outside leg and full, Brydon Carse tries to work that across, but gets a leading edge to the point region.
Drags the length back, outside leg. Tongue goes back and across to dab it down to the pitch.
Fuller delivery, on the leg stump, Tongue pushes it to the bowler.
Nice and full, on middle, eased back to the bowler.

CHANCE, PUT DOWN! KL Rahul drops a sharp catch! Jadeja lands it on the rough outside leg again, and gets a good grip from there as the ball turns sharply across the batter. Brydon Carse plays at it and gets a thick outside edge, and goes to the left of KL Rahul. Rahul there is a bit late to react and is probably beaten by the pace at which the ball came at him. Drags his both hands towards the ball, but puts it down eventually. The ball rolls behind and they cross.
FOUR! Shot! On leg, full in length. Brydon Carse sits down and sweeps it to deep mid-wicket for a cracking boundary.
With a crowded field ambushing the batter, Jadeja floats it full and on the rough around leg. Carse keeps it out safely.
An attempted yorker, on middle, carved out back to the bowler by Josh Tongue.

BEAUTY! Just shapes into the batter, on a length, and straightens up a bit, on off. Josh Tongue is caught in the crease and plays away from the body to poke at it. Gets beaten on the outside edge by a whisker.
Hits the deck hard, on top of middle. Josh Tongue hops across and inside the line to dab it onto the pitch.
Short and outside off, Josh leans back to leave.

An appeal for LBW, but dies down as the umpire denies! Maybe doing a bit too much to slide down leg. Krishna spears it fuller and on middle and leg. Josh Tongue looks to flick it across, but the ball nips in a touch and catches the inside edge to rap on the front pad.
Hard length, outside off, Carse pushes it between cover and point for a single.
Shortish and down leg, Josh Tongue stays inside the line and lets it be.
Full and on off, pushed to cover.

OUT! IN THE AIR AND GONE! FIVE-FER FOR AKASH DEEP! And his joy knows no bounds as he gets his name on the honours board of Edgbaston! Smart change of pace by Akash, hits the hard length, on the bodyline of the batter, but this time, he rolls his fingers to take all the pace off the ball. Jamie Smith, with the adrenaline of those two biggies, goes for another one with the pull shot but is just a bit early on the shot. Mistimes it towards Washington Sundar stationed at deep backward square leg, who runs to his right to snaffle it. Jamie Smith departs and England are 226/8. Maiden Test five-wicket haul for Akash and several Indian players scoot towards him in jubilation.
Jamie Smith (wk) c W Sundar b A Deep 88 (99b 9x4 4x6)

SIX MORE! That is huge! Short again from Akash, on top of off. Jamie Smith gets the ball at a comfortable height and finds the middle of the bat as he smashes into the stands behind deep mid-wicket for a cracking six.
SIX! Gets plenty on that! Short and over the shoulder height, Jamie Smith hangs back and pulls it over the deep backward square leg fence for a six.

Fuller and on middle. Carse drives it straight back to the bowler. The ball deflects off the right boot of Akash Deep and rolls through the right of mid off, but loses its steam on the way to the ropes. Yashasvi Jaiswal from mid off chases it before the boundary. Three taken.
Well bowled! Jamie Smith shows his cards early as he backs away and Prasidh Krishna spots it. Slips in the loopy and dipping slower one, very full, on the off stump. Smith ends up jamming it out.
Fuller in length, on off, knocked wide of short cover for a single.
Tighter line, on middle, on a hard length, Brydon Carse rises with the bounce and fends it down.
FOUR! Brydon Carse is off the pair! On a back of a length, outside off, Brydon gets on top of the bounce and just punches it through point for a boundary.
Hits the bat hard and rushes the batter, on a shortish length, around off, Brydon Carse waits back to push it away on the off side. The ball hits the splice of the bat and rolls down the deck.
Wide! Short again but this sails over the head of Brydon Carse.
Serves a bumper, over off, Jamie swivels and controls the pull towards deep square leg for a single.
Bowled from wide of the crease, on a good length, outside off, Brydon knocks it to extra cover but they do not take the single.
Pitched up this time, on the off stump, Carse does not move his feet and taps it to mid off.
Lands it on a hard length, on off, Brydon Carse rises with the bounce and guides it down towards gully.
Banged in short, sharp and quick, over middle, Brydon Carse hurriedly ducks under it. The ball curves away after going past the batter but Rishabh Pant manages to collect it with a dive to his right.
Attacking the off stump, on a good length, Carse gets his bat out in front to keep it out.
Sliding down leg, on a back of a length, Carse misses out on the tickle.
Back to bowling it short and Krishna gets good height on this one. Around the right shoulder, Jamie Smith sways away and drops his wrists.

FOUR! Easily done! After a barrage of short balls, Prasidh Krishna looks to slip in the full ball but ends up bowling a low full toss, on middle, Smith clips it between mid-wicket and mid on for a boundary.

Given LBW but successfully overturned by Jamie Smith! On a back of a length, over middle, Smith hops on the back foot to deal with it. Goes for the pull but the ball stays a bit low and catches Smith on the back thigh. A loud shout and the finger is raised. That looked high and Jamie Smith has taken the review. No bat involved on UltraEdge and the Ball Tracking shows that the ball is going well over the stumps.
With a short leg and a leg slip in place, Krishna bangs it in short, around the ribs, Carse fends it down to the right of short leg and crosses over.
Hits the deck hard, on top of off, Carse waits back and steers it to point.

OUT! TAKEN! Mohammed Siraj takes a dolly and the short ball ploy against Chris Woakes has worked! Prasidh Krishna steams in from over the wicket and digs it in short, outside off, Chris Woakes hops and lifts his front leg as he looks to drag the pull. Fails to get on top of the bounce and a top edge is induced. It goes straight up towards mid-wicket, where Siraj settles under it and does the rest. First wicket of the game for Prasidh as he breaks this 46-run partnership. Chris Woakes departs for 7 (32) and England are 199/7.
Chris Woakes c M Siraj b P Krishna 7 (32b 1x4 0x6)
Short and outside off, Woakes rides the bounce and glides it to deep backward point for a single.
Beauty! In the channel on off, on a good length, Woakes is pushed back due to the previous two short balls. Tentatively defends away from his body and is beaten on the outside edge.
A well-directed bumper at the badge of the helmet, Chris Woakes ducks under it.
Akash goes into the wicket again, around off, Woakes seemed to be shaping up for the duck intially before opting to stay upright and fend it down.
Bangs it on a shortish length, on off, Jamie Smith leans back for the pull. Drags it off the inner half to deep square leg for one.
Honing in on the off stump, on a good length, Jamie Smith covers the line and dabs it down on the off side.
Delivers it on a back of a length, outside off, Woakes stands tall and punches it to cover.
Outside off, on a length, Chris Woakes gets forward and taps it back to the bowler.
This is around off, on a length, knocked past Karun Nair at short cover for a single.

Not far away from going to hand! Krishna hurls it fuller in length, around off, Smith extends his hands into the shot. Drives it on the bounce to the man at short cover. Karun Nair makes a sharp stop with a dive to his right.
On a back of a length, around leg, Jamie Smith hangs back and tucks it to mid-wicket.
On off, on a good length, Smith pushes it towards mid off.
Fuller in length, on off, Woakes pushes it to cover.
On middle and leg, on a length, Woakes is right behind it in defence.

FOUR! Edged but it goes through! Wider on off, on a good length, Woakes presses forward and plays a loose drive away from his body. Gets an outside edge that goes low towards the third slip, where Nitish Kumar Reddy dives to his right and goes for the catch with his right hand. The ball gets past him for a boundary.
Beaten! In the channel on off, on a back of a length, this deviates away, possibly off a crack. Chris Woakes walks closer to the line of the ball to block. Gets beaten on the outside edge.
This stays a bit low and it is not that short, on middle, Smith swivels on the back foot and drags it towards deep backward square leg for a single.
On a good length, outside off, Smith drives it on the up to cover.
Keeps it full but this is slower, on middle, Jamie works it towards mid-wicket where the fielder dives to his right but fails to make the stop. Concedes a single.
SIX! Hit flat and hard! Sundar offers flight, on off, Jamie puts the dancing shoes on and thumps it to the left of Mohammed Siraj at wide long on for six more.
FOUR! Edged away! Flatter and shorter, outside off, Smith goes back for the cut. Gets it off the outer half and fine of the man at backward point for a boundary.
Full and attacking the front pad, clipped to mid-wicket.
The length is pulled back and there is a bit of extra bounce, on middle, Smith presses back and knocks it to cover.
SIX! BANG! Excellent use of the feet! Floated up, full and on middle, Smith charges down the track and launches it over mid-wicket for a six.
A bit of inward shape, on off, on a length, Woakes gets behind the line and pats it down the deck.
Deep looks to go short but the ball does rise as much as he would have liked and the line is slightly down leg. Woakes gets inside the line and ducks.
Very full, on off, Jamie Smith stays leg side of the ball and guides it to deep point for a single.
Pitched up, on off, Smith stylishly drives it with a high elbow towards mid off.
On off, on a hard length, played off the back foot to mid on with a straight bat.
On a back of a length, on off, Smith sets up to force it through the off side. Miscues it back to the bowler.
From around the wicket, landing outside the line of the leg stump. Chris Woakes shoulders arms and lets the ball hit his pads. Half a shout for LBW but that certainly pitched outside leg.
On off, on a nagging length, Woakes gets back to block.
On middle, Woakes presses back to block.

FIFTY FOR SMITH! A stunning century in the first innings and now, a fighting half-century in the second innings. His 5th fifty in Test cricket. This kicked up a bit, on middle, Smith stepped out but could not get to the pitch of the ball. Ekes out an inside edge that went wide of the man at short leg to his right. A single taken.
At the stumps, on a length, Smith flicks it away but the ball hits Yashasvi Jaiswal at short leg on his right leg on the bounce.
On off, on a nagging length, Jamie Smith steps out and clips it but can't get it past the substitute fielder, Sai Sudharsan who dives to his right at short mid-wicket to make the stop.
Fuller and on off, Woakes defends it off the front foot.
On off, punched off the back foot past cover for a single.
Fuller and on middle, Jamie Smith gets down for the slog sweep. Gets an inside edge onto the pads.
Around leg, kept out on the leg side.

EDGED AND FOUR! Serves it outside the line of the leg stump, Jamie is better off padding the ball away but looks to flick it against the turn. Gets an outside edge that goes to the right of slip for a boundary.
Turning away from the rough, on a leg, Jamie plays the line and gets beaten all ends up as the ball rips across to go past the bat and goes onto hit the right pad of Rishabh Pant.
Short and a bit of turn, on off, Woakes punches it to cover.
Drifting away, on the fuller side, outside off, Woakes walks across and gets closer to the line to defend.
Shorter and around off, Woakes is a bit indecisive whether to leave or play it. Stabs it down on the off side.
Short and on off, Chris gets back to tuck it to mid-wicket.
This does not turn much, fuller and slower, Woakes is solid in defence.
On off, on a length, Woakes gets his bat out in front of the front pad.
Full and at the stumps, Smith eases it back to Jadeja.
This is quicker, around middle and leg, on a nagging length, Smith covers the line and plays it back to Jadeja.
A bit of loop on this one, on middle, knocked back to the bowler.
Keeps it slow and full, on middle, Jamie smothers the spin.
Full and spinning away, on middle, Woakes gets forward to defend it with soft hands. The ball rolls off the outer half to backward point for one.
Turning away, on middle, on a nagging length, Woakes waits back to block.
FOUR! Off the edge! On the shorter side, outside off, Jamie Smith backs away to slap it away. Gets an outside edge that races past short third for a boundary.
On off, pushed wide of cover for a single by Woakes.
Slower and shorter, outside off, Smith backs away for the cut. Gets it off the outer half to deep third for a single.

Fuller and on middle, a bit of away drift, Jamie flicks it to the right of long on. Woakes had to hurry for the second run as Mohammed Siraj was quick to get to the ball and release the throw but Woakes made it in.
Flatter and shorter, around off, Smith presses back for the pull. Ends up playing it back to Sundar.
Pushed through, on the off stump, on a nagging length, Jamie Smith covers the line and pushes it back to Sundar.
Full and on middle, Chris Woakes defends it right under his eyes.
Slower and fuller, on the leg stump, Woakes blocks with his bat close to the front pad.
Landing outside leg, on a length, Woakes pads it away.
Fired in, full and on the pads, Jamie flicks it through mid-wicket. Nitish Kumar Reddy goes after it and cuts it off with a slide. Keeps the batters down to a single.
Full and around leg, Smith blocks it out off the front foot.
FOUR! Lovely shot! Tossed up, full and on off, Smith just gets forward and drives through the vacant mid off region for a boundary.
This spins back in, short and on middle, Woakes stays back to work it across to the leg side with the turn but is beaten on the inside edge. Wears it high on the front pad.
On middle and leg, on the fuller side, Woakes dabs it down on the leg side.

Edged but short! Another one that drifts away, on a nagging length, on off, Woakes tentatively defends away from his body. Gets an outside edge that drops short of KL Rahul, who is a bit deep at slip.

OUT! LBW! A loud shout and the finger is raised! Ben Stokes stands there a bit perplexed before walking over to Jamie Smith. Stokes takes the review. This is pushed through from around the wicket, full and drifting in on off, Stokes is a bit late to get forward in defence. The bat stays behind the front pad and the ball seems to have flicked the front pad before making contact with the bat. The UltraEdge confirms that it is pad first and it is three reds on Ball Tracking with the ball crashing into the middle stump. The English skipper takes a review with him and this is a massive blow for the hosts right at the stroke of Lunch.
Ben Stokes (c) lbw W Sundar 33 (73b 6x4 0x6)

Strangled down leg? India like it but the finger stays down. Yashasvi Jaiswal at short leg is convinced but Shubman Gill decides against the review. There seemed to be a deflection and the ball passed close to the bat and the thigh pad. Short and around leg, Stokes misses out on the tickle and it is gathered well by Rishabh Pant to his right.
Slanting in, on the pads, Ben dabs it down on the leg side.
Fired in, full and around leg, clipped to mid-wicket by Jamie.
This is fuller, around leg, Smith knocks it back to Jadeja.
Slower through the air, on a nagging length, around leg, Smith pushes it back to the bowler.
Fuller and on middle, Smith defends it well.
Keeps it short and around leg, patted on the bounce to short leg by Smith.
Turn and bounce for Jadeja! Short and around leg, Jamie Smith is turned around in defence. Gets beaten on the outside edge and wears it on the back pad.
Pushed through, on middle, Ben Stokes leans ahead to block. The ball kicks up a bit to hit the upper half of the bat but Stokes manages to keep it down.
Slows it down a bit but the line is on the pads, Stokes misses out on the flick and wears it on the pads.
Sliding on with the arm, on middle, Ben goes right back to push it back to Sundar.
Drops it short, around off, Smith slaps it well but Ravindra Jadeja dives to his right at cover and makes a half-stop. Parries the ball away and the batters cross over for one.
A bit of away drift, on off, on a nagging length, Jamie Smith defends.
With a silly point in place, Sundar starts from around the wicket and sprays it down leg, on a nagging length, Stokes gets inside the line and glances it down to deep fine leg for a single.
Fuller and slower, around leg, Jamie Smith gets down on a knee and swings hard for the sweep but misses and gets hit high on the thigh pad.

Sharp turn! This lands well outside the line of the leg stump and spins towards the batter, on a nagging length, on middle, Smith plays the line but the ball goes past the outside edge and clips the back pad before going to slip.
Stays over the wicket for the right-hander and slows it down, on middle, Jamie Smith is watchful in defence.
A bit too full, on off, swept away to deep backward square leg for a single.
Fuller and quicker, around off, Stokes gets forward to defend. The ball lands on the rough and sneaks past the inside edge. Brushes the front pad on the way to the keeper.

FOUR! Swept hard and fine! Floated up, outside the off stump, Stokes plants his front foot across and manages to get on top of the bounce. Sweeps it fine of the man at deep backward square leg for a boundary.

On a back of a length, over off. This stays a bit low and arrives later than Stokes expected it to but he manages to get the pull away to the left of deep square leg. Ben wants to come back for the second run but Washington Sundar in the deep is quick to release the throw and keeps it to a single.
Honing in on the off stump, on a good length, Stokes is solid as a rock as he defends.
Attacking the stumps, on the fuller side, Stokes gets his bat out in front and knocks it back to Siraj.
Sprayed on the pads, Jamie works this length ball to deep square leg for a single.
On middle, on a good length, Jamie Smith waits on the back foot and plays it right under his eyes. Wrists it right between the two men in a catching position at mid-wicket and takes a couple of runs.
On a hard length, around off, Smith presses back and cracks it on the bounce to point.
FOUR BYES! This keeps low and does not turn much, outside off, on a length, Stokes lunges to smother the spin. The ball beats him on the outside edge and goes through the legs of Rishabh Pant.
On off, on a length, Ben Stokes gets right forward to block.
Slows it down and gets a bit of turn, on middle, on the fuller side, Smith defends a bit inside the line. The ball catches the outer half and rolls in front of point for one.
Keeps it short and around the pads, Jamie nudges it to mid-wicket.
Shorter and around leg, Smith tucks it off the back foot to mid-wicket.

FOUR! Nicely done! From over the wicket, targetting the footmarks outside the line of the leg stump for the right-hander. Jamie Smith gets down and sweeps it to the left of the man at short fine leg for a boundary.
Mohammed Siraj switches to over the wicket and hits a good length, on the off stump, Ben Stokes stays back and stabs it down on the off side.
Nails the yorker, does Siraj, around off, Stokes gets his bat down and jams it out to cover-point.

FOUR! Hit with real authority! Mohammed Siraj goes into the wicket again but fails to get it high enough this time. On off and this sits up to be hit. Ben Stokes stands tall and hammers it through mid-wicket for a boundary. The 50-run partnership is up between Stokes and Smith.
Wide! A well-directed bumper around the left shoulder by Siraj. Ben Stokes sways away. Wide called for height.
FOUR! Easy pickings! A bit too straight from Siraj from around the wicket, on a length, on the pads, Stokes tickles it fine of the man at deep fine leg for a boundary.
Hurls it on a back of a length, on off, punched to cover by Jamie. A fumble there by Washington Sundar allows a single and Siraj is not pleased one bit.
Seaming back in, on a good length, on off, Smith drives it to mid on.
Full and straight, on off, Stokes blocks it watchfully.
Short and on off, Stokes plays it back to Jadeja.
Short of full, on off, punched back to Jadeja.
BEATEN! Pitched outside off, spinning in off the rough, Ben Stokes gets low to sweep but misses and the ball passes below the inside edge to the keeper.

Now then! A chance created by Jadeja. Spin and bounce. Tough little period for Stokes! Landed around off, and turns across the batter on the leg stump. Ben Stokes hangs deep in the crease, and looks to work it across but gets it off the gloves and the ball dips in front of the leg gully fielder, where Gill, who is a bit deep, dives forward, and scoops it on the bounce.
Turns in from the rough, on a length, on off. Ben Stokes goes back in the crease and blocks.
Lands it on a good length, slanting in, on the off stump, Smith knocks it from the crease to cover.
Siraj goes slightly wide on the crease, on a back of a length, on off, Jamie Smith pats it back to the bowler.
Slightly fuller, on middle, Jamie Smith gets right behind it.
Attacking the off pole and this nips back in. Keeps a bit low as well but Jamie Smith adjusts to the low bounce and taps it down the deck with a straight bat.
On top of off, on a short of a length, Jamie Smith hangs back to defend.
Full and angling into the pads, Smith is beaten on the flick. Half a shout for LBW but that was always going down leg.
Spinning back in sharply, on middle, Ben Stokes is on the back foot and watchful as he keeps it out.
Pushed through, aiming the rough, full and outside off, Ben Stokes reaches out in front and goes hard on the sweep but misses.
Short and on the off stump, Smith backs away and cuts it to deep point for a single.
Flatter and shorter, on middle, Jamie Smith taps it back to Jadeja.
Even shorter this time, around leg, Smith goes deep in the crease and nudges it to the right of mid-wicket for a brace.
Sliding on, a bit too short, around leg, Jamie goes back and jabs it to mid-wicket.
FOUR! This is even better! Fuller by Siraj, outside off, Stokes leans into the drive and plays it all along the ground. Beats the diving cover fielder to his left and picks up four more.
FOUR! Fine shot! Not all that wide, on a back of a length, outside off, Ben Stokes arches back and gets on top of the ball to cut it to the right of backward point for a boundary.
Tighter line, on the off stump, on a length, Ben plays it back to Siraj with a straight bat.
Full and wide on off, Stokes frees his arms and drives it to cover.
Seaming back in, on a back of a length, Jamie Smith brings his bat out in front to defend. The ball dribbles off the inner half off to deep square leg for a single.
Shorter and outside off, Ben Stokes rocks back and dabs it down on the off side.
Wider on off and on the fuller side, Ben Stokes gets a good stride in to block it out. Gets beaten on the inside edge due to the turn. The ball lobs off the front pad to slip.
This keeps low and turns back sharply, on the off stump, Stokes manages to keep it out. Ekes out an inside edge onto the pads.
Turn and bounce! From over the wicket to the left-hander, this lands on the footmark outside the off stump and a puff of dust comes up. Stokes stays back and fends it down on the leg side.
Short and wide on off, Jamie slaps it to deep point and crosses over.
Time for spin from the other end as Ravindra Jadeja comes on. Begins from around the wicket and bowls it slow and full, on off, Smith gets forward and pats it on the bounce to silly point.
Siraj starts with a maiden! Outside off, on a good length, Ben is happy to let it go.
Bowled from wide of the crease, in the channel on off, on a good length. Ben Stokes shoulders arms. This keeps low and just about carries to Rishabh Pant.
Attacking the stumps and the length is pulled back, on middle, Ben Stokes pushes it to mid on.

Siraj switches to around the wicket and gets a bit of away shape, on the fuller side, outside off, Stokes walks across his stumps and gets closer to the line for the block. Gets it off the outer half to gully.
Pushed across, on a back of a length, left alone by Stokes.
Angled across from over the wicket, on a good length, keeps a bit low but Stokes manages to defend.
Down leg, full in length, Smith misses the flick shot and it goes behind to the keeper's left as Pant gathers it.
On middle, length-delivery. Smith taps it to the leg side.
FOUR! What a beautiful stroke that! Lands full and nips in from off, Jamie Smith gets on the top of the ball and drives it to the left of mid off for a cracking boundary.
Cannoned on the middle stump, just short of full. Jamie Smith watchfully defends it.
Nips back in from off, full, Smith brings the bat in front and blocks it out.
A yard behind fuller length, on off, Jamie Smith leans on and drives it confidently to the left of cover. Jadeja from there, chases the ball with a slide in the deep and the batters run for two.
An attempted yorker, on off, Ben Stokes manages to shovel it out to mid on.
Fuller and outside off, slightly overpitched and Stokes cracks the drive, but the man at cover dives to his right and makes a sharp stop.
The stumps are on attack again, full in length, flicked solidly by Stokes to short mid-wicket.
Touch full, cutting in from the crack, on off. Stokes forces it back to the bowler. Krishna collects the ball on the follow-through.

A bit too wayward onto the pads. Ben Stokes misses to nudge that across and the ball deflects off the thigh pad and runs behind to deep fine leg. The fielder there mops it up to his left and the batters get two leg byes.
Angled in, on off, on a length, Stokes punches it across to mid on.

Uppish, but safe! The crowd right behind Akash! Nip-backer on middle and leg with some extra bounce. Jamie Smith is a bit early on the shot and flicks it uppishly between mid on and mid-wicket and collects a brace.
Fuller and just outside off, Smith steers it off the outside half of the bat to the wide gully region.

BEATEN, AGAIN! This is serious interrogation from Akash Deep! He is consistent to hit the length, and lands it on the crack as the ball nips sharply into the batter and cuts Smith into half. Beats the inside edge and Rishabh Pant dives low to his left to grab the ball.
Angling into the batter, full in length, pushed to the right of the bowler.
Good length, on off, tapped out to point.

CUT IN HALF! How has that missed the edge or even the sticks? Lands it right on the crack from outside off and jags in a long, long way. Jamie Smith prods forward to push it straight but plays over the initial line and is beaten on the inside edge. The ball passes scarily close to the inside edge and, just whispers the stumps passing above them.

This stays a tad low! On a length, on middle and going across. Ben Stokes misses again to work that across and is beaten by the lack of bounce this time. The ball thuds on the pad and rolls to the gully region.
Little bit of shape away from off, Stokes taps it out to the point region.
Back of a length, jagging back a long way into the batter from off with some bounce. Ben Stokes looks to work it across, but misses and is rapped on the thigh pad.
Length, outside off, left alone.
Nagging length, outside off, Stokes shoulders arms at it.

Way too full and on middle, Ben Stokes drives with a straight bat and drills it down the ground. Siraj from mid on puts in a dive to his right but parries the ball to the deep, slowing it down. But, he ends up crashing into the heap of sawdust there. Gill from mid off, chases it before the ropes and keeps the batters to two. The 100 comes up for England.
FOUR! Helped away! A rare loosener from Akash as he slides this on the pads, Jamie Smith gets inside the line and tickles it to deep fine leg for a boundary.

OH, ALMOST PLAYED ON! Fuller ball, outside off, Ben Stokes is late to lift his bat up to leave, and the ball cuts in and takes the inside edge, but luckily for Stokes, it rolls past the stumps behind to short fine leg. A single taken.
Fired in fuller and on off, Stokes knocks it back to the bowler.
Length ball, on middle and leg, Smith steers it to deep square leg for a single.

Questions being asked! BEATEN! Into the corridor of uncertainty, back of a length and outside off. Jamie Smith has a casual poke at it without much foot movement and is beaten past the outside edge by a kitten-whisker.
Swings into the pads, on a fuller length, Smith pushes it to mid on.
On middle, angling in on a length, Ben Stokes tucks it straight to short mid-wicket.
Nagging length, around fourth and fifth stump. Stokes lets it be.
Lands around off and then straightens up with an extra bounce. Stokes hangs his bat in the air to leave.
Fractionally fuller, on off, Stokes leans ahead and defends it out to short cover.
Good length, on the stumps, blocked off the back foot.

NO BALL, FOUR! Too full from Prasidh, on the stumps, Ben Stokes flicks it away to deep square leg for a boundary. And it is the No Ball given for back foot as Krishna's back leg was cutting the return crease.
From around the wicket, served on a length, Stokes gets right behind it as he presses forward.
FOUR! Lovely shot to get off the mark! Fractionally short, on off, Jamie Smith stands tall, rides the bounce and punches it through covers for a boundary.
Delivers it on a nagging length, outside off, Smith tentatively hangs his bat out away from his body. Gets it off the outer half and it dribbles towards gully.
In the channel on off, on a good length, Smith shoulders arms.

OUT! LBW! Akash Deep gets his fourth and has fished out the big wicket of Brook! Hard length, pitching outside off, and cutting back in very sharply. Harry Brook is cut into half and is absolutely cramped up for space. Gets into a tangle as the ball beats him on the inside edge and thuds onto the back pad. A huge appeal for LBW and up goes the finger. That has taken Brook by total surprise, but he reviews it straightaway! UltraEdge shows a clear gap and Ball Tracking shows the ball to be clipping the top of middle on the umpire's call. England are 83/5, rocked early as Brook departs on 23 (31).
Harry Brook lbw A Deep 23 (31b 3x4 0x6)
On off, on a length, solidly defended by Brook.

Length ball, outside off, taking off from the pitch. Harry Brook plays it with soft hands dabs it to the right of the diving Nitish Kumar Reddy at gully. NKR gets a hand on the ball and parries it to Jadeja at backward point. Meanwhile, Brook is almost halfway through the single as Jadeja is a bit casual and fumbles to gather the ball. Brook gets sent back and has enough time to get back home.
Good length, gets that extra bounce again, outside off, Stokes leaves it watchfully.
Fired fuller and on off, Stokes leans on it and knocks it to short cover.
Length ball, on the stumps, tapped across to the leg side by Stokes.

Rushed! Krishna hits the good length, angling in from off, with some extra bounce. Ben Stokes is not allowed to get fully forward as he tries to adjust to the bounce and plays over the line and is hit on the back thigh pad.
Straighter and fuller, angling on off, from around the stumps. Stokes blocks it out with a straight bat.
Nice and full, on off, Stokes defends it on the front foot.
Touch fuller from Akash, on off, Ben Stokes flicks it to the left of mid-wicket and gets a single.
Good length, on off, blocked straight back.
Hard length, angling in and around off, Ben Stokes hangs back and taps it onto the surface.
Length-delivery, defended back to the bowler.

Stokes is away! Back of a length, angling in from around the stumps. Ben Stokes steers it away to deep backward square leg. Yashasvi Jaiswal runs to his right from deep fine leg to intercept, and he does, but while doing so, he slips on the ground and parries the ball behind him. But recovers well by getting up and preventing it from going to the ropes. Two taken.

OUT! PLAYED ON! BOWLED! Ollie Pope will feel a bit unlucky here, but India get the breakthrough! That extra bounce does the trick for Akash. He continues to hit the deck hard, on top of the middle. It lifts off the deck and surprises Pope who brings his bat in front to defend. But the ball nips in, grazes the back arm of the batter and rolls back into the stumps behind. Akash Deep is ecstatic as he gets his third wicket, and so are India. England are 80/4.
Ollie Pope b A Deep 24 (50b 3x4 0x6)
Short of a length, climbing onto the batter. Harry Brook rises on the toes and dabs it in front of short cover.
FOUR! Put away! Width on offer from Krishna, on a good length. Harry Brook hangs back in the crease and plays the square cut. Gets a boundary at deep backward point.
Fuller and on off, pushed back to the bowler.

Whoa! That just took off, but adjusted well by Brook! Hard length, lifting off the deck suddenly, on off, Harry Brook is flummoxed with the extra bounce but takes the bottom hand off the bat to dab it down. Gets it off the outside edge and the ball goes past the right of the gully fielder for a couple of runs.
Attacks off stump, on a length, Brook keeps it out to short cover.
Nagging length, on middle, Harry defends it solidly.
Strayed onto the pads, on a good length. Harry Brook nudges it to deep backward square leg for a single. Not much happening in terms of movement.
Hard length, on top of off, Harry Brook blocks it back to the bowler.
Aims the sticks, good length, angling into the batter. Harry Brook meets the ball under his eyes and blocks it off.
Just tails in a touch, on middle, Harry Brook flicks it to mid-wicket.
On off, on a length, Brook lets it arrive and dabs it with soft hands to the off side.
Starts with a fuller delivery, does Akash, outside off, Harry Brook mistimes the drive to the cover region.
Attacks the stumps, full in length, Ollie Pope forces the drive to mid off.
Short delivery, outside off, Pope does not go fishing at it.
This one nips away from off, on the shortish length. Ollie Pope gets behind the line and knocks it to the off side.
Makes the batter play at it, length-delivery, on off, Ollie Pope leans on and defends it off the outer half of the bat to the gully region.
No swing! Goes straight on a length, just outside off. Ollie Pope offers no shot at it.
Back of a length, around off, Brook taps it out to the point region for a quick single. First run of Day 5.

An inswinger on the pads, Ollie Pope flicks this full ball to deep square leg. Washington Sundar from deep fine leg runs across to his left and mops it up. The batters hurry back for the second run. And that will be STUMPS ON DAY 4!
Drifts it way down leg, does Akash, on a length. Harry Brook whips it behind square on the leg side for a single.
Touch fuller and on middle and leg, Harry Brook clips it along the ground, to the right of mid-wicket for a couple of runs.
FOUR! Easily done! Onto the pads, on a length, Harry Brook gets across and guides it with the pace to deep fine leg for a boundary.
Good length, angling into the batter, blocked straight back.

FOUR! Just wide of mid-wicket! Wasn't timed that well from Brook! Hands on heads for Gill! Angling onto the leg stump, full in length. Harry Brook clips it uppishly and to the right of the diving Mohammed Siraj at mid-wicket. Siraj dives full-stretch as he flings himself towards the ball, but it is just too wide of him and races away to the fence.
Fuller and around off, Ollie Pope takes a giant stride ahead to block it out.

A shout for LBW from Siraj, but not entertained by the umpire. Probably an inside edge. Back of a length, deviating into the batter off the pitch. Ollie Pope tries to block it forward but gets an inside edge onto the front pad.
Watchful leave! In-between length, around the fourth and fifth stump line, Ollie Pope shoulders arms.
Good-length delivery, outside off, Ollie Pope hangs back and cuts it straight to Ravindra Jadeja at backward point.
Nagging length, on middle, worked to square leg.
Back of a length, cutting back in, Ollie Pope blocks it off the inside half of the bat to the leg side.
Quite full and around off, Ollie Pope strides ahead and drives it wide of mid off for a quick single.
Pitched outside off, on a short of a good length, Ollie Pope covers the off stump and leaves.
Nagging length, on middle and leg, steered to mid-wicket.
Hits the fuller length, on off, nipping in a shade. Ollie Pope gets half-forward to defend, but gets an inside edge onto the front pad as the ball rolls on the pitch.
BEATEN! A jaffa from Krishna! Bowls around off, inviting the batter to draw his front foot out. The ball angles in and then straightens up the pitch, beaten Pope's outside edge.
Curves into the batter, on the leg stump, Ollie Pope flicks the length ball to short mid-wicket.
Full and attacking the stumps, Harry Brook prods forward and keeps it out.
Back of a length, drifting back in, Harry Brook blocks it off the back foot.
Jags back in from off, on a good length. Brook covers the line and dabs it to the leg side, beside the pitch.
Full and in front of the sticks. Brook pushes it to the right of the bowler.
Hard length, outside off, punched to the cover-point region. A fumble there allows the batters to skate off for the second run.
On off, full, straightening up. Harry Brook is squared up and manages to keep it out.
That hurried him! A sharp nip-backer from off, on a length. Ollie Pope is rushed into the shot and is cramped up for space. Wears it on the thigh pad and the ball rolls behind.
Good length, on the stumps, punched across to mid on.

INSIDE EDGE, FOUR! Almost played on! Back of a length, jagging back off the surface. Ollie Pope leans forward to block, but the ball takes the inside edge and deflects off the back pad before racing down to deep fine leg for a boundary.
Good-length delivery, around off, Ollie Pope taps it out to backward point.
Nice and full, on off, Pope blocks it to short cover.
Nagging length, outside off, Pope leaves it alone.

Short of a good length, outside off, Harry Brook punches it on the rise to deep point. Ravindra Jadeja from backward point chases the ball before the ropes with a slide. The batters hare back for the second in the meantime.
A well-directed bouncer on the leg stump, Harry Brook gets inside the line and ducks under it.
Fuller and straighter, on off, Harry Brook gets on top of the ball to block.
Wider angle, full and on the stumps, Harry Brook presses forward blocks it off.

OUT! OUTFOXED! BOWLED'EM! Totally unplayable seed from Akash and he gets a big fish, Joe Root! A cold celebration from the seamer as England lose their third wicket! Fires this too full, sliding on middle. It lands and straightens up a touch. Joe Root plays for the initial line to work across but the ball cuts away from him and beats the outside edge before making a total mess of the sticks behind. Joe Root departs for 6 (16) and England are 50/3.
Joe Root b A Deep 6 (16b 1x4 0x6)
Good length, on off, angling in. Worked to mid off.

Good length, outside off, jagging back in off the deck. Pope plays a loose shot to cut it square and the ball grazes the inside edge and travels flat and dips on its way to the keeper. Pant bends low to scoop the ball from the ground and is unsure whether it bumped before entering his mitts. The onfield umpires send it upstairs. The slow-motion replay shows that it has indeed bumped on the ground before tucking into the gloves.
Speared fuller and on off, pushed to the left of mid on.
Length-delivery, on off, Pope goes for the square cut but chops it behind the stumps.

Another convincing appeal for LBW, but the umpire remains unmoved yet another time. Rishabh Pant assisted in taking the review and Shubman Gill signals for it. This is on a good length, sliding onto the leg stump line, Joe Root gets across on the crease to work it into the leg side but misses to lay the bat on it. The ball passes close to the inside edge and raps on the front pad. UltraEdge shows a flat line, but the Ball Tracking shows that the ball is going past the leg stump on the projection. A leg bye is taken as the ball rolls off the pad to the square leg region. Another piece of brilliant umpiring as India lose another review. They have only one remaining now. The 50 is up for England.
Length-delivery, outside off, cut behind square on the off side for a single.
Prasidh Krishna is into the attack now. Lands it on a back of a length and outside off, dabbed to the point region.
Nagging length, on off, Joe Root leans on it and blocks it off solidly.
Bowled from a wider angle again, around off on a length, Root defends it out from the crease.

A huge appeal for LBW, but the umpire does not entertain it! Looked a bit high on the bounce to the naked eye. A bit of a chatter between Gill and Akash, but they do not opt for a review this time. Akash Deep bowls it from a wider angle and lands it on a good length, angling into the batter. It lands and nips further into the batter. Joe Root is trapped in front to block and plays over the line, but misses on the inside edge and the ball raps high on the front pad. Ball Tracking later shows that the ball is indeed passing over the leg stump on the projection.
Touch full and on the stumps, Ollie Pope prods forward and steers it to backward point for a single. Quick tap and run!
Shoots it on the back of a length, on off, Ollie Pope opens up and knocks it onto the pitch.
Short of a length, outside off, Pope rises with the bounce and cuts it to the fielder at backward point.
On the stumps, good length, Root meets the ball under his eyes to block it back to the bowler.
Angles on top of middle, on a length, Root gets behind the ball and tucks it to short mid-wicket.
Shapes away from outside off, Root lets it be.
FOUR! Guides it away with ease! Siraj slides this down leg, full in length, Joe Root uses his wrists to work it towards deep fine leg for a boundary.
Nips away from off, on a length. Root rises on the toes and guides it straight to backward point.
A gentle outswinger, but outside off, Root leaves.
FOUR! Helped away! Angled onto the pads, on a length. Ollie Pope gets inside the line and tickles it away to the fence at deep fine leg for a boundary.
Length ball, and on off, blocked off to cover.
Good length, angling in, Ollie Pope looks to work across the line and gets an inside edge onto the thigh pad.

EDGED, FOUR! Full and on off, straightening up a fraction. Ollie Pope looks to flick it to the leg side, but the leading edge is found and the ball shoots past the right of the diving gully fielder for a boundary.
Hard length, skidding through the surface on off, Pope is squared up and stabs on the pitch. Again, the bottom hand comes off the bat.
Speared fuller and outside off, Ollie Pope drives it through covers. One hand comes off the bat, but he controls it along the turf and in the gap. Two taken.
This one nips away from off, on a length, Ollie Pope gets on the back foot and knocks it to cover-point for a quick single.
Good delivery! Shapes away from off, on a good length. Ollie Pope looks to play at it, but decides to hang his bat in the air to leave.
Keeps the line of attack outside off, on a length. Pope offers no shot as the ball nibbles away.
On top of off, on the good length, Joe Root waits for the ball to come at him and punches it through covers for a single.
A bit of a tail back into the batter, full and on middle. Joe Root forces the drive to mid off.
Shapes in around off and then straightens off the deck, on a length. Root watchfully leaves by shouldering arms at it.

An absolute whisperer! Bowls from a wider angle, on a good length, just around the fourth stump. Ollie Pope finds himself in a very awkward position to block that from the pitch. Plays inside the line and the ball misses the outside edge by a kitten-whisker. What a probing opening spell this has been from Akash Deep.
Some extra bounce there for Akash as he hits the deck hard, around off. Ollie Pope watchfully dabs it to the backward point region.
Root is off the mark! Back of a length, on the pads, an easy tuck away to deep backward square leg for a single.

OUT! KNOCKED HIM OVER! Absolute beauty from Akash Deep! India all over England now! Runs full tilt from around the stumps, cannons it on the off stump line. The ball kisses the surface and arrives a lot quicker with the skid than Duckett anticipates and also cuts in a touch. The southpaw tries to play it from the crease, but is a bit late to bring his bat down to block and an inside edge is found. The ball then smashes behind into the stumps. Ben Duckett departs for a quickfire 25 (15) and England are 30/2.
Ben Duckett b A Deep 25 (15b 5x4 0x6)

FOUR! Through the gap! Lovely piece of timing by Duckett! Width on offer, outside off, length ball. Enough time and space to work with for Ben as he stays back and punches it through backward point for a boundary.
Cannoned on the middle stump, full in length, Duckett knocks it across to mid on.
Back of a length, on off, punched behind backward point for a single.

FOUR MORE! Two in two for Duckett! And that's deliberately played! Around the stumps, length, around off. Ben Duckett opens the bat face and steers it between the third slip and the gully fielders. Nitish Kumar Reddy at gully is a bit late to react as he gets low, sticks out his right hand. Goes one-handed to grab the ball, but it evades him and races behind to the deep third fence.
FOUR! Smashed away! Plenty of width outside off, on a length. Ben Duckett throws the kitchen-sink at it and slashes it over backward point for a boundary on the bounce.
Pitches on middle and nibbles away, Ben opens the bat face late and glides it to gully.
Too full and outside off, Ben Duckett drills it straight to short cover.
Angled across off, on a length, Duckett cuts it straight to point.

Siraj fires it full and across off, Ben Duckett plants his front foot out to smash it down the ground, but ends up bumping it back to the bowler. Uh, oh! Siraj has overstepped here and it is a No Ball.
Slides it down leg on a length, Ollie Pope works it behind square on the leg side for a couple of runs. End of an eventful over.
Back of a length, outside off, Ollie Pope dabs it off the back foot to backward point.
Fuller than a good length, outside off, Ollie Pope pushes it to cover.
Good length and outside the off stump with a slight shape away. Pope with a waft at it but gets beaten on the outside edge.
Back of a length, angling on middle and leg, steered to deep backward square leg for a single.

A loud confident celebrappeal from the Indians in unison, but the umpire's finger stays down! All the Indians converge and Shubman Gill instantly signals the 'T' for a review for caught behind. Ben Duckett is going nowhere, but the Indians are very convinced. Akash Deep bashes the ball on a hard length, around off and gets it to nip away from the deck. Ben Duckett tries to flick it across. but without much foot movement as he plays it from the crease. The ball passes close to the outside edge and Rishabh Pant does the rest behind the stumps. And a fantastic decision as the UltraEdge shows no bat but it clipped the back pad on the way to the keeper, which resulted in the noise and the deflection. India lose a review, but that was a snorter from Akash.
Moving away in the air, on a length, Ollie Pope transfers the weight on the front foot and eases it through covers. Collects a couple of runs to get off the mark.
Jagging back in, on off, on a back of a length, Ollie stays back and tucks it to mid-wicket.

OUT! TAKEN! 'Catch it' is the cry and Sai Sudharsan answers the call! Zak Crawley goes for a 7-ball duck. Shaping away from the right-hander, on a length, Zak Crawley does not quite get forward and just goes for the drive with his hands. Gets a thickish outside edge that goes low and straight into the waiting hands of Sai at backward point. Sudharsan stays low to snaffle it.
Zak Crawley c sub Sai Sudharsan b Mohammed Siraj 0 (7b 0x4 0x6)

More runs! This nips back in a bit, on off, on a good length, Ben Duckett waits back and punches it through cover-point. Sai Sudharsan goes after it and tumbles in the direction of the ropes to pull the ball in. Three runs taken.
FOUR! Easy pickings! Full and on the pads, Ben Duckett brings his wrists into play and clips it to the right of deep fine leg for four more.

FOUR! Ben Duckett is away and off the pair! From over the wicket, on a back of a length, over off, Duckett gets on top of the bounce and steers it with an open bat face to the right of the diving backward point fielder for a boundary. Siraj is not pleased one bit with the effort of Sai Sudharsan, who is on the park as a substitute.

Ouch! On a nagging length, on off, Zak Crawley looks to get behind the line of the ball. Gets beaten on the inside edge as the ball jags back in and kicks up a bit to catch him on the box. Crawley is down on his haunches. Deep starts with a maiden!
Swinging away, on a good length, in the corridor of off, Crawley presses forward for the block. Gets it off the outer half to backward point.
On the fuller side, just outside off, this nips back in a bit but Zak Crawley has his off stump covered whilst making the leave.
Makes the batter play this time, on a good length, around the sixth stump, Zak defends it out with a straight bat.
Brings the line closer to the off stump, shaping away, on a good length, left alone by Zak.
Deep charges in from over the wicket and lands the first one short and wide on off, Zak Crawley gets closer to the line and shoulders arms.
On off, on a length, Jadeja pushes it in front of cover and calls Sundar through for a quick single.
Lands it full, outside off, Sundar goes for the drive. Gets it off the outer half to deep third for one.
Short and well outside off, RJ reaches out and slaps it to deep point for one.
Floated up, full and on off, driven to cover.
On off, Sundar runs it down to deep third for a single.
Full and around leg, Jadeja turns it behind square on the leg side for a run.

FOUR! Gets it away this time! More loop on this one, full and outside off, Washington Sundar holds his shape this time and lofts it over cover for a boundary. India's lead goes past 600. They lead by 602.
Looped up, full and wide on off, Sundar swings a bit too hard and almost swings himself off his feet. Gets an inside edge onto the pads.
Drifting in, fuller and on middle, played back to Root.
SIX! Fine shot! Tossed up, full and on off, Sundar backs away and opens up the front hip. Goes inside out over cover for a flat six.
Looped up, full and on off, Sundar pats it back to Root.

OUT! TAKEN! Nitish Kumar Reddy holes out! By the looks of it, India will continue to bat. Floated up, full and wide on off, Reddy gets low and reaches out to go over long off. Neither does he get the distance nor the elevation. Hits it only as far as long off where Zak Crawley takes a couple of steps forward and dives forward to take a safe catch. Nitish Kumar Reddy comes and goes for 1 (2). India are 412/6, leading by 592 runs.
Nitish Kumar Reddy c Z Crawley b J Root 1 (2b 0x4 0x6)
Flat and short, on middle, Nitish switches his stance and plays the reverse to the right of backward point for a single.

OUT! GONE! CAUGHT! Finally, England get rid of Shubman Gill! Shoaib Bashir loops it up and drops it on a length. It lands and spins in sharply around off with some extra bounce on it. Shubman Gill goes back and across to work it across, but closes the bat face a bit too early and a leading edge is found. The ball lobs up in the air and in front of covers. Shoaib Bashir runs forward-left to take the catch. A warm reception for the Indian skipper from the entire Edgbaston crowd as he makes a slow walk back to the dressing room after scoring 161 (162). A few English players walk towards Gill and congratulate him for his marathon innings. India are 411/5 down, leading by 591 runs.
Shubman Gill (c) c&b S Bashir 161 (162b 13x4 8x6)
Shortish delivery, spinning from outside leg, Ravindra Jadeja hangs back and punches it wide of mid-wicket for a single.
Length, outside off, Shubman Gill slaps it past covers for a single.
SIX! KABOOM! Drops a half volley, on off, Shubman Gill shimmies down the track and sends it sailing behind deep mid-wicket for a six.
Full and wide on off, blocked off by Gill.
Down leg, on a length. Jadeja lets it be.
Full and around leg, Jadeja works it to square leg.
NO BALL for overstepping! Well down leg, Shubman Gill lets it be. Jamie Smith fails to gather it and concedes a bye.

FOUR! WHAT HAPPENED THERE? Floated up, around leg, Shubman Gill gets down on a knee for the slog sweep but top edges it high towards deep backward square leg. Ollie Pope runs in off the ropes and loses the ball in the sun. The ball drops wide of him and goes behind for a boundary.

SIX! Hit with real authority and that brings up 150 for SHUBMAN GILL! Ravi Shastri informs on air that Gill is the FIRST batter to score a double hundred and 150 in the same Test. Pushed through, in the slot, on middle, Gill gets down on a knee and clobbers it over deep mid-wicket for a six.
Leg bye! Slower and on the pads, RJ lunges to clip it away. The ball goes off the pads in front of short fine leg for one.
FOUR! Up and over! Full and around leg from over the wicket, Jadeja backs away and carves it over wide mid off for a boundary. India lead by 570!
Full and on the off stump, Jadeja knocks it in the vacant cover region for a single.
Around leg, flatter, Ravindra Jadeja misses out on the lap and the ball goes off the pads to short fine leg.
Full and around leg, Ravindra Jadeja clips it to mid-wicket.
Directed at the pads, on a nagging length, Gill works it in front of square on the leg side for one more.
On the pads, quicker and fuller, turned away through mid-wicket for a run.
Turning away, on a length, Jadeja sweeps it straight to square leg.
Full and wide on off, RJ frees his arms and drills it to long off for a single.
Turning away from the rough, outside off, Ravindra Jadeja shoulders arms.
Full and on off, RJ pushes it to cover.
Short and around leg, Gill jabs it to deep square leg for a single.
SIX! Two in two for the Indian skipper! Slower and fuller, around leg, Gill gets down on a knee and slog sweeps it behind square on the leg side for six more. India's lead is now 561!
SIX! All the way! Sliding across, on middle, Shubman Gill gets down and nails the slog sweep over the leaping deep mid-wicket fielder for a six. India's lead goes past 550!
Sprayed down leg, Ravindra Jadeja makes the leave. Jadeja thinks it should have been a wide for bowling a negative line but the umpire does not think so.
Leg bye! Tossed up, turning into the right-hander, outside off, Gill shuffles across for the reverse but fails to lay any bat on it. A leg bye is taken as the ball goes off the pads on the leg side.
Angled across, Jadeja works this full ball to long off and gets to the other end.
Flatter and fuller, on middle, Jadeja skips down and drops it beside the pitch on the leg side.
Around leg, on the shorter side, paddled to short fine leg.
Tossed up, on middle, Ravindra Jadeja steps out and ends up getting too close to the ball. Pushes it back to the bowler.
Tossed up, around leg, Shubman Gill sweeps but picks out the man at short fine leg.
Full and on leg, clipped to mid-wicket by Gill.
Full and on off, knocked down to long off for a single.
FOUR MORE! Sliding down leg, short in length, Ravindra Jadeja gets inside the line and helps it away towards the fine leg fence.

FOUR! Gets it through and that will bring up FIFTY for Ravindra Jadeja! His second of the game and he will have an even more important role to play later with the ball. Pushed through, short and on off, Jadeja presses back and cuts it to the left of backward point for a boundary. Brings out the signature sword celebration.
On off, on the fuller side, Jadeja stabs it down on the off side.
Very full and straight, at the stumps, Jadeja sweeps it in front of square leg for one.
FOUR! Easily done! Shorter and quicker, wide on off, Ravindra Jadeja reaches out and dabs it to the right of short third for a boundary.
Lands it full, on off, Jadeja checks the drive to cover.
Keeps it full, on off, swept through square leg for a run by Shubman.
Offers flight, fuller and slower, outside off, Jadeja drags the sweep to deep square leg for one.
On off, on a length, Jadeja drops it in front of mid-wicket and wants to sneak in a single, but Gill sends him back.
Darted in with the arm, closer to the off stump, Jadeja chops it down in front of short third for one.
Turning away, flatter and shorter, outside off, left alone by RJ.
Pushed through, on middle, Gill clips it wide of mid-wicket for a single. India's 350 is up and the lead is 530!
Turning down leg, Gill lets it be.
Floated fuller and just outside off, Jadeja leans on and drives it with the spin, and through covers for a single.
Joe Root is back on. Full and outside leg, Shubman Gill goes for the sweep, but top edges it and the ball dribbles to the right of short fine leg fielder. One taken.

Bye! Looped up, looked like the carrom ball from Bashir, outside off, Gill goes for the reverse but misses out. The keeper, Jamie Smith fails to gather it cleanly and the ball deflects off the gloves to his right, allowing a bye.
Short and around off, Jadeja cuts it late towards backward point where a fumble from Josh Tongue allows a single.

Dropped short, on off, Ravindra Jadeja rocks back and pulls it to the right of deep square leg. Chris Woakes moves to his right and pushes the ball away from the fence. The converging deep mid-wicket fielder mops it up. Two runs taken.
Tossed up, on off, Gill presses forward and pushes it to the left of cover for a single.
Slower and shorter, outside off, Jadeja cuts it to deep point and crosses over.
Nicely tossed up, turning away, on off, Ravindra Jadeja reaches out in front for the sweep but misses.
On a back of a length, on off, slapped to deep cover for a run.
Off-cutter from Woakes, outside off, on a short of a length, Ravindra Jadeja looks to flay it away but the ball shoots a bit off the deck to go over the bat.
Slower bumper, on off, Shubman Gill rides the bounce and pulls it in front of square for a run.
Floaty delivery, full and on middle, Jadeja knocks it to the right of mid on for a single.
Just outside off, on a back of a length, Ravindra Jadeja backs away and cuts it straight to backward point.
This is on a short of a good length, Gill advances down the track and punches it in front of extra cover for a single.
Slower through the air, going down leg with the angle. Jadeja plays the paddle, but Harry Brook at slip anticipates early and moves to his right to cut it off.
Shorter and on off, Ravindra Jadeja chops it down to backward point.
Looped up and bowled wider on off, Shubman Gill drags the sweep towards deep mid-wicket for a single.
Full and on off, Shubman wrists it to mid-wicket.

FOUR! In the gap! Dragged down by Bashir, on the shorter side, on middle, Gill waits back and gets low to pull it right between deep mid-wicket and deep square leg for a boundary. The partnership between Gill and Jadeja is 100 runs now.
Full and on off, Ravindra Jadeja plants his front foot across and sweeps it to deep backward square leg for one.

Good running! Woakes takes pace off, on a back of a length, on off, Shubman Gill lets the ball come to him and taps it with soft hands in the vacant point region. By the time Joe Root comes charging in from the deep and releases the throw, the batters run two. 18 runs off the over and India now lead by 511.
Woakes nails the yorker from around the wicket, outside off, Jadeja gets his bat down to jam it out in front of point for one.
Pace on, on a hard length, on middle, Shubman Gill gets inside the line and tucks it to deep square leg for a single.
FOUR! Carved away! Pace taken off by Woakes, on a back of a length, on middle, Shubman backs away and slaps it to the right of deep point for four more.
FOUR! India's lead goes past 500! On a back of a length by Woakes, on off, Gill plays it a bit in front of his body. Jabs it to the right of the man at deep mid-wicket for a boundary.
SIX! Clobbered! Woakes lands it on a nagging length, on middle, Shubman dances down the track and tonks it towards the sight screen for a six. The lead is now 499!
Darted in, on middle, Ravindra Jadeja gets forward to defend.

Looped up, full and outside off, Shubman Gill brings out the reverse and hits it towards short third where Chris Woakes tumbles to his left to make the stop. The ball deflects off his body and the batters cross over.
Shorter and around leg, Jadeja turns it wide of backward square leg for a run.
Fuller and on off, RJ pushes it off the front foot to cover.
SIX! Excellent use of the feet! Floated up from around the wicket, on a length, on middle, Jadeja skips down the track and thumps it back over the bowler's head for a six.
Tossed up from over the wicket, around off, Gill drives this full ball to long on for a single.
Sliding on with the arm from around the wicket, attacking the stumps, Ravindra Jadeja defends with his bat close to the front pad. That will be TEA on Day 4!
Spinning away, outside off, on a length, Ravindra Jadeja leaves the ball alone.
Bowled outside off, on a length, left alone by RJ.
Arm ball, outside off, darted away. Left alone.
This turns away sharply off the rough outside the off stump, Ravindra Jadeja lets it go.
Pushed through, outside off, Jadeja lets it be.
Floated up, on off, solidly blocked out by Shubman.
Full and on the pads, Jadeja works it off the pads through square leg for a single.
Fuller and on off, Jadeja defends it off the front foot.

HUNDRED FOR SHUBMAN GILL! A dreamy start to Gill's tenure as India's Test captain. Shubman becomes the first batter to score a double hundred and a hundred in the same Test against England. Short and on off, Gill gets back and works it to the left of mid-wicket for a single. Takes the helmet off and soaks in all the applause from the teammates and the crowd. Shubman is the second Indian after Sunil Gavaskar to achieve this feat of scoring a double hundred and a hundred in the same game in Test cricket.
Shorter and on off, Gill presses back to jab it to mid-wicket.
Outside off, on a length, punched to cover.
Around leg, on the shorter side, Ravindra Jadeja works it to backward square leg.
On off, stabbed down on the off side by Ravindra.
This is pushed through from wide of the crease. Outside off, lands on the rough and it kicks up a bit and turns sharply as well. Left alone by RJ.
Serves it full, on off, Gill eases it down to long on for a single to move to 99.
Tossed up, on the pads, Gill looks to sweep it fine but picks out Harry Brook at leg slip. Brook collects it on the bounce.
Full and wide on off, driven away to deep cover for a single.
On off, on a length, Gill plants his front foot across and clips it to mid-wicket.
On the pads, Jadeja works this full ball to the right of backward square leg. 300 up for India and the lead is now 480!
This is bowled quicker, at the stumps, Jadeja defends.
Turning away, slower and outside off, left alone by RJ.
Slows it down and drops it short. The turn takes it further away from Jadeja who cuts it straight to cover.
Full and attacking the front pad, Jadeja gets his bat out in front to block.
Low full toss, on the pads, Jadeja whips it to deep mid-wicket for one more.
Shorter and around leg, Gill waits back to flick it past square leg for a single.
Slower through the air, around off, Shubman Gill gets forward to block this full ball.
Goes full, on off, Gill plays it back to Root.
Sliding on with the arm, full and at the stumps, Jadeja taps it in front of mid on and takes a quick single.
Pitched up, on off, RJ drives it to mid off.
Angled in at the hips, on a nagging length, turned away to backward square leg for a run.
FOUR! Punished! Short and wide on off, asking to be hit, Ravindra Jadeja presses back and cuts it between cover and point for a boundary.
Very full, on middle, knocked down the deck.
Fired in, on off, Jadeja pushes it to cover.
Drags the length back, on off, Jadeja gets on the back foot and nudges it to the left of deep mid-wicket for a couple of runs. Gill had to hurry there for the second run.
Looped up, full and on middle, Ravindra Jadeja blocks it out.
Drifting away, around off, Shubman Gill gets forward to block.

Turning in, on off, on the shorter side, Shubman Gill rocks back and cuts it to the left of deep cover. Zak Crawley swoops in, picks it up cleanly and fires it on the bounce at the batting end. A slightly wayward throw allows Gill to complete a tight second run.
Very full and quicker, on off, Jadeja taps it in front of mid off and gets to the other end quickly.
Full and wide on off, Shubman Gill gets a stride in and knocks it to deep cover for a single. Moves to 95!
FOUR! Nicely done! Root keeps it full and on off, Gill plants his front foot across and sweeps it over backward square leg for a boundary.
Full and on off, Gill lunges to defend.
On off, on a nagging length, Ravindra Jadeja defends.
Pushed through, on off, Jadeja blocks it out.
Shorter and wider on off, Jadeja lets it be.
Fuller and on off, Jadeja pats it down the deck.
Turning away, on a good length, Ravindra Jadeja leaves it alone.
Slow and full, around off, Jadeja guides it towards backward point.
On a shortish length, over middle, Jadeja rises with the bounce and drops it on the leg side for one.
On a back of a length, outside off, RJ stands tall and punches it to the left of cover where Chris Woakes fumbles but it is backed up by the mid off fielder.
This stays a tad low, on a nagging length, on the off stump, Gill pushes it in front of cover for one.
On off, on a good length, Shubman opens the bat face and steers it to the right of deep backward point for another couple of runs.

From around the wicket, around middle and leg, Shubman Gill stays leg side of the ball and charges down the track to go back over the bowler's head. Gets it off the toe end but manages to evade the back-tracking mid off fielder for a couple.
Short and wide on off, Ravindra Jadeja hops and slaps it to deep point for a single.
Even slower and keeps it full, on off, Shubman Gill gets right behind it.
Looped up, outside off, Gill smothers the spin.
Darted in, short and around leg, RJ tucks it towards backward square leg for a single.

First hint of aggression from Jadeja! Tossed up from around the wicket, on a length, Ravindra Jadeja skips down the track and does not manage to get to the pitch of the ball. Ends up dragging it to the left of the diving mid-wicket fielder for a couple.
Fuller and on off, Gill drives it down to long on for a single.
Flat and short, on off, Shubman Gill defends it off the front foot.
On middle, Ravindra Jadeja punches it in front of mid on and Gill is keen for a single but Jadeja sends him back.
Banged in short from around the wicket, over off, Ravindra Jadeja sways away.
On a good length, on the off stump, Ravindra Jadeja gets on top of the bounce and chops it down.
Around leg again, on a back of a length, Shubman Gill swings for the pull but cannot get his hands through completely. Mistimes it towards fine leg for one. India's lead is now 450!
Around leg, on a nagging length, turned to square leg.

Stokes comes from around the wicket and bowls it down leg, on a back of a length, Gill lets it be. Looks at the umpire and asks for a wide for Stokes bowling a negative line but there is no signal from the umpire.
Fuller and quicker, on off, whipped to mid on.
Slows it down and keeps it full, on middle, Ravindra Jadeja stabs it down.
A bit quicker but the length stays full, on the off stump, Ravindra Jadeja blocks.
Continues to give the ball air, on a length, on leg, defended by Jadeja.
Gives the ball a bit of air and it is full and wide on off, driven to deep cover for a single by Gill.
Angled in, short and on middle, Jadeja works it in front of mid-wicket and gets to the other end quickly.
Dug in short by Stokes, over middle, Shubman Gill ducks under it.
Attacking the stumps from a bit wide on the crease, on a length, Shubman taps it back to Stokes.
Good running! On a back of a length, on off, Gill pushes it in the vacant deep point region and comes charging back for the second run.
Sliding down leg, on a nagging length, Shubman Gill shoulders arms.
On a hard length, on off, Ravindra Jadeja rides the bounce and nudges it in front of square on the leg side for one.
In the channel on off, on a good length, Ravindra Jadeja leaves the ball alone.

Loopy delivery, just outside the off stump, Shubman Gill gets forward for the block but fails to get to the pitch of the ball. The ball turns past the inside edge to hit the front pad outside the line of the off stump.
On off, this keeps straight, Gill blocks it out.
Wide! Floated up but well wide on off, Gill lets it be.
Fuller in length, outside off, Shubman Gill lunges to smother the spin.
Sliding on with the arm, on the pads, flicked past mid-wicket for a single.
Pushed through, fuller and on middle, RJ gets a stride in to defend.
Short and on off, Jadeja presses back and tucks it to square leg.
Angled in at the hips, Shubman Gill wrists it to square leg.
On the off stump, on a good length, Gill is a bit hurried but manages to keep it out with a straight bat.
Sprayed down leg, Gill lets it go.
Slanting in at the hips, on a back of a length, Shubman Gill turns it to square leg.
On off, on a short of a length, Shubman gets right behind it.
On a back of a length, around leg, Gill nudges it to mid-wicket.
Pushed through, on off, Gill knocks it down to long on for a single. 13 runs off the over!
The length is pulled back and it is slower, outside off, Gill cuts it late to the left of deep point for a couple of runs.

SIX! It seems Shubman Gill has had enough of blocking against Shoaib Bashir! Bashir offers flight, on a length, on middle, the Indian skipper skips down the track and heaves it with the turn over deep mid-wicket for a six.
Drags the length back, on off, Shubman Gill gets his bat out in front to defend.
FOUR! BANG! Tossed up again, wider on off, Shumban charges down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and thumps it to the right of mid off for a boundary.
Floated up, full and around off, Gill lunges to block it out.
Speared in fuller and on off, Ravindra Jadeja prods forward and pushes it to mid on.
Length-delivery, outside off, Jadeja leaves.
With a leg slip in place, and a crowded leg side field, Stokes goes short and angles it onto the leg stump. Shubman Gill gets on the back foot and works it to deep square leg for a single.
Oh, almost chopped on! Fuller delivery and outside off, Shubman Gill attempts to cut away, but ends up chopping it off the inside edge and the ball dribbles behind to the keeper.
Length, outside off, guided away to deep third for a single.
Ben Stokes (2-0-12-0) returns to the attack. Hits the hard length, on top of off, Shubman Gill rises on the toes and steers it to deep backward point for a single.
