Leg slip in place. 'Round the wickets, full and outside off, tapped out by Jadeja.
Shortens the length, does Shoaib, on off, Shubman Gill punches it across and down to long on for a single.
Fuller and straighter on off, Gill strides out to block.
Length ball, on middle, steered to backward square leg.
Nicely tossed up, full and on off, Shubman Gill leans ahead and gently pushes it to the left of the bowler. The fielder from wide mid off cuts it off to his right.
Full, outside off, driven straight to mid off.
Full and shaping away on off, Jadeja leaves again.
A tempter from Tongue! Fuller and in the corridor of uncertainty, on off, Jadeja is content with leaving.
Length ball, on middle and leg, Shubman Gill steers it towards deep square leg for a single.
Hits the deck hard, 136 kph, on middle, Shubman Gill plays close to the body and keeps it out to cover-point.
Attacks the stumps, full and on middle, Ravindra Jadeja flicks it behind square on the leg side for a single.
Nagging length, around off, watchfully left alone by Jadeja.
Fuller and on off, eased to short cover by Gill.
Spins in on off, Shubman Gill leans forward to block, but the ball goes off the inside edge to backaward square leg.
Short of full, on off, Ravindra Jadeja tucks it across and through mid-wicket for a single.
Loopy delivery, on off, Shubman Gill smashes it to short cover. Ollie Pope makes a half-stop and parries the ball in the deep. He chases the ball behind and the batters cross over.

Slides it down leg, on length, Gill steers it to deep fine leg again and completes the first one easily. Josh Tongue yet again chases the ball from backward square leg and keeps the batters down to two.
Too slow through the air, full and on the leg stump, Shubman Gill leans on and tickles it to deep fine leg for a couple of runs.
Straighter and fuller, around off, Jadeja offers no shot. A rare maiden.
Length ball, outside off, left alone by Jadeja.
A well-directed bumper from Josh, angling in and on off. Ravindra Jadeja drops down his wrists, arches back and lets it through.
Back of a length, angled on off, Ravindra Jadeja punches it off the back foot to the covers.
Lands it fuller on off, Ravindra Jadeja presses ahead and blocks it to the off side.
Short of full, outside off, Jadeja sees it pass to the keeper.
Full and spinning in on leg, Shubman Gill clips it to the square leg region.
Shortish delivery, outside off, cut away to backward point.
Full and sliding onto the pads, Jadeja clips it through backward square leg for a single.
Fuller and on off, blocked off by Jadeja.

OUT! IN THE AIR AND TAKEN! Pant leaves the way he came in! Bashir floats it fuller and just around the off stump, Rishabh Pant dances down the track to give it a whack over the off side, but he tries to hit it too hard and badly mistimes it. The ball gets sliced off the bat and the willow shoots up in the air in the opposite direction of the ball and lands at backward square leg. The ball sails high but not long enough and Ben Duckett settles under the ball, moving forward from long off. Takes a comfortable catch. Rishabh Pant departs after an entertaining 65 (58). India are 236/4 with a lead of 416 runs.
Rishabh Pant (wk) c B Duckett b S Bashir 65 (58b 8x4 3x6)

FOUR! Signature Pant shot this! Drops it full and on middle. Rishabh Pant gets low and gets under the ball to sweep it over fine leg for a boundary. He loses his balance in the process and falls over on the pitch but collects four runs.
Strayed down leg on a length, Gill misses to flick and the ball goes to the left of the keeper.
Full and nips in sharply from off, Shubman Gill adjusts well to that and smothers it to the leg side.
FOUR! Glorious stroke! Pitched short and on top of off, Shubman Gill shimmies down the track and cuts it between the gap at cover and point for a boundary. The lead is now 412 runs for India!
Fuller and on off, Shubman Gill forces it out to short cover.
Full on off, Gill prods forward and blocks it off.
Fired on middle, on a length, knocked straight back.
No run.
Almost a similar delivery that spins away from outside off, Rishabh Pant lets it be.
Outside off and full, Pant leaves as the ball lifts off the rough and spins away.
FOUR! He is just finding the gaps with ease! A low full toss, on off, Rishabh Pant gets low and sweeps it along the turf through square leg for a boundary. The 100-run partnership comes up with this.
Short and outside off, Rishabh Pant hangs back and chops it to the left of the first slip.
Wide on off, tossed fuller. Rishabh Pant plants his front foot out but lets it be.
Banged short and on the leg stump, Pant helps it away to deep fine leg for a single.
SIX! SMOKED! A bit fuller in length now, on off, Rishabh Pant clears the front leg and heaves it over deep mid-wicket for a six. This takes India's lead past 400 runs as well!
Back of a length, on off, steered behind backward point for a single.

ANOTHER FIFTY FOR RISHABH PANT! Back-to-back hundreds in Leeds and now completes his 16th Test fifty in a fine fashion! Onto the pads, on a length, Rishabh Pant tucks it behind square on the leg side for a single. Gets to the other end, raises his bat in the air, and soaks in all the applause from the crowd and his teammates.
Around the stumps, nagging length on off, Rishabh Pant gets behind it and solidly defends it to the off side.
Back of a length, with a sudden lift off the deck, outside off, Shubman Gill controls the square cut along the ground. Gets a single at deep backward point.
A yard behind full, outside off, Rishabh Pant gets back and across, and opens the bat face and cuts it to short third.
Loops it outside off, full in length. Rishabh Pant leaves it.
Short of full, outside off, Pant cuts it to backward point.
On middle, on a length, Shubman Gill tucks it to the right of mid-wicket for a single.
Around off, and short, Gill rocks back and punches it to the leg side.
Slower through the air, short and wide on off, Pant hangs back and chops it to deep point for a single.
Around the stumps, short and outside leg, Gill pulls it to the left of backward square leg.

FOUR! FIFTY FOR SHUBMAN GILL! His amazing run with the bat continues in this series. His 8th half century in Test cricket. Bashes the hard length, does Tongue, on off, Shubman Gill blasts at it with a flat-batted shot to the left of mid on for a boundary. This has come at a much quicker pace than the first innings and he has looked in complete control as well. He already has a hundred and a double hundred in the series. India lead by 392 runs.
Outside leg, short in length. Rishabh Pant helps it away with the pull shot to deep fine leg. Another single.
Back of a length, on off, Shubman Gill pulls it along the turf for a single at deep mid-wicket.
WIDE! Digs the short ball in, but well over the head height. Shubman Gill gets inside the line and ducks. Wide called.

SIX! Easy pickings! Josh Tongue stays predictable and bangs another short delivery, on middle. Shubman Gill weighs on the back foot and pulls it over deep backward square leg for a huge six. The 200 is up for India!
Swing and a miss! Short and angling down leg. Shubman Gill gets inside the line to pull it away, but does not lay the bat on it.
Tossed up, full and on off, Rishabh Pant lunges forward and eases it into the cover region.
Loopy delivery, full and spinning away from outside off. Rishabh Pant does not poke at the teaser.
Floated through the air, on off, Rishabh Pant hangs back and chops it to the point region.
Pitched fuller on off, Gill drills it down to long on for a single. Moves into his 40s!
Slowish, fullish, on middle. Gill pushes it to mid on.
Short and outside off, punched away off the back foot to deep cover for a single.
Short on leg, pulled to backward square leg.

MISFIELD, FOUR! Banged around halfway on the pitch, on the bodyline, Shubman Gill goes deep in the crease and smashes the pull shot along the ground to the right of deep mid-wicket. Ben Stokes who is stationed a few yards inside the ropes in the deep, moves to his right but does not fully bend low to stop and the ball evades to race behind for a boundary. The ball seems to have hurt Stokes on the pinky finger on the right hand in the process.
FOUR! More runs! Short and on the leg stump, Shubman Gill plays the tennis forehand and hits it over the mid on fielder for a cracking boundary on the bounce.
SIX! A bit of a loosener and Gill cashes on it! Another short delivery from Josh, angling on middle and leg. Shubman Gill gets under the ball and pulls it over deep fine leg for a six.
Short on middle, Gill stands tall and pulls it to the square leg fielder.
Steams in from over the stumps, sees Gill backing away and follows the batter with a short ball. Shubman Gill controls the pull shot and hits it straight to mid-wicket.
Full, on off, Shubman Gill draws his front foot out and taps it to the left of cover for a quick single. 6 runs off the over.
Drags the length back, on middle, nudged off the back foot to the leg side.
Low full toss, outside off, carved to backward point.
Pitched fuller, turning in from off, Shubman Gill leans forward and pushes it gently to the right of the bowler.
Flights it up, fuller and on the stumps, Rishabh Pant works this to the mid on region for a single.

FOUR! Pant gets his business going without wasting any time! Shoaib bowls it short and outside off, a bit of a freebie and Pant cuts it off the back foot to deep backward point for a boundary. India lead by 361 runs.
Almost a half-tracker, on middle, Shubman Gill meets the ball under his eyes and blocks it to the right of the bowler. And that will be LUNCH ON DAY 4. India are 177/3, leading by 357 runs!
Short delivery on the leg stump. Rishabh Pant stands tall, and helps it on its way to deep fine leg for a single.
Straigher and fuller, on off, Shubman Gill leans on and guides it through backward point for a single. The 50-run partnership comes up between Gill and Pant, in just 51 balls.
On the stumps, from around the stumps. Rishabh Pant tucks this length ball to the mid-wicket region for a single.
Another one which is angled on the leg stump, on a short length. Shubman Gill gets inside and nudges it to deep square leg for a single.
Slanted down leg, on a length. Shubman Gill misses to flick it away. Smith grabs behind the wickets.
Drifter into the pads, on a length, Pant goes back and jabs it on the pitch.
Fuller on the stumps, pushed to the left of Bashir.
A bit of spin from middle. Rishabh Pant goes back to play the full ball and just gets his bat in front to ease it out.
Good follow-up! Slower through the air, sliding on the pads, Pant nudges it to mid-wicket.
FOUR! Pulled away! Drops short on off, does Bashir. Rishabh Pant hangs back in the crease and pulls it over mid-wicket for a one-bounce boundary. The lead goes past 350 for India.
Nicely flighted up, full and on middle, drilled down to mid on.
Aims the off pole, does Josh, on a yard behind fuller length, Shubman Gill presses forward and blocks it straight back.
Good length, on top of middle, Shubman Gill lets the ball arrive and taps it out to short cover.
Keeps the stumps in play, on a length, Gill gently pushes it to the leg side, beside the strip.
Short of a length, on middle, nipping in. Shubman Gill steers it to square leg.
Short and angling on the leg stump. Rishabh Pant half-pulls that to deep backward square leg for a single.
On the back of a length, on off, Rishabh Pant gets behind it and taps it out to the off side.
On middle, and on a length, Rishabh Pant hangs back and taps it across to the square leg region for a single.
On middle and turns toward the leg stump, Shubman Gill steers it to the square leg region for a single.
Pitches around off and turns in, Shubman Gill leans forward and defends.
Shortish and sliding on the pads, Pant nudges it behind square on the leg side for a single.
Certainly stayed low! Darted full and just outside off, Rishabh Pant gets low on his knee to pull that but misses as the ball stays low on the bounce. Goes scarily close to the off pole as well.
Nice and full, toss on middle and off, Pant lunges forward and defends it off.
A calm end to the over, Length, on off, pushed to mid on.

IN THE AIR... PUT DOWN! A tough opportunity, but goes down as a chance. Full from Josh Tongue on the leg stump line. Rishabh Pant closes the bat face early to flick it and gets it off the top edge. The ball flies off the edge to the mid-wicket region. Chris Woakes from square leg scoots towards the ball and dives while sticking his right hand out to catch. But doesn't cling on it as his elbows graze the ground. The ball rolls beside him and a single is taken.

And the bat has flown away! It's all happening out there! Just a bit fuller and outside off, Rishabh Pant swooshes at it with a high velocity to slog it away, but misses and the ball slips off his hands and lands around the backward square leg region. All smiles in the Indian dressing room as Pant strolls to collect the bat.
Quick run! Pitched fuller on middle and leg, Gill gently pushes it to the mid on region and calls Pant through for a quick single.
Close! Onto the pads, on a length. Shubman Gill misses to glance it away, but the ball just grazes the front pad on the way to the keeper.

A bit of a miscommunication but no harm done! Back of a length, on off, Pant steers it to the backward point region. Ollie Pope dives to his left and stops it. A bit of yes and no between the batters, but they make their respective ends.
Floated up, full and just around off, Shubman Gill takes a giant stride out to defend.
Pitched on off, on a length, spinning away. Rishabh Pant steers it to the off side and takes a quick single.
FOUR! And again! A bit fuller and on off, Rishabh Pant plugs his back knee on the pitch and pulls that to deep backward square leg for a boundary.
Fairly outside off, on a length, Pant does not touch that.

FOUR! PUNISHED! That has travelled at the rate of knots! Bashir drops short again, on middle. Rishabh Pant quickly goes into the crease and pulls it to the left of deep mid-wicket fielder who barely gets a chance to move a muscle. A cracking boundary.
Shoaib Bashir is into the attack now. Starts off on a length, spinning in on middle. Shubman Gill gets back and across and dabs it to backward square leg for a single.
Nagging length, on off, cutting back in, Rishabh Pant hops off and stabs it across on the pitch.

SIX! Oh, goodness gracious! That is a shot and a half! Angles on the leg stump line, on a fuller length. Rishabh Pant crouches and sweeps while using his wrists, and keeps it aerial. Deposits it behind deep fine leg for a six. This is Pant's 23rd six against England, the most by any overseas batter. The 150 also comes up for India, and the tourists lead by 332 runs.
Pops off the good length, on middle and leg, Rishabh Pant dabs it to the leg side with soft hands.
Good length, angling on middle and leg, Rishabh Pant nudges it to square leg.
FOUR! Through the gap and into the fence! Shortish delivery, outside off, Rishabh Pant gets enough width and cuts it off the back foot, to the left of point for a boundary.
On a back of a length, on middle, Pant hangs back to nudge it away. Gets a bit hurried on the shot. The ball sneaks under the blade and catches Rishabh high on the thigh pad.

DROPPED! A big, big moment in the day's play! Ben Stokes almost fished out Pant but Zak Crawley puts it down. Hits the deck hard, does Stokes, around off and middle, angling in. Rishabh Pant shimmies down the track to smash it away. Hits the ball flat and straight to the mid off fielder, where Zak Crawley crouches low to grab the catch to his right, but seemingly leans a bit too much to his right and loses his balance. Hence, it bursts in and out of the palms and parries to the cover region. A single taken. But how costly will this be for the Englishmen? Only time will tell.
Slides down the leg side, on a length. Rishabh Pant misses to flick the ball and it carries back to the keeper.
Short of a good length, outside off, Pant punches it on the up to cover-point.
Curves in a touch, full and on leg, Shubman Gill clips it to long leg for a single.

FOUR! That's a deft touch! Hard length, just around off, Shubman Gill rises on the toes, waits for the ball to come and opens the bat face pretty late. Guides the ball to deep third for a boundary. A suddenly, the boundaries have started to flow.
Hard length, on middle and leg, Gill plays this across to the short mid-wicket region and looks for a single but goes back. Stokes runs across the strip and stops the ball himself.
Short length, on top of off, Rishabh Pant covers the line and gets right behind it to block. A very eventful over. A wicket, a six and a four from it. India lead by 316 runs.
SIX! Dear me! That is an audacious shot from Pant! Hard length, outside off, Rishabh Pant reads the length quickly, dances down the track and smashes it over long off for a cracking six.

FOUR! Gets off the mark! Back of a length, angling down the leg stump line. Rishabh Pant stands tall and just provides the way to the ball. Uses the pace and the angle and helps it away to deep fine leg for a boundary.
Around off, on a length, worked towards point.

Adventurous already, is Pant. He shows his cards early as he steps down the track to heave it across, and seeing that, Josh Tongue fires this on the pads, Pant misses the full toss and the ball rolls off the pad to the leg side.

OUT! CLEANED HIM UP! What a corker of a delivery from Josh Tongue! England have the second wicket of the morning! And it's the big fish, KL Rahul! Josh Tongue steams in full tilt and cannons the ball on the fuller length, keeping it right in front of the stumps. It pitches and just straightens a touch. KL Rahul tries to flick this away, but plays the wrong line, expecting it to come in with the angle and is beaten on the outside edge. Hears the death rattle behind him as the ball makes a total mess of the sticks. KL Rahul departs on 55 (84) and India are now 126/3, leading by 306 runs.
KL Rahul b J Tongue 55 (84b 10x4 0x6)

Oh, a close leave! Just in the vicinity of the off pole, on a length. It lands, nips in, and just dies on the bounce as KL Rahul makes a watchful leave. Jamie Smith gets low to gather the ball, but makes a fumble as he gets a bad bounce, and it rolls behind him. The batters cross for a bye.
This one just jags back in a touch, on a good length, on middle and leg. Shubman Gill brings the bat with angle to flick it to the mid-wicket region for a quick single.
Sliding onto the pads, on a length, KL Rahul flicks it to deep square leg for a single.
Straight and on off, KL Rahul blocks it on the pitch.
Nagging length, nipping away outside off, KL Rahul is beaten on the outside edge while playing the square cut.

EDGED, FOUR! Ben Stokes is disappointed as it just goes through the vacant gully region. Outside off, on a back of a length, shaping away. KL Rahul throws his hands at it to place it through the covers, but gets a thick outside edge and goes through the gully region for a boundary. India's lead has now gone past 300!
Just outside off, on a length, left alone by Gill.
FOUR! Glorious written all over it! Fuller one again, outside off, Shubman Gill strides forward and cracks the cover drive for a boundary. Lovely hand-eye coordination on that one.

FIFTY FOR KL RAHUL! His 18th Test half century! And it's been quite a free-flowing one from him. Touch full from Tongue, outside off, KL Rahul leans onto it and drives past the cover region. Brydon Carse chases the ball to the ropes and just in time, flicks the ball inside with him going beyond the ropes after that. Comes back in the field of play and throws it back. Three taken.

Fractionally fuller, on off, Shubman Gill presses forward and taps it to the cover region. Calls his partner through for a single. The fielder there gathers the ball and scores a direct hit at the bowler's end, but Gill skates through.
Makes the batter play at that, full and on the fourth stump. KL Rahul draws his front foot out and pushes it wide of cover-point for a single.
Josh Tongue is into the attack, replacing Woakes! Too full, outside off, Gill carves it out to the point region for a single.
Maiden from Carse. Another rhythmic over from him. Hits the deck hard, just outside off and it nips away a touch. KL Rahul lets it pass.
A gently away shape, on a length, but fairly outside off, KL Rahul does not poke at it.
Attempted yorker, on the leg stump. KL Rahul closes the bat face a bit early to flick and the ball rolls off the outside edge to the second slip fielder.
Back of a length, outside off, KL Rahul watches it pass.

BEATEN! Beautiful seam presentation as this lands around off and cuts back in from the good length. KL Rahul presses forward to drive it through the covers, but plays over it and is beaten on the inside edge.
Just a shade of an away shape, outside off, on a length. KL Rahul hides the bat in front of the pad to let that go.
Back to pace on, on a length, on the off stump, Gill covers the line and stabs it down the deck.
Slower one by Woakes, fuller in length, on middle, Shubman picks the variation and watchfully defends.
In the corridor on off, curving away, on a good length, Gill plays inside the line and gets beaten on the outside edge.

FOUR! Two is the call but Shubman Gill gets more than that! On a length, on off, Gill lunges for the block. A little bit of away movement results in the ball catching the outside edge and it beats Ben Duckett in the deep to his left at deep backward point.
On a short of a length, on middle, tucked to short mid-wicket.
Jamie Smith is up to the stumps to keep the Indian skipper in his crease. Shubman Gill had so far been batting outside the crease. On a good length, on off, kept out on the off side.
Hurls it on a length, on of, Rahul taps it to cover off the front foot.
Banged in short by Carse, over off, KL Rahul sways away from the line of the ball and lets it go.
Oh, hello! The previous ball reared up a bit but this has kept low. Outside the line of the off stump, on a good length, left alone by KL.

FOUR! Gets it away! On a hard length, outside off, Rahul presses back and looks to cash in on the width. Sets up to flay it away and the ball kicks up a bit but Rahul manages to get it through the vacant gully region for a boundary.
Full and wider on off, Rahul creams the drive but picks out the man at cover.
Hits the deck hard, on off, on a good length, KL gets forward for the block.
Loopy slower delivery by Woakes but the line is down leg, Gill walks inside the line but fails to get any bat on it. The keeper, Jamie Smith gathers it with a dive to his left.
Woakes goes wide on the crease and attacks the front pad, on a length, Gill does fall over to the off side slightly but manages to clip it to short mid-wicket.
Shaping away, on off, Gill gets right forward to block.
Fuller and on off, Shubman gets a big stride in and plays it to mid off.
On a good length, on off, Shubman Gill takes a step down the track and stabs it down on the off side.
Very full, on off, Gill jams it out back to the bowler.

A huge appeal for LBW but turned down! Ben Stokes signals bat but he is coaxed into taking the review by the bowler and the keeper. Looked to be going down leg at first glance. Sprayed on the pads, on a length, Gill misses out on the flick. The batters cross as the ball rolls through square leg. The UltraEdge shows a spike and England lose their review.
On a length, on middle, nudged wide of mid-wicket for a single. 100 comes up for India and the lead is now 280.

What happened there? Very full, curving away, outside off, Rahul taps it towards cover where Ben Stokes moves to his left and gathers it. Stokes looks to throw it towards the keeper but it goes through the slip cordon. Joe Root went after it and pulled it back in before the ropes. Neither of the two Indian batters was aware of what had happened and they did not run. Strange.
On a good length, on off, Shubman looks to play it with a straight bat. This jags back in to take the inside edge and the ball rolls down to deep fine leg for one.
England won't mind this! A bit of away shape, outside off, on the fuller side, Gill is drawn into the drive and plays it to cover.
Slanting in, on a back of a length, on off, Shubman Gill rides the bounce and keeps it out.
Outside off, on a good length. A bit of indecision from KL on whether to leave or play. Ends up tentatively defending it away from his body.
Full and around leg, Gill plants his front foot across and is batting outside the crease. Flicks it wide of mid-wicket for a single to get off the mark.
On top of the off stump, Shubman Gill presents a straight bat and plays it back to Woakes.
On a back of a length, around off, Rahul gets on top of it and punches it to deep point for a single.
On the pads, on a short of a length, KL fails to help it away. Tries to sneak in a leg bye as the ball rolls off the pads in front of square leg but Gill sends him back.
Lands it on a length, on the off stump, KL taps it towards mid on.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! Brydon Carse has his reward off an extremely rhythmic start with the ball! Finally, the edge goes to hand for Carse and England. Carse serves it full, slanting in, on the off stump, Karun Nair gets on the front foot to knock it down the ground with a straight bat. The ball goes away off the seam just enough and Nair's bat comes down at an angle. The ball catches the outside edge and goes behind quickly. The keeper, Jamie Smith, dives to his right and snaffles it. Nair falls for 26 (46). India are 96/2 with a lead of 276 runs.
Karun Nair c J Smith b B Carse 26 (46b 5x4 0x6)
Goes full, does Carse, outside off, Karun Nair punches it off the front foot but Ben Stokes at cover cuts it off with a slide to his left.
The length is pulled back, on off, Karun presses forward before rocking back. Gets a bit rushed in defence but manages to keep it out.
FOUR MORE! A bit too full by Brydon, around off, Karun Nair presses on the front foot and times the drive between cover and mid off for another boundary. India's lead goes up to 276!
FOUR! Easy pickings! A rare misdirected ball from Carse in this spell. Full and sliding onto the pads, Nair helps it away fine of the man at deep fine leg for a boundary.
Full and on off, blocked out by Karun.

Play and a miss! Chris Woakes goes wide on the crease and angles it in, on a good length, outside off, Rahul makes the mistake of poking at the delivery before trying to withdaw the bat. Luckily for him, he does not nick this one behind.

Half a shout for LBW! The umpire says no and England do no go for the review. Angled in, on a back of a length, around off, Rahul covers his off stump and tucks his bat inside the line and behind the front pad. The ball nips back in to brush the front pad before going behind to the keeper.
Fuller and on middle and leg, Rahul clips it to square leg.
A bit too straight, on the pads, on a nagging length, glanced down to deep fine leg for one.
Drags the length back, on the off stump, KL Rahul presses back and dabs it to the left of cover for a single.
Woakes goes full and attacks the stumps, KL gets forward to pat it back to the bowler.

Another edge that drops short! Bowled from a bit wide on the crease, on the off stump, on a length, Karun's bat comes at an angle in an effort to make the block. Gets it off the outer half and it goes on the bounce to second slip.
FOUR! Nicely done! Full and width offered by Carse, Karun presses forward and opens the face of the bat slightly to direct the ball to the left of backward point for a boundary.

Beaten! Brydon Carse is amidst a probing spell! In the channel on off, on a back of a length, Nair flirts with danger and does have a slight poke at the delivery before withdrawing his bat. Gets beaten on the outside edge.
On the fuller side, on off, KL Rahul knocks it in front of mid on and takes a quick single.
A bit of extra bounce, on off, on a hard length, Rahul gets on top of it and fends it down.
Completely opened up! Angling in and then it straightens off the deck, over off, Rahul is turned around in defence and the ball flirts past his outside edge.
Banged in short by Woakes, over off, Karun ducks under it.
Karun presents a straight bat and pushes this full ball to mid on.
Full and straight, at the stumps, flicked nicely by Karun Nair but he can't get it past Ollie Pope at short mid-wicket.
On middle and leg, kept out on the leg side by KR.

Edged again, but this time, it falls well short! On a back of a length, on off, Karun looks to defend but his bat comes at an angle. Gets squared up in defence and the ball catches the outside edge but drops ahead of Harry Brook at second slip.
Full and on off, Karun blocks it out.
Fuller and on off, driven past cover for a single by Karun.

FOUR! Edged but it goes right through the slip cordon! A lucky escape for Karun Nair. Dug in short by Carse, over off, Karun hangs his bat out in front to block but the ball seams away a bit to catch the outside edge and it goes right between the wide gap of Joe Root at first slip and Harry Brook at second slip.

Oh, that could have gone anywhere! The umpire signals for the physio to come out. Did that go off the helmet? Or the glove? Looked to be the glove in real-time. This jags back in and the bumper does not rise as much as Karun expected it to. Nair tries to sway away from the line of the ball but fails to get down enough in time. The ball sneaks past the bat and the gloves and catches him on the grill before lobbing in front of the slip cordon.
Sprayed down leg, on a back of a length, Karun misses out on the tickle.
At the stumps, on a short of a length, Nair gets right behind it.
Lands it on a back of a length, around off, Karun glides it towards backward point.
Fuller in length, on off, Rahul firms the drive down the deck. Woakes gets low and makes the stop to his left.
Woakes goes wide on the crease and slants it into the right-hander, on a good length, Rahul presses forward and taps it to the right of the bowler.
A bit of away shape, just around the off stump, on a good length, KL waits back to defend.

Leg bye! Sliding onto the pads, on a good length, Karun is beaten on the flick and the ball bounces a bit to catch him high on the front pad. Half a shout for LBW but the appeal dies down quickly. A leg bye is taken as the ball goes on the off side.
On top of off, Nair gets on top of the bounce and dabs it down on the off side.
Hurls it on a good length, on the line of the off stump, Nair pushes it back to the bowler with a straight bat.
Pitched up, on off, Rahul defends solidly with his bat close to the front pad.
On a hard length, over off, KL rides the bounce and drops it near his feet.

EDGED AND FOUR! No third slip and it races away! This kicks up a bit, on a hard length, on off, Rahul jabs at the ball with hard hands. Gets an outside edge that goes through the vacant third slip region for a boundary.

A loud shout for LBW but turned down! Brydon Carse looks interested but there seemed to be an inside edge and yes, replays later confirm it. A wise decision not to go for the review. Nipping back in, on a length, on off, KL plays a bit outside the line of the ball as he looks to play it with a straight bat. Ekes out an inside edge onto the pads.
FOUR! Lovely shot! Overpitched by Carse and offers width on off, Rahul gets a good stride in and caresses it through covers for the first boundary of the day.
Angled into the right-hander from over the wicket, on a length, Rahul eases it with a straight bat to mid on.
Bowled into the surface by Woakes, outside off, Rahul presses back and punches it to deep point for a single.
Angled in at the hips, on a short of a good length, Nair turns it through square leg and crosses over.
On off, on a nagging length, Nair covers the line and pushes it down the deck.
Woakes goes into the wicket and gets a bit of away movement off the deck, around off, Karun presents a straight bat and keeps it out.
Lands it on a hard length, on off, Rahul hops back and rides the bounce to steer it to deep backward point for a single.
Woakes steams in from over the wicket and serves it on a back of a length, on off, KL stands tall and pats it down on the off side.
Another short ball by Carse, over middle, Karun Nair ducks underneath it. That will be STUMPS on Day 3!
Dug in short by Brydon Carse, around off, Karun Nair ducks and sways away from the line of the ball.
In the channel on off, on a short of a good length, Karun shoulders arms.
Beaten! Brydon Carse looks to go short but this does not rise that much, outside off, Karun Nair is early into the pull and the ball sneaks under the blade.
There's the double bluff from Carse! With a short leg in place now, Brydon goes full and attacks the stumps. Karun's weight is on the back foot but manages to play it with a straight bat to mid on.
Lands it on a back of a length, on off, Rahul goes deep in the crease and knocks it to the left of mid off for a single.
A maiden from Tongue! Hits the deck hard, on top of the off stump. The ball kicks up a bit but Karun takes the bottom hand off the bat and watchfully fends it down on the leg side.
A sharp and quick bumper but down leg, Nair ducks under it.
Tongue goes into the wicket, over off, Nair hangs back and pats it down on the off side.
Angled in, on middle and leg, on a good length, Nair gets his bat out in front and knocks it to mid on.
Drags the length back, over off, Karun rides the bounce and drops it in front of point. Looks for a single but KL sends him back.
Full and straight, at the stumps, Karun whips it nicely but picks out the man at short mid-wicket.
Seaming back in, on a short of a good length, on the off stump, Rahul gets on his toes to keep it out.
Around off, on a back of a length, Rahul hops and guides it towards gully.
Attacking the stumps from over the wicket, on a good length, KL covers the line and taps it back to the bowler.
Bowls it on a length, on off, KL gets forward to defend.
On a back of a length, outside off, Rahul stabs it down on the off side.

Banged into the wicket by Carse, outside off, KL hops to ride the bounce and sets up to cut it away. Just as he was about to swing his bat, in came a gust of wind and that kind of put him off. Rahul adjusts by dabbing it down.
At the hips, on a short of a length, glanced down to deep fine leg for a single.
Outside off, on a length, Rahul blocks it out.
FOUR! Exquisite! Josh gets it a bit too full, wide on off, Rahul leans into the shot and firms the drive between cover and mid off for a boundary. India's lead goes up to 242!
Wider on off, on a good length, left alone by KL.
Bowled from a bit wide on the crease, on a good length, on the off stump, KL plays it late and defends it right under his eyes.
Angled in, on off, Rahul gets a good stride in and pushes it to mid off.
FOUR! Majestic! Woakes lands it nice and full, on middle, Karun shows the full face of the bat and just eases the drive to the left of mid on for a boundary.
Shaping away, fuller in length, Karun thinks about leaving the ball intially but then decides to guide it towards point with an open bat face.
On top of off, on the shorter side, Karun hangs back and defends it with a straight bat.
Full and sliding onto the pads, Karun presses forward and clips it between mid-wicket and mid on. Shoaib Bashir gives it a chase from mid on and cuts it off. Two runs taken.
Just outside the off stump, on a length, Nair shoulders arms.
Delivers a full ball, outside off, Nair leaves the ball alone.
Attacking the stumps, on a length, Rahul brings his bat out in front and blocks it out.
Pitched up, around off, Nair caresses it towards cover where a fumble from Ben Duckett allows the single and Nair is off the mark.

OUT! PLUMB IN FRONT! Josh Tongue with a timely breakthrough for England! Nipping back in from around the wicket, on a length, on middle, Jaiswal plants his front foot across for the flick but is beaten on the inside edge. The ball brushes the front pad before going on to hit the back pad. England go up in unison and the finger is raised. Yashasvi Jaiswal walks up to KL Rahul and takes too long to go for the review. The timer on screen does seem to have run out but the umpires allow the review. The UltraEdge shows no bat and the Ball Tracking shows three reds with the ball crashing into the stumps. Jaiswal takes a review with him. He falls for 28 (22). India are now 51/1, leading by 231 runs.
Yashasvi Jaiswal lbw J Tongue 28 (22b 6x4 0x6)
50 comes up for India! Full and on middle, Yashasvi brings his bottom hand into play and whips it to the right of deep mid-wicket for a couple. The lead is now 231 runs!
FOUR! Easy pickings! Sprayed on the pads, on a length, Jaiswal clips it to the right of deep fine leg and beats the despairing dive of Shoaib Bashir in the deep.
Josh Tongue comes into the attack and starts from around the wicket. Tries to go full but ends up serving a low full toss, down leg, YJ gets inside the line for the tickle but misses.
Slanting in, on middle and leg, on a nagging length, Rahul dabs it down on the leg side.

FOUR MORE! Chris Woakes overcorrects and bowls it short and wide on off, Rahul is quick to get on top of the bounce and cuts it between cover-point and backward point for the third boundary of the over.
FOUR! Sumptuous! Woakes gets his length wrong. Serves a half-volley, on off, KL presents the full face of the bat and times the drive to the right of mid off for a boundary.
Full and just outside the off stump, Rahul covers the off stump and makes the leave.
This keeps low, angling in on the off stump, on a short of a length, Rahul gets his bat down to keep it out.
FOUR! Threads it through! Woakes hurls it on a back of a length, around off, KL rocks on the back foot, gets on top of the bounce and punches it between cover-point and backward point for a boundary.
On middle, Rahul gets behind the line of the ball and pats it to the right of mid on for a single.
A bit fuller, on the off stump, Yashasvi drops it with soft hands beside the pitch on the off side for one.
FOUR! Slammed! Brydon Carse goes short but this sits up to be hit, on off, Yashasvi presses back and nails the pull over mid-wicket for four more.
On a length, on off, Yashasvi pats it down on the off side.
FOUR! Nothing streaky about this one! A half-volley, on middle and leg, Yashasvi Jaiswal stays balanced in the crease and wrists it between mid-wicket and mid on for a boundary.

FOUR! Streaky! Cross-seam delivery from around the wicket, on a length, on off, Yashasvi Jaiswal looks to push it down the ground with a straight bat. Gets an outside edge that goes along the ground past gully for a boundary. Yashasvi brings up 2000 runs in Test cricket. He is the joint-fastest Indian to reach the landmark in 40 innings alongside Virender Sehwag and Rahul Dravid.
On middle and leg, on a good length, KL jabs it to mid on.
In the channel on off, on a good length, left alone by KL.
FOUR! Fine shot! Woakes bowls it on a back of a length, on off, Rahul meets the ball right under his eyes and punches it to the right of backward point for a boundary.
England won't mind this! A hint of nip away, on the fuller side, outside off, KL was better off leaving this one but ended up defending away from his body.
Lands it on a short of a good length, on off, Rahul rises with the bounce and taps it down.
Serves it on a nagging length, on off, Rahul covers the line and defends.
On a hard length, on off, Yashasvi hops back and stabs it down the deck.

FOUR! Punished! Brydon Carse errs in both line and length. Short and wide on off, there to be put away, Yashasvi Jaiswal frees his arms and slaps it to the left of Ollie Pope at backward point. Pope had no idea where the ball was hit and was ducking to avoid being hit on the head.
Just around the off stump, on a nagging length, Jaiswal gets on top of the bounce and dabs it to point.
Fuller this time by Carse, on off, YJ drives it firmly to mid off.
Continues to zone in at the stumps, on a length, Jaiswal gets forward to block.
Bowled from wide of the crease on the around-the-wicket angle, on a length, on middle, Yashasvi Jaiswal gets right behind it.
Outside off, on a good length, KL lets it be.
Leg bye! Sliding at the hips, on a back of a length, YJ fails to help it away. A leg bye is taken as the ball goes behind off the pads.
Much better! Fuller and attacking the stumps, Yashasvi Jaiswal gets forward and defends with his bat close to the front pad.

FOUR! Hit with real authority! Chris tries to go into the wicket but he does not have the pace for it and fails to get it high enough, on off, Yashasvi Jaiswal pulls it over mid-wicket for a boundary.
On top of off, on a back of a length, Jaiswal stands tall and pats it back to Woakes.

Half an appeal for caught behind from Chris Woakes but a shake of the head from the umpire! Slanting down leg from around the wicket, Yashasvi Jaiswal misses out on the tickle and Jamie Smith gathers it with a dive to his right. The noise seemed to be of the bat hitting the pad.
Pulls the length back, on off, KL rises with the bounce and dabs it down on the off side.
FOUR! Class written all over it! Carse hurls it fuller, on off, Rahul presses on the front foot and drives it all along the ground past mid off for a boundary.

WOAH! That took off! Wobble seam delivery by Carse, on a back of a length, on off, KL tentatively hangs his bat out in front to defend. Gets taken aback by the steep bounce and the ball whispers past the outside edge.

Oh, that could have gone back onto the stumps! This is on a short of a good length, on off, Rahul gets on his toes in an attempt to punch it away. Gets an inside edge that sneaks past the pads and rolls beside the pitch on the leg side.
Nipping back in, on off, on a good length, Rahul gets right forward to keep it out.
A bit of nip back into the right-hander, on a back of a length, Rahul turns it off the pads towards square leg.
From around the wicket to the left-hander, on a good length, on off, Jaiswal defends it right under his eyes.
Angled in, on a hard length, around the hips, Rahul presses back and nudges it through square leg for a single to get off the mark.
Drags the length back, around the off stump, KL gets on his toes and punches it to mid off.
In the channel on off and keeps it nice and full, Rahul presses forward to block. Gets it off the outer half to backward point.
Slanting into the pads, on the fuller side, Rahul brings his wrists into play and works it to mid-wicket.
Yashasvi Jaiswal and India are away! Woakes steams in from over the wicket, on a back of a length, around leg, Jaiswal hops inside the line and glances it down to deep fine leg for a single.

OUT! KNOCKED HIM OVER! Mohammed Siraj wraps up the tail with a 6-for and does the job brilliantly for India! He bowls it on a fuller length, just outside off. It lands and just cuts back into the batter. Shoaib Bashir plants his front foot out but decides to leave it and hears the death rattle as the ball smashes into the off stump. Mohammed Siraj leaps in the air in jubilation as he registers his best bowling figures in England in Tests. Bashir is the sixth English batter to get out on a duck in this innings. Jamie Smith remains unbeaten. But England slip down badly from 387/5 to 407 all out.
Shoaib Bashir b M Siraj 0 (2b 0x4 0x6)

A vicious delivery and Bashir is struck right on the helmet! Mohammed Siraj shows serious concern as he walks up to Bashir to check if he's okay. A lethal bumper from Siraj, on the bodyline with some extra bounce. Shoaib Bashir is caught on the crease with the evasive action, but gets no time whatsoever to sway away from the line. The ball plonks straight onto the helmet and drops on the pitch. Bashir looks to be a bit shaken by that and the physio will be out for the concussion test.

OUT! LBW! A FIVE-FOR FOR MOHAMMED SIRAJ! He raises the ball as his teammates appreciate his efforts. Mohammed Siraj fires it fuller and angles on middle and leg, Josh Tongue tries to work that to the leg side, but ends up playing all over the wrong line and he is trapped in front as the ball thuds the front pad. A confident appeal for LBW and the finger is raised. Josh Tongue walks to Smith and opts for a review after a brief chat. This looks pretty straightforward to be fair. UltraEdge shows no spike and the Ball Tracking comes up with three reds. Another duck for an English batter as Josh Tongue departs now. England are 407/9.
Josh Tongue lbw M Siraj 0 (2b 0x4 0x6)

FOUR! Smith is keeping the flame ignited for England! What a powerful stroke that is! Akash Deep spears it full and outside off, Jamie Smith plants his front foot out and spanks it to the left of the bowler for a boundary down the ground.
WIDE! Well outside the tramline on the off side, Jamie Smith lets it be and Pant dives low to his right to collect the ball. Wide called.
Lands it outside off, on a fullish length, Jamie Smith with barely any footwork, pokes at it, away from his body and is beaten on the outside edge.
SIX! That's hit with venom! That in-between length, outside off. Jamie Smith swings his bat freely and deposits the ball behind long on for a cracking six. The 400 comes up for England!

EDGED, BUT SAFE! Back of a length, on the leg stump line. Jamie Smith shapes up for the pull shot, but gets a top edge and the ball flies over the slip cordon and lands on the bounce in front of deep third.
Pitched fuller and around off, Jamie Smith smashes it down to long off but refuses the single.
Attacks the stumps, does Deep, Jamie Smith gets right behind it and blocks it off.
Back of a length, angling in, around off, Josh Tongue blocks it out with a straight bat.

OUT! LBW! Siraj gets his fourth now and the Indians are running through the English lower order and making the new ball talk. This is touch full and angling into the batter from off, Brydon Carse gets half-forward to block but his bat doesn't arrive in front in time and is rapped on the front pad. A huge appeal for LBW, but the umpire denies it. Mohammed Siraj looks very certain and convinces Rishabh Pant to take the review as Shubman Gill is not on the field. Looks pretty close to the naked eye. UltraEdge shows that it is pad first and the Ball Tracking shows three reds as the ball smashes the leg stump on the projection. England are now 396/8, trailing by 191 runs.
Brydon Carse lbw M Siraj 0 (4b 0x4 0x6)
Slides it down leg on a length. Brydon Carse gets inside the line and misses to nudge it away. Rishabh Pant dives low to his left and collects it on the bounce.
Lovely nut! Shapes away from off, on a fuller length. Brydon Carse commits on the front foot to defend, but gets beaten past the outside edge as it moves away.

Back of a length, angling in on middle. Jamie Smith stays leg side and knocks it away through covers for a single. With this, Jamie Smith moves to 174 and goes past Alec Stewart for the highest individual score by any England wicket-keeper in Tests.
Angling in, on a nagging length, on middle and leg, Smith pushes it to mid on with a straight bat.
Pitched up, outside off, Carse leans into the shot and firms the drive to the man at a deepish extra cover.

OUT! EDGED AND GONE! Akash Deep gets another reward for being consistent with the new ball. Gets his fourth wicket. Akash dishes out an away swinger on a fuller length, outside off, Chris Woakes gets half forward and does not get to the pitch of the ball and pushes at it with hard hands. He plays it inside the line as the ball shapes away and takes the outside edge. It goes flat and low to the first slip fielder and Karun Nair takes a sharp catch there. Chris Woakes departs for 5 (17) and England are 395/7, trailing by 192 runs.
Chris Woakes c K Nair b A Deep 5 (17b 1x4 0x6)
Length ball, on off, punched toward mid off.
Curves back into the batter, short of a good length, Chris Woakes is taken by surprise and gets in a bit of a tangle to work that across. The ball zips past the bat and rams on the thigh pad.
Nagging length, on off, tapped off the back foot to short cover.
BEAUTY! Angles in on off and then straightens off the deck, on a length. Chris Woakes hangs his bat on the front foot and is beaten by a kitten-whisker on the outside edge.
Good-length delivery, around off, Smith blocks it off the inside half of the bat to the leg side, just beside the pitch.
Jags in sharply from off, on a length. Jamie Smith manages to bunt it down off the back foot.
Cannoned in front of the stumps, on a fuller length. Jamie Smith hangs back and stabs it straight back. Siraj chirps at the batter and Smith returns a wry smile back to him.
Angled on middle, full in length, Jamie Smith blocks it with a straight bat.
Hits the deck hard, does Siraj, on top of middle. Jamie Smith watchfully punches it back to the bowler. Siraj collects the ball on the bounce and gives a bit of stare to Smith.
Around off and full, Smith hangs on the back foot and gets a thick outside edge as the ball shoots on the bounce to the right of the gully fielder.
Another single as Smith guides this length ball to deep backward point.
A well-directed bouncer, on the bodyline. Chris Woakes controls the pull shot to deep square leg for one more.
Laser-straight on off and full, Chris Woakes brings the bat in front and pushes it to mid off.
Back of a length, outside off, Chris Woakes slashes it to left of the point fielder. Jadeja there dives to the left and stops.
This is short and on off, Woakes hangs back and taps it to the off side.
Attacks the off stump, on a good length, skidding through. Jamie Smith hangs on the back foot and blocks it to the leg side off the inside half of the bat.
A surprise bumper from Siraj, sliding down leg with a lift off the deck. Woakes is beaten on the pull shot and Pant moves to the left to grab it.
Straighter and fuller, on off, Woakes knocks it straight to cover.
Fuller and on middle, Woakes pushes it to mid on.

FOUR! Excellent timing and placement! Tails in a bit, around off, on a fuller length. Chris Woakes strides on the front foot and drives it in front of square on the off side and the ball races to the fence.

Angles it into the middle and leg, Jamie Smith pushes at it but gets an inside edge and the ball travels to deep backward square leg for a single. With this, England have avoided the follow-on as the deficit shrinks below 200!
Attacks the middle stump, on a length, Jamie Smith gets on the back foot and punches it solidly on the pitch.
Banged in short and on the leg stump, Chris Woakes ducks underneath to dodge this. A successful over for India and Akash Deep.
Good length, nipping in on middle with extra bounce. Chris Woakes manages to push it off the inside half of the bat to short mid-wicket.
Full and on off, driven to the cover region.
Wayward down the leg stump, short in length. Chris Woakes misses the pull and Rishabh Pant flings himself to the left to snaffle it behind the sticks.

OUT! CLEANED HIM UP! BOWLED! Akash Deep finally provides the breakthrough for India and gets his third wicket. This is on a good length, lands just around off and jags back in a long way off the pitch. Harry Brook does not fully commit on the front foot, and plays all over the line. A big gap between the bat and the pad and the ball sneaks through that to smash into the sticks. A huge round of applause from the crowd as Harry Brook makes his way back to the dressing room after scoring a valiant 158 (234). England are now 387/6, trailing by 200 runs.
Harry Brook b A Deep 158 (234b 17x4 1x6)
Banged halfway on the pitch, on the leg stump, Jamie Smith rises on the toes and turns it to deep square leg for a single. England trail exactly by 200 runs now!
Whoa, this sharply cuts into the batter, on a length and on middle. Jamie Smith is caught off guard and is blocked for space and inside edges it to deep backward square leg for a single.
Nagging length, around off, knocked out to the off side.

Length-delivery, around off, Smith leans back and punches it through covers for a couple of runs. The crowd is up on its feet as the partnership crosses the 300 mark. A remarkable feat from these two! This is already the second highest 6th wicket partnership for England in Tests.
Back of a length, on off, Jamie Smith punches it to cover.
FOUR! Lovely shot! Siraj serves it on the fuller length, and offers width outside off. Jamie Smith cashes on it, completely leans on and uppishly drives it over covers for a boundary.
A gentle shape away from off, on a length, Smith stays leg side and taps it to point.
Fuller delivery, on off, kept out to the cover region.
On middle, shaping inward, Jamie Smith prods forward and drives it to deep point for a single.

A huge appeal for LBW from Akash, but not entertained by the umpire. Looked a bit too high to the naked eye. Akash Deep looks at the keeper, Rishabh Pant, but says that he is not sure. This is bowled on a good length and nips in off the deck. Jamie Smith looks to play to the leg side, but misses and the ball thuds on the thigh pad. India do not review this one. The Ball Tracking later shows that the ball is passing well over the leg stump.
Ahh, this tails back in a touch, on a length, on off. Jamie Smith gets on the back foot to work it across, but inside edges onto the pads.
Good length, on the leg stump, Harry Brook glances it to deep backward square leg for a single.

And it straightaway shoots off the deck wildly! NO BALL as Akash Deep has overstepped. Seeing Brook hurtling down the track to smash the ball through the off side, Akash Deep bowls it short and it nips away with some extra bounce. Brook is beaten as the ball goes over his angled bat. He looks in some discomfort there due to the cramps in his right leg.
Goes straight on off, on a length, Brook dabs it out to point.

Drifting outside off, on a fuller length, Harry Brook gets a giant stride forward and drives this to deep point for a single. The partnership moves to 292 runs in 353 balls and England trail by 211 runs now.
Outside leg, on a length, Brook goes back and taps it to the leg side.
Fuller delivery and this is blocked off.

Oh, this goes straight on with the arm! Full and drifting across off, Harry Brook leans to play it inside out through the cover region, but misses on the outside edge. Rishabh Pant fails to collect the ball behind the stumps and it deflects off his gloves and drops to his left.
Flight given, full and on middle, Jamie Smith drives it to long on for a single.
Flighted around off, from 'round the stumps, Brook pins it down to long off for one.
Pulls the length back and drifts it on the leg stump. Harry Brook goes back in the crease and steers it away to deep square leg for a single.
FOUR! Cracking stroke that! Fired fuller and outside off, Harry Brook gets on top of the ball and smashes it through covers for a boundary.
Tossed up, on off, driven to long off for a single.
Length, on off, tapped out to the off side.
150 FOR HARRY BROOK! This is his 5th score of 150 or more in Test cricket! Brilliant stuff from the Yorkshire right-hander. Length, outside off, cut away off the back foot to deep point for a single.
Full, in front of the stumps, Brook prods forward and defends.
Dragged length, on leg again, knocked back by Smith to the bowler.
Length, served on leg, punched away to mid on.
Nice and full, blocked out.

Had to hurry! Drops short and on the leg stump. Harry Brook gets across and tucks it to the square leg region and calls Smith through for a single. Smith has to hurry and beats the rocket throw of Jadeja to the keeper. That might have stung Rishabh Pant as it was released at a rapid velocity.
Too full and on off, across the batter, Brook reverses it straight to short third.
Tossed full and outside leg, tapped to backward square leg.
Same line, same length, Smith does the same.
Full and on middle, defended straight back.
Shortish delivery, around off, Brook stays leg side of the ball and punches it to the cover-point region for a single.
Pushed into the batter, on a length, nudged to the leg side.
FOUR! Punished! Short ball, on off, Brook picks the length quite early, rocks back quickly and pulls it to deep mid-wicket for a boundary.
Length, on off, punched down to long off for a single.

A huge cheer in the Hollies Stand as that's just missed by a whisker! Washington Sundar bowls across the batter and tosses it up on middle. Harry Brook again goes for the reverse but plays all over it and is clipped on the front pad. A huge appeal for LBW and Shubman Gill eventually takes the review. Nothing on UltraEdge and the Ball Tracking shows the ball to be sliding across the off stump. NOT OUT!
Spilled down leg, Harry Brook tries to sweep that away, but misses. Rishabh Pant gets to the left to collect but he too, misses and the ball goes straight to the leg slip fielder.
Another full ball outside leg, Brook employs the reverse sweep to deep point and scampers through for the second.
Looped full, but still outside leg, Jamie Smith clips this to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Too full on the stumps, Harry Brook reverse sweeps it to deep backward point for a single.
Pitched outside leg, on a length, steered to square leg.
Lands it fuller and around off, Jamie Smith prods forward and drives it straight to mid off. And that will be TEA ON DAY 3!
Full and fired outside off, Brook slices it to deep point for a single.
On middle and Brook smothers the spin by blocking it.
Flat and full, on off, driven down by Smith to long off for a single.
Nice and full, on the stumps, tapped back to the bowler.
Length, on off, punched through covers-point for a single.
Full, tossed up on leg, Brook reverses it to deep backward point for a single.
Down the leg side, Brook lets it be.

FOUR! Poor bowling this! Pitched well outside leg, on a length. Harry Brook stays inside the line and tries to pull, but the ball catches the back of the bat and lobs over the keeper and runs behind to the fence. This brings up the 350 for England!

Full and on the stumps. Another reverse sweep, played pretty fine as the ball goes to the deep third region. Mohammed Siraj from deep backward point sprints to his left and intercepts it with the dive. Two taken.

FOUR! Innovative and effective! Sundar keeps probing on that outside-leg stump line, full in length. Harry Brook stretches forward and switches his stance. Reverse sweeps it to deep point for a boundary.
Flat and quick, on the leg stump. Jamie Smith flicks it to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Oh, this one spun sharply! Lands on middle on a fuller length. It grips and bites away from Brook who leans to defend it on the front foot. Some bounce there too as the ball beats the outside edge.
Full and flighted on middle. Blocked ahead by Brook.
Quicker through the air, full and outside off, Brook tries to smash that through covers, but ends up slicing it to short third.
Pulls the length back, does Jadeja, on off, Smith stays back and punches it down to long off for a single.
Bowled full and on middle, Smith pushes it back to Jadeja.
On a length, on off, Harry plays close to the body and cuts it to the point region for a single.
Slides in from outside leg, Jamie Smith taps it across to short mid-wicket.
Bowls full and on the leg stump. Jamie Smith knocks it straight back.
Drifts in on middle. Harry Brook reverse sweeps this full ball and gets a single at deep third.
Arm ball, outside leg on a fuller length, clipped to the backward square leg region.
Pitched outside leg on a fuller length. Harry Brook misses the flick and Pant collects it to the left.
Too full, on the stumps, drilled back to the bowler.
Nice and full, on off, Brook with the front foot defence. Another quick Jadeja over ticks by.
Gives the ball more air, and lands it full and around off, Harry Brook spreads across the crease and pushes it gently to the off side for a quick single.
Pulls the length back, does Jadeja, outside off, Jamie Smith rocks back and cuts it to the left of backward point for a single.
Slides into the batter, Smith watchfully defends it back.
Full and on off, driven to the left of the diving Nitish Kumar Reddy at short cover for a single.
Bowled into the batter, full and on middle, Brook eases it straight back to Jadeja.
Fuller delivery on off, Harry Brook strokes it down to long off for a single. This brings up the 250-run partnership between Brook and Smith. England now trail by 253 runs.
Bowls from wider angle, sliding across middle, Harry Brook takes a giant stride out and blocks.
Around the stumps now. This drifts across the batter, full and on off, Brook lunges forward and defends.
Outside off, flighted up and full, Smith plays inside out and drives it to the left of long off for a single.
Tossed up, full and on middle, Brook drills it down to long off and jogs off for a single.
Short ball, outside off, Jamie Smith rocks back and punches it to deep extra cover for a single.
Really slow on off, Harry Brook defends it out.
Touch full and on off, worked into the off side.
Around off, pushed to cover.

BEATEN! Slows it up and bowls it wide of off, making Harry Brook reach for it as he looks to drive past the cover region. The ball pitches and turns away and beats Brook on the outside edge. It deflects off Pant's gloves and KL Rahul at the first slip collects it.
Flighted fuller on middle, Brook leans on and defends.
In-drifter on middle, Harry Brook goes back and knocks it on the off side.
Attacks the off stump, Jamie Smith blocks this length ball off the back foot.
Fuller ball, on the stumps, Jamie Smith drives it to mid on.

Whoa, this one cuts in sharply from middle and stays a bit low too. Jamie Smith negotiates well as he brings his bat in front to block. Plays it from the crease and the ball rolls off the bottom half of the bat to the leg side.
Short and on top of middle, Harry Brook hangs back and wrists it to the right of mid on for a single.
Fuller and on off, Harry Brook drives it straight to wide mid off.
Just outside off, on a length, Brook dabs it with soft hands to the slip cordon.
Length, and outside off, Smith controls the cut shot to the point fielder.
Beaten! Slightly quicker through the air, outside off on a shortish length. Jamie Smith attempts the cut shot but does not lay bat on it.
Pitched full and around off, Brook drives it with the turn and gets a quick single at wide cover.
Drifting in on middle, Brook clips it to the leg side.
Full and on the stumps, pushed straight back.
'Round the stumps, floated full and on middle. Harry Brook carves it out to the left of Jadeja. He dives on the follow-through to his left and makes a half stop.
Back of a length, on middle, Harry Brook rises on the toes and turns it away to deep square leg for a single.
Siraj holds the shine inside and gets a tail into the batter, full and on off, Jamie Smith shapes for the cover drive, but gets an inside edge and the ball trickles to the leg side. They cross.
Aimed at the off pole, full in length, Jamie Smith presses forward and blocks it right under the bat.
On top of middle, on a good length, Brook hangs back and taps it across to mid-wicket. Milks a single.
Full and around off, drilled towards mid off.
Straighter and fuller, on off, Brook blocks it on the surface.
Good length, on off, punched on the rise to the cover fielder.
Nagging length, outside off, dabbed away to cover.
Good length, nips in from off, Jamie Smith shapes for the back foot punch into the off side but inside edges it. The ball then ricochets off his back thigh pad and rolls to the point region.
Spears it full and outside off, Jamie Smith is a bit late to bring his bat through the line and chops it off the inside edge as the ball rolls behind wide of the stumps.
Length, outside off, Brook cuts it behind square on the off side for a single.

Oh, some uneven bounce there! This one nips in sharply from off and bounces off the track as well. Jamie Smith is cramped up for space and the ball deflects off the thigh pad as it rolls to the backward point region. A leg bye taken.
Too full, angling on off, Harry Brook forces it to mid on.

150 FOR JAMIE SMITH! It has been a tremendous fighting innings from the youngster as he gets a warm reception from the Edgbaston crowd. Raises his bat and acknowledges the applause from his teammates and the crowd. Length, outside off, Brook runs it down to deep third for a single.
Around off, driven firmly to the right of cover. A fumble there allows the batters to cross for a single.

Oh, almost dragged on! Fired fuller and around off, it comes back in with a wobble seam, Harry Brook tries to hit it through the covers, but inside edges and the ball deflects off his pads and rolls beside the leg stump.
Hard length, outside off, Smith punches it to deep backward point and collects another single.
Mohammed Siraj is back on. Bowls it outside off, on a length, Harry Brook leans back and cuts it to deep backward point for a single.

A muted appeal for LBW, but wanes away instantly! Back of a length, cutting into the batter, around off and middle. Jamie Smith is cramped for room and plays all over it as he is rapped high on the thigh pad. Seemed to be going over the stumps.

Full and on middle, Harry Brook flicks it towards deep square leg for a single. Prasidh Krishna mops it up from deep fine leg and he fumbles a bit to pick the ball up, but recovers well to prevent any extra run.
On the stumps and Smith clips this to the mid-wicket region for a single.

FOUR! Played with real authority! Short of a good length, on off, Jamie Smith weighs on the back foot and pulls it along the turf for a boundary at deep mid-wicket. A bit of inconsistent bowling from the Indians here.
On the fourth stump, on a length, Jamie Smith hits it on the rise to short cover.
Hits the hard length, on middle and leg, Jamie Smith hops off and tucks it to mid on.
Around off, and Brook defends this full ball. An expensive over though from Nitish Kumar Reddy as 9 runs come off it. England trail by 279 runs now.
Full, outside off, driven wide of mid off for a single.
FOUR! Excellent batting this! Short, nipping in on off, Jamie Smith has enough time in the world to rock back and pull it to the left of deep mid-wicket for a boundary.

FOUR! Threads the gap with surgical precision! NKR lands this full and just around off, Jamie Smith presses forward, gets on top of the ball and drives it between the narrow gap of extra cover and mid off for a boundary.
Shortens his length, outside off, Jamie Smith cuts it to point.
Just a little shape away from outside off, Jamie Smith forces the cover drive on this fullish delivery.
Length-delivery, outside off, Brook drives it straight to the cover fielder.
Full and around off and middle, Jamie Smith pushes it to mid on and steals a quick run. Uh, oh! A late call for No Ball as Akash has overstepped.

Play and a miss! Akash bowls on a length, keeps it outside off as it nips in a touch. Jamie Smith hangs on the back foot to slash it away, but misses on the inside edge. That kept a bit low on the bounce as well.
Back of a length, outside off, punched off the back foot to short cover.
Shortish delivery, over middle, nudged off the back foot by Brook for a single at deep square leg.
Outside off, length, left alone.
Hard length, but wayward down leg. Harry Brook lets it be.
On a nagging length, on middle, Brook drops it beside the pitch on the leg side for one more.
300 comes up for England! On a back of a length, on off, Jamie drags the pull wide of mid on for a single.
A stifled appeal for LBW but it dies down quickly! Nitish looks to pitch it up but ends up serving a low full toss, on middle, Smith tries to flick it away. Gets an inside edge onto the front pad.
Outside off, on a length, Jamie knocks it to cover.
On off, on a length, Smith brings his bat out in front. Defends inside the line and gets it off the outer half towards gully.
Short and wide on off, slapped away to deep point for a single.
On a hard length, on off, Smith rides the bounce and steers it to the man at gully.
On off, on a good length, Smith defends it right under his eyes.
Keeps it nice and full, on middle, played to mid on by JS.

Half a shout for LBW! Akash Deep was the only one to go up in an appeal. Seemed to be an inside edge. Attacking the front pad, on a length, Brook with a shuffle looks to play it with a straight bat. Gets an inside edge and it does not even hit the pad as it rolls off the bat to deep fine leg for one.
Serves it on a length, on the off stump, Harry shapes up to drive it down the ground. Plays a bit in front of his body and the ball rolls off the outer half to point.
Around off, on a length, pushed down to mid off by Harry.
Slanting into the pads, on a length, Jamie brings his wrists into play and works it to the left of deep mid-wicket for a couple of runs.
A bit of shape back into the right-hander to this full ball, around off, Jamie knocks it to mid off.
On off, on a nagging length, defended on the off side.
On a back of a length, on middle, Harry turns it in front of square on the leg side for one.
FOUR! Smashed! Another full ball, wide on off, Brook brings his bottom hand into play and drills it to the right of the man at wide mid off.
Full and outside off, Brook firms the drive but straight to cover.
Delivers it on a length, outside off, Smith shoulders arms.
Full and outside off, Smith leans into the drive but gets it off the toe end towards short cover-point.
Slightly fuller, outside off, JS lunges to block.
In the corridor of off, on a short of a length, Jamie covers the line and defends.
Beaten! This jags back in, on a back of a length, just around the off stump, Smith gets on his toes to stab it down on the off side. Gets beaten on the inside edge.
Outside off, on a length, Brook firms the drive to the left of mid off for a single.
Fuller and on off, Smith mistimes the drive to extra cover.

On a good length, wide on off, Brook flays at the delivery to the left of deep point. Jamie Smith wants to come back for the second but Mohammed Siraj is quick to release the throw after covering good ground to his left and keeps it just a single.
Attacking the stumps, Brook drives this full ball towards mid on.
Angled in from wide of the crease, very full, Jamie jams it out wide of mid-wicket for one. With this single, England's deficit shrinks below 300 as the hosts trail by 299 runs.

On a length, outside off, Smith hangs his bat out away from his body. Gets an inside edge that sneaks past the stumps and rolls towards the fine leg fence. The man in the deep is a lot squarer and therefore, Rishabh Pant has to give the chase. Pant mops it up. Two runs taken.
Full and shaping away, wide on off, Smith walks closer to the line of the ball and drives it to Ravindra Jadeja at a deepish extra cover.
Short and wide on off, cut away to deep point for a single by Jamie Smith.

Edged but just short! In the channel on off, on a back of a length, Smith gets on his toes to force it through the off side. The ball seams in a touch and Smith plays it with an angled bat. Gets an inside edge that falls just short of the diving Rishabh Pant.
On a back of a length, on off, Jamie Smith hangs back for the pull. Gets an inside edge onto the back thigh.
Beaten! This is wider on off, on a good length. Almost an afterthought from Smith to play the dab. Gets beaten due to the bounce as the ball keeps a bit low.
Outside off, on the fuller side, Jamie drives well but can't get it past the man at short cover-point.
On a back of a length, around off, Smith stands tall and punches it to cover.
Outside off, left alone by Harry.

Full and attacking the stumps, Brook looks to tap it down the deck. Ekes out an inside edge onto the pads. The ball dribbles beside the pitch on the leg side and Harry wants to sneak in a single but Smith sends him back and rightly so, as Nitish was quick to get to the ball.
Very full, on off, squeezed out to cover by Brook.
Full and on off, Brook knocks it to cover.
Keeps it full and on off, Smith taps it to the left of mid on for a single. The 200-run stand comes up between these two batters!

FOUR! A tough chance goes down! Full and a hint of away shape, around off, Smith presents a straight bat but does not move his feet at all. Goes for the drive and gets an outside edge that goes low to the right of the keeper. Rishabh Pant is a bit late in getting down and sticks out his right hand. Fails to get low enough and the ball clips him on the fingertips and goes behind for a boundary.
And again! On the fuller side this time, making the batter reach for it. Brook shapes up for the drive but misses. A rare maiden over from Prasidh Krishna amidst the English offensive.
Krishna serves it wide on off again, on a good length, Brook goes after it and gets beaten as the ball sneaks under the blade.
Keeps it outside off, on a short of a length, Harry hammers it towards mid on with a flat bat but can't get it past Mohammed Siraj stationed there.
On a hard length, outside off, Harry cuts it well but straight to Karun Nair at point.
On a length, on off, Brook gets right behind it.

Harry Brook is down whilst attempting the scoop and India won't mind this! Prasidh Krishna continues to keep it away from Brook, well outside off, on a good length, Harry shuffles across the stumps for the scoop but fails to connect.

Misfield! Angled across, on the shorter side, Smith goes back and cuts it late toward backward point where Yashasvi Jaiswal gets down to make the stop but fails to read the spin. The ball spins past him and the batters collect another couple.
On a length, around leg, Smith plays the paddle to the right of deep fine leg for two more. Prasidh Krishna mops it up in the deep.
Full and on the pads, flicked to mid-wicket.
Fuller and slower, on off, Jamie Smith drills it down the ground with a straight bat to the right of long off for a couple of runs.

FOUR! A valiant effort by Siraj but in vain! Short and sliding across, Smith makes use of the angle and cuts it late. Hits it to the right of Yashasvi Jaiswal at short third. Mohammed Siraj sprints and dives to his left in the deep. Tries to push the ball away from the fence and ends up deflecting it onto the fence. Siraj's trousers get dragged down while diving and that brings about a laugh in the boisterous Hollies Stand right behind Siraj.
Tossed up, on middle, Smith defends it with a straight bat.

9TH TEST HUNDRED FOR BROOK! After falling agonisingly short on 99 in the first innings at Leeds, Brook gets to the three-figure mark this time. He has adopted a much calmer approach today compared to yesterday’s frenetic start and will now look to build on this milestone and make it a big one. This is on a hard length by Krishna, on off, Harry rides the bounce and opens the bat face to steer it to the left of the diving gully fielder. The fielder gets a hand to it but the ball still goes away for a boundary.
Keeps it wide on off, on the fuller side, Jamie Smith walks across and gets closer to the line of the ball to guide it to deep backward point for one.

Nearly dragged it back onto the stumps! Not all that wide, on a short of a length, Smith hangs back to work it through the off side. Plays it with an angled bat and the ball catches the under edge and bounces over and wide of the stumps.
On a good length, around the off stump, Smith drives it on the up but straight to cover.
On a back of a length, outside off, Harry taps it to deep backward point for one.
Width offered by Prasidh, on a good length, Brook slashes at the delivery but the ball sneaks under the angled bat.
Shorter and on off, Brook goes back and plays it late, almost off the keeper's gloves. Glides it to the left of backward point for a single.
Back to over the wicket, on a length, on off, Smith knocks it to long on for another easy single.
This is short and outside off, cut away to deep point for one more.
Bowled with a flatter trajectory, on off, Brook goes back to a full delivery but manages to pat it away to cover.
On the pads, on a length, Smith flicks it through square leg and crosses over.
From around the wicket, sliding across, full in length, Brook eases it to the left of cover for a single.
Tighter line, closer to the off stump, on a nagging length, JS stands tall and punches it to cover.

Play and a miss! Prasidh Krishna errs in line but gets away with it. Short and wide on off, Smith presses back and throws his hands at the ball. The ball does not rise as much as Smith expected it to. Sneaks under the bat and just about carries to Rishabh Pant.
Hurls it fuller, outside off, Smith drives it with a straight bat to mid off.
Beaten! This nips back in, on a good length, outside off, Smith looks to get on top of the bounce and punch it away on the off side. Gets beaten on the inside edge due to the movement off the deck.
Lands it full, outside off, Smith goes hard on the drive without any foot movement. Gets an outside edge that dribbles to the left of deep backward point for a couple of runs.
In the channel on off, on a back of a length, Brook opens the bat face slightly and guides it to deep backward point for a single.
Sundar switches to over the wicket and drops it short, on off, Brook goes back and punches it through cover-point for one more.
On the pads, Smith works this full ball through square leg for a run.
Another tossed up delivery, on middle, Smith brings his bat out in front to defend.
Fuller and slower, on middle, Brook wrists it in front of square on the leg side for a single.

Pushed across the right-hander, on the shorter side, Smith goes deep in the crease and cuts it to the right of backward point. Mohammed Siraj sprints and dives to his left in the deep. Pushes the ball away from the fence and saves a run for his side. Three runs taken.
Floated up, full and on middle, calmly pushed back to Sundar by Smith.
Fuller and on off, Harry Brook firms the drive to cover. That will be LUNCH on Day 3!
On off, on the fuller side, Jamie pushes it to long off and crosses over.
At the stumps, on a nagging length, on middle, Smith defends it well.

HUNDRED FOR SMITH! Simply superb from Jamie. A counter-attacking knock of the highest order. This is full and outside off, Smith gets down on a knee quickly and drags the sweep in front of square for a boundary. 2nd Test hundred for the English wicket-keeper batter and he gets there in 80 balls. Ben Stokes and Co. are all up on their feet in the dressing room and so is the Edgbaston crowd who have been treated to a highly entertaining show.
FOUR! Hit with real authority and Jamie Smith moves to 97! Tossed up, full and wide on off, Jamie gets down on a knee and slams it to the left of the man at mid on for a boundary.
Short and on off, Brook punches it to deep point for a single.
Pushed through, outside off, Smith goes back and defends.
Very full, on off, Brook collects an easy single with a drive to long on.
Fuller and quicker, on off, a bit of a jab by Brook. Gets an outside edge that dribbles to backward point.
On off, on the shorter side, eased down to long on with a straight bat for one by Jamie.
Short and turning into the pads, Brook flicks it in front of square for a run.
Short and on off, Brook goes back and taps it in front of backward point. He wants a quick single but Smith sends him back.
Full and on middle, pushed down to long on for a single by HB.
A bit of turn, on off, on a nagging length, Brook steers it to backward point.
At the stumps, on a length, blocked out,
Full and around off, driven to cover again by Brook but this time, Nitish Kumar Reddy manages to stop it with a dive to his right.

FOUR! Gets it through!
