Floated up, around off, Brook presses forward and eases himself into the drive. A regulation stop for Nitish Kumar Reddy at cover to his left but he is late in getting down and the ball gets past him for a boundary. A hand of apology straight away from Nitish. These two have now added 150 runs together.
Attacking the front pad from around the wicket, on a length, Brook gets his bat out in front to block.
Around off, on a nagging length, kept out with a straight bat.
Shorter and on off, Brook drops it to the right of mid-wicket and gets to the other end quickly.
Full and on off, driven down to long on for a single by JS.
Floated up, on off, Smith steps out and taps it back to Sundar.
On a nagging length, just outside the off stump, Harry pushes it to the right of point for a single.
On off, a bit of turn, on a length, Harry defends it out.
Short and on off, Harry taps it to the left of cover for a single.
Fuller and slower, just around the off stump, Harry Brook is solid in defence.
Sprayed on the pads, on a nagging length, nudged to mid-wicket.
On off, dabbed down on the off side by Harry.

FOUR! In the air but in the gap! Fractionally short by Jadeja, on middle, Harry Brook presses on the back foot and plays it with a flat bat. Hits it aerially to the right of long on. Mohammed Siraj at long on, goes after it but his chase goes in vain.
Short and attacking the off stump, solidly defended by Brook.
Drifting away, on off, on a length, Jamie presents a straight bat to block but plays inside the line. Gets it off the outer half to backward point.
At the stumps, Brook plays this full ball to long on and crosses over.

WAS THAT A CHANCE? Fuller and quicker, on off, Jamie Smith gets his hands through and smashes it down the deck. Hits it low towards Sundar and Washington gets low but the ball bounces just short and bursts through his hands and rolls behind him. They cross.

FOUR! Put away with absolute ease! A half-tracker from Sundar, outside off, Jamie Smith has all the time in the world to rock back and slap it to the right of Mohammed Siraj at deep point for a boundary.
Nicely slowed down, on off, Brook presses forward to drive this full ball. Miscues it off the inner half towards long on for a single.
Short and wide on off, Harry Brook waits back and punches it to the right of deep point for a couple of runs.
This is on the shorter side, outside off, Jamie Smith goes on the back foot and stays leg side of the ball for the cut. Gets an outside edge that dribbles towards backward point.
NO BALL! Ravindra Jadeja has overstepped! Darted in, on off, Harry works this full ball to deep cover for a run.
Very full, outside off, knocked past cover for a single by Jamie.
Play and a miss! This is bowled slower and wider, outside off, Jamie goes for the drive away from his body but the ball grips and turns past the outside edge.
Back to bowling it flat and short, on off, Smith gets back and taps it to cover-point.
Bowls it nice and full, on off, Smith gets forward for the drive but can't get it past the diving Nitish Kumar Reddy at cover.
Drops it short, on off, Jamie goes back and pats it back to Jadeja.
Beaten! This does not turn, on a length, outside off, Harry Brook defends with his bat close to the front pad. Ends up playing inside the line and gets beaten on the outside edge.
Pushed through, outside off, Harry follows the line of the ball and guides it to backward point.
Tossed up, fuller and outside off, Jamie pats it down to long on for a single.
Flat and short, outside off, cut away to deep point for a single by Harry.
Shorter and around off, Brook stays back to block.
On off, on a nagging length, Brook gets forward to defend.
Fuller and on off, Smith pushes it down the deck where Jadeja dives to his left to cut it off.
Angled in, short and on middle, jabbed to mid-wicket off the back foot.
SIX! WOW! Dispatched with disdain! Floated up, on off, Jamie Smith puts the dancing shoes on and swings through. Thumps it back over the sight screen for a biggie.

FOUR! Jamie Smith continues to find the boundaries! Ravindra Jadeja errs in length as this is a bit too short and outside off, Smith presses on the back foot quickly and cuts it to the right of backward point and beats the man in the deep to his left. The 200 is up for England in no time.
Short and on off, punched to deep point for a single.
Full and just outside the off stump, Brook drops it to the left of cover and wants a quick single but the fielder gets to the ball quickly.
This is shorter and quicker, outside off, Smith backs away to unleash the cut but gets beaten on the outside edge.
Around off, on a nagging length, dabbed down by Smith.
Pushed through, on off, Smith stabs it down on the off side.

Shorter and on off, Jamie Smith goes on the back foot and chops it down to the left of backward point. Washington Sundar sprints and dives at deep third to prevent the boundary from reaching the fene. Two runs taken.

FOUR! Back-to-back boundaries! This is tossed up again but a bit wider by Sundar on spotting Jamie come down the track. Smith extends his hands and cracks it along the ground between cover and mid off for four more.
FOUR! Smith welcomes Sundar with a boundary! Floaty delivery, full and wide on off, Jamie gets his hands through and creams the drive to the left of mid off for a boundary.
FOUR! Nicely done! Fuller and slower, around off, Harry Brook reaches out in front and gets inside the line. Plays the lap over the keeper and collects a boundary.
Full and on off, defended off the front foot.
Fuller and slower, on off, Brook blocks it out.
Nearly dragged it back onto the stumps! Short and outside off, Harry hangs back to punch it away. Gets an inside edge that sneaks past the stumps.

DROPPED by Shubman Gill! A sharp chance but India needed that to be converted! Jadeja drags the length back slightly and this is a bit wide on off, Brook goes for the expansive drive away from his body. Does not manage to get to the pitch of the ball and the ball spins away just a touch to catch the outside edge. Brook went hard at it and therefore, the ball went behind quickly and it climbed onto Shubman. Gill got his hands in front of his face, more as an evasive action and it went over his hands to ping him on the cap before it rolled behind for a couple.
Tossed up, on off, Brook drives it straight to extra cover.

FOUR! Gap picked with surgical precision! Prasidh Krishna goes short but this does not trouble Smith at all. Jamie gets it at a good height, around middle. Pulls it all along the ground and right between deep backward square leg and deep square leg.
Around off, on a shortish length, Jamie Smith hops and is airborne while playing the shot. Cuts it well but it goes straight to backward point.
Short and following the batter as he backs away, Harry Brook taps the ball on its head and steers it to deep third for one more.
On middle, on a shortish length, Jamie goes for the pull but he once again swings early. Gets an inside edge that rolls down to deep fine leg for one.

Miscued but safe! Prasidh goes into the wicket and gets the ball high enough to trouble the batter, around leg, Smith tries to get inside the line to help the pull down towards deep fine leg but is early into the shot. The ball lobs off the gloves but drops safely beside the pitch on the leg side.
Delivers it on a back of a length, on middle, Harry Brook pulls it along the ground to deep square leg for a single.
Goes a bit wide on the crease, full and on middle, Brook drives it in front of mid on for a quick single.
Keeps it full and straight, on off, Harry plays it back to Jadeja.
Fired in, full and on off, solidly blocked out by Brook.
Full and attacking the stumps, knocked with a straight bat to long off for a single.
Slanting in, on off, on a nagging length, JS pushes it to the left of cover. Brook wants to sneak in a quick single but Jamie sends him back.
Around off, Jamie presses forward to tap it to cover.
Prasidh spots Brook backing away and follows him with a hard-length delivery. Harry manages to open the bat face and glide it to the left of deep third for a couple of runs. 11 runs off the over!
On off, on a shortish length, on off, Harry drags the pull to mid-wicket.

CHANCE? No, wide of the man at square leg. Prasidh Krishna bangs it into the wicket, on off, Jamie Smith sets up for the pull but is early into the shot. Gets it right off the toe end of the bat and it goes uppishly towards square leg where Karun Nair leaps to his right but the ball evades his outstretched right hand. They cross.
Prasidh goes into the wicket but only gets it as high as the waist, on off and middle, Brook pulls it to the right of deep square leg for a run.
Banged in short again, around the ribs, Smith plays a controlled pull all along the ground to the left of deep fine leg for a single.

SIX! 'Catch it' is the call but it sails over! Prasidh Krishna bends his back, digs it in short, around leg, Smith swivels inside the line and hooks it well over Ravindra Jadeja at deep fine leg for a six.

FIFTY FOR SMITH! A counter-attacking knock after England were under pressure early in the day. First half-century of the series for Jamie and his 5th overall in Test cricket. This is floated up, fuller and on middle, Jamie Smith steps out and clips it to the right of mid on for a single.
Flatter and fuller, on off, Jamie stays leg side and guides it to backward point.
Sliding on with the arm, short and around leg, Jamie nudges it to mid-wicket.
Drags the length back, on off, Smith looks to punch it past the man at silly point but Yashasvi Jaiswal gets low to make the stop on the bounce.
Angled in, full and straight, Jamie Smith blocks it out with a straight bat.
With a slip and a silly point in place, this is darted in from around the wicket, short and on off, Brook presses back and pushes it wide of point for a single.

FOUR! Cracked down the ground! Make that 23 runs off this over! Krishna pitches it fuller and around off, Jamie Smith leans forward and smacks the ball straight down the ground for a boundary. Jamie Smith has leapfrogged to 49 off just 38 balls, and England now trail by 427 runs.
WIDE! Playing with the batter's ego here! Too short and over the head height outside off. Jamie Smith lets it be. Wide called.

FOUR! Brilliant batting this! The counterattack from England is on and Ben Stokes enjoys this aggression from the dressing room! Moves outside leg, does Smith and Prasidh Krishna follows him by banging it short and on the leg stump. Jamie Smith backs away and pulls it hard to deep mid-wicket for another boundary. This is aggression personified.

FOUR! A flurry of boundaries for Smith! Krishna gets a bit too predictable as he again bowls a short ball, on off. Jamie Smith has enough time to get on top of it, and he pulls it to the right of mid-wicket for a boundary.

SIX! What a shot! Bangs it short on middle, Jamie Smith picks the length early, creates a stable base and pulls it aerially. Clears deep square leg with ease as the ball sails into the stands for a six.
FOUR! Clear intent by these two! Short ball, on the bodyline, Jamie Smith stands tall, swivels and pulls it behind square on the leg side for a boundary.
Around off, forced towards the right of mid off by Smith.
Siraj bowls with a cross seam, 140 kph, on a length, Harry Brook gets right behind it and blocks it out.
Good length, at off, stabbed on the strip.

FOUR! Cracked down the ground! Make that 23 runs off this over! Krishna pitches it fuller and around off, Jamie Smith leans forward and smacks the ball straight down the ground for a boundary. Jamie Smith moves to 49 and England trail by 427 runs.
WIDE! Playing with the batter's ego here! Too short and over the head height outside off. Jamie Smith lets it be. Wide called.

FOUR! Brilliant batting this! The counterattack from England is on and Ben Stokes enjoys this aggression from the dressing room! Moves outside leg, does Smith and Prasidh Krishna follows him by banging it short and on the leg stump. Jamie Smith backs away and pulls it hard to deep mid-wicket for another boundary. This is aggression personified.

FOUR! A flurry of boundaries for Smith! Krishna gets a bit too predictable as he again bowls a short ball, on off. Jamie Smith has enough time to get on top of it, and he pulls it to the right of mid-wicket for a boundary.

SIX! What a shot! Bangs it short on middle, Jamie Smith picks the length early, creates a stable base and pulls it aerially. Clears deep square leg with ease as the ball sails into the stands for a six.
FOUR! Clear intent by these two! Short ball, on the bodyline, Jamie Smith stands tall, swivels and pulls it behind square on the leg side for a boundary.
Around off, forced towards the right of mid off by Smith.
Siraj bowls with a cross seam, 140 kph, on a length, Harry Brook gets right behind it and blocks it out.
Good length, at off, stabbed on the strip.

FOUR! He has been really productive through the covers! Overpitched from Siraj, just around off, Harry Brook cracks the cover drive through the gap for a boundary. Holds his pose for a bit as he enjoys it racing away. With this, the 50-run stand comes up between Brook and Smith.
Back of a length, angled onto the pads, Jamie Smith works it towards deep square leg for a single.
Slants it towards the leg stump, on a good length, Jamie Smith brings his bat in front and knocks it to short mid on.
Angling on middle, Jamie Smith pushes this full ball to the left of mid off.
Pitched fuller and on off, Brook forces it down to mid off.
Makes the batter play at it as Prasidh bowls it full and on off, Jamie Smith works this through backward point for a single.
Length-delivery, outside off, punched to the covers.
BEATEN! A pearl f a delivery from 'Skiddy'. This one straightens up a bit from off, on a length. Jamie Smith plays at it but inside the line of the ball and is beaten past the outside edge.
Full and straight on off, Smith drives it down to mid off.

Quick tap and run! A tight single though! Fuller and on the fourth stump, Harry Brook presses foward and defends it in front of the point region and calls his partner through for a hurried single. KL Rahul charges quickly on the ball and has a shy at the batting end. Smith gets home.
Hard length, on middle and leg, Harry Brook tucks it to deep square leg for a single.
Back of a length, on off, Brook stabs it out to mid on.
Outside off, on a length, chopped wide of gully for a single.

Excellent running between the wickets and that will be FIFTY FOR HARRY BROOK! His 13th half century in Test cricket! Siraj hurls it fuller and outside off, Harry Brook leans on top of the ball and slaps it past cover and point. It slows down on the way to the ropes and is chased by Yashasvi Jaiswal from the cover region. Brook hurries to get to the non-striker's end to complete the third run and gets there before the throw from the deep. The lad from Yorkshire has looked really proactive and has kept himself busy on the crease despite wickets tumbling at the other end. England will hope that he plays for long and converts this into triple figures.
Attacks the stumps, keeps it full, Harry Brook defends it right under his eyes.
No Ball for overstepping! Length ball, around off, blocked out by Brook.
Change of ends for Mohammed Siraj! Slanting across on the leg stump, Jamie Smith steers the length ball to deep square leg for a single.
Hits the deck hard, outside off, slashed by Jamie to deep backward point for a single.
Hard length, on off, Brook plays it close to the body and crunches it through backward point for a single.

EDGED, FOUR! Just goes through the vacant area as there's only one slip and a gully in place! Back of a length, lifting up outside off, Harry Brook leans back to cut it square on the off side, but gets off the outside edge and the ball runs through the vacant second slip for a boundary at deep third.
On the stumps, Harry Brook blocks it on the pitch.
Good length, nipping in, Harry Brook pushes it to mid off.
Prasidh Krishna is brought into the attack now. Goes short and around off, Jamie Smith climbs over it and pulls it to the mid-wicket region for a single.
Good length, on middle, Jamie Smith nudges it off the toes to deep mid-wicket and collects a single. The partnership moves to run-a-ball 32 as England trail by 471 runs.
FOUR! Just liberates his arms! Pitched full and wide of off, nipping away. Jamie Smith gets a good stride forward and drives it through cover-point for a cracking four.
Short length, outside off, punched off the back foot to wide mid off.
Straighter and fuller, on off, driven straight to the mid off fielder.

Angled onto the pads, on a length, Smith tucks it along the turf in the vast vacant deep mid-wicket region. The fielder from mid on is after it and the man from deep square leg converges and mops it up. Two runs taken.
The stumps are on attack, on a good length. Jamie Smith hangs on the back foot and defends it out to mid on.
Cuts back in from off, on a length, Harry Brook plays with a straight bat and blocks it out.
Nips in from off, on a length, Brook plays it on the up and bumps it on the surface.

On a length, just outside off, Jamie Smith gets on the back foot and punches it to pierce the cover gap but the fielder there dives to his right and parries the ball to the mid off fielder. A single taken.
Good length, at off, Jamie Smith prods forward and drives it to wide mid off.
Short of a good length, jagging in towards middle, Jamie Smith hangs back and punches it to mid on.
Short and on top of middle. Jamie Smith plays it closer to the body and taps it out to the off side.
Length-delivery, shaping inwards from off. Jamie Smith steers it through mid-wicket. Siraj chases it down before the ropes as he slides and saves a run for his side. Three taken.

FOUR! He has picked the length in a trice! An attempted bouncer, outside off, and almost dies on the bounce. Jamie Smith waits for it, weighing on the back foot and pulls it towards deep mid-wicket. It is off the toe end but has enough wheels to beat the chase of the mid on fielder and run into the fence.
Length, on middle and leg, tucked away to deep square leg for a single.

Oh, nearly! Akash bowls on that inviting line as he hurls it outside off on a length. Harry Brook does not lean fully towards the ball and goes for a wafty cover drive with an angled bat. Gets beaten as the ball shapes away.
Short of a good length, around off, angling in. Harry Brook lets the ball arrive and dabs it onto the pitch.

Hard length, on off, cutting in a touch. Jamie Smith rises with the bounce and punches it with a straight bat. Akash Deep bends low to his right on the follow-through, but not enough to stop the ball. It rolls to the right of mid off and Smith gets a single. Cheers from the crowd as the 100 comes up for England!

FOUR! A loosener from Siraj and gets the treatment! Shortish delivery, but sliding down the leg stump line. Harry Brook gets inside the line and just helps the ball on its way to the fence at deep fine leg for a boundary.
The nip-backer on the leg stump line, Jamie Smith hops across and nudges it fine towards the leg side for a single.
On a back of a length, on middle, Harry Brook plays with soft hands and turns it between square leg and mid-wicket for a single.
Touch fuller and on the off stump, Harry Brook presses forward and defends it on the pitch.
Almost a half-tracker, outside off, Harry Brook opens the bat face and works it to the point region.

FOUR! Magnificent shot! Slightly fuller from Siraj, just around off, nipping away. Harry Brook gets on top of the ball and swings his bat through the line. Finds the gap through covers and collects a boundary.
Length-delivery, around off, Jamie Smith plays from his crease and blocks it out.
Back of a length, just outside off, Jamie Smith defends it out to the off side.
Just outside off, swinging in a touch, on a length, Jamie Smith watches the ball closely and shoulders arms at it.
Short of a length, outside off, punched hard towards the point region, where Jadeja moves to his right to stop it.
Aims the off stick, on a length, Jamie Smith hops off and defends it off the back foot. Came more off the inner half of the bat.
Hard length, on top of middle, Harry Brook stands tall and steers it to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Tailing in on middle on a fuller length, Jamie Smith flicks it off the inner half of the bat to the mid-wicket region. An excellent over from Siraj this as he gets two big wickets.
FOUR! A boundary on the Hat Trick ball! Siraj serves it fuller and just around off, Jamie Smith prods forward and cracks the drive down the ground for a boundary.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! Mohammed Siraj does it again as he removes the English skipper on his very first ball. A picture-perfect start for the Indians as half of England's side is back in the dressing room on 84. A well-directed bumper from Siraj this, around the left shoulder and kicking off the deck. Ben Stokes is taken aback by that excessive lift off the deck and hangs his bat in an evasive action, but doesn't manage to drop his wrists down in time. Hence, a faint edge is found and the ball carries back to the keeper. Rishabh Pant takes a regulation catch and Ben Stokes departs for a golden duck. Siraj gets his third wicket and his joy knows no bounds.
Ben Stokes (c) c R Pant b M Siraj 0 (1b 0x4 0x6)

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! Siraj provides a huge breakthrough, early in the day for India. And it's the big fish Joe Root. Siraj runs full tilt and slides the ball on the leg stump line. It curves further down leg on a length with some lateral movement. Joe Root is strangled down the leg side as he looks to flick. Only manages to get an inside edge and Rishabh Pant does the rest behind the wickets. Dives to his left and completes a low catch. A big appeal for caught behind and the finger goes up! The Indians celebrate in unison and Root's expressions indicate that he knows he has nicked it and hence, does not opt for a review. He is devastated as he walks back to the dugout.
Joe Root c R Pant b M Siraj 22 (46b 2x4 0x6)
Tails in on the leg stump, Harry Brook clips the full ball to deep backward square leg for a single. There's some visible movement.
Siraj finally gets his run up sorted and goes full and on off, Harry Brook pushes it to short mid on.
Attacks the off pole, full in length, Joe Root meets the ball under his eyes and knocks it to the leg side with soft hands. England trail by 504 runs.

FOUR! First runs off the bat on Day 3! A glorious stroke from Root. Akash gets a bit of a tail into the batter, full and on middle and leg, Joe Root tilts forward, finds the middle of the bat, and flicks it through the mid-wicket region for a boundary.
Identical length, but fairly outside off, Root does not offer any shot.
Back of a length, at off, punched to the off side.
Ahh, this shapes away from the batter. Length, cutting away from off, Joe Root plays inside the line of the ball and it whispers past his outside edge.

Hits the deck hard, outside off, Root gets behind it, lets the ball come and blocks it off the back foot. Dear me! Another No Ball for overstepping. Akash will have to get his footing sorted. He did struggle with the landing area on Day 2.
Angles into the body, does Akash, on a good length, Joe Root opens up on the back foot and punches it straight back.
Oh, dear! No Ball to begin the day as Akash has overstepped. On a length, just outside off, straighter one, Joe Root presses in to defend it under the bat.

Well bowled and equally well played! A proper bumper from Prasidh on the final delivery, bowling it over off and at a brisk pace. Harry Brook watches it all the way and ducks under it. That will be STUMPS ON DAY 2!

Oh, what happened here? Harry Brook with a very awkward moment and he nearly falls onto the stumps and its all happening out there in the middle. Prasidh Krishna bangs it into the deck and bowls it a bit short around off. Brook hops back to defend but jams it back onto the deck and the ball sees to be bouncing back onto the stumps. Brook reacts quickly and tries to shoulder it away and somehow manages to avoid the stumps.

FOUR! Well-controlled from Harry Brook and the 50-run stand is up between these two. Hard length a bit wide outside off, Brook presses back and stabs the cut late and behind the gully fielder for a boundary.

Oh, a top edge now and even Joe Root thought he's a goner there. Prasidh Krishna slips in a short ball around off, gets it to jump off the deck. Root goes for the swivel-pull but miscues it and gets a top edge that doesn't carry to deep mid-wicket. Just a single then.
On a good length and in te channel, Root strides in and punches it towards cover.
Fuller in length and around off, angling in, Joe Root punches it back to the bowler.
Tosses this one up fuller and outside off, Brook drives it to covers. A maiden from Jadeja!
Fired in full and straight, Brook jams it back towards the bowler.
A bit fuller and around off, a hint of turn away from the right-hander as well. Harry Brook leans on to drive and mistimes it to covers.
Flatter delivery again and around off, Brook taps it away into the off side.
Flatter one around off, gripping a touch. Harry Brook backs away and cts it late and straight to gully.
A bit more round arm and angled in at the stumps, Brook gets forward well and blocks it off.
Good length on the fifth stump line, left alone by Root but that one shot up off the deck.
Back of a length and over off, Root presses back and drops it down towards mid on.
Oh, an inside edge! Goes fuller and bowls it a tad wide outside off. Root gets a stride across and looks to push but doesn't quite get his bat out in front and gets an inside edge onto the pads.
Pitches the ball up and around off, Joe Root stays solid in defense.
Hard length on the fourth stump line, Root covers the line and blocks it off.
Full of a good length on off, angling in, Brook stays compact and nudges it away to square leg for a quick single.
Full on middle and leg, eased down to long on for a single by Brook.
Angles this one in towards the legs, Brook leans on and defends it with a fairly straight bat.
Relatively full and straight, gets some drift again, Brook leans on to block.
Nagging length, around off and middle, drifting in, Brook leans on and tentatively keeps it out.
Tossed up, very full and on middle, clipped away in front of mid-wicket and into the deep for a run.
Slightly flighted, a bit full and around off, Root lunges and blocks it off.
No ball! Starts off with a cardinal sin, does Jadeja, as he oversteps. Around the wicket and bowled short and wide, this is cut away to deep point for a single.
Full and wide, very wide outside off and Root lets it through to the keeper.
Hard length outside off, Root walks across to the off side and advances before blocking it off to the off side.
Full again but on the legs, Brook flicks it away off the pads and to deep square leg for a single.
Full and outside off,  hint of away movement, Brook leans on and strokes it to wide mid off.
Nagging length, in the channel, Brook stays back and taps the ball down towards backward point.
On a good length and wide outside off to begin. Harry Brook stands tall and looks to lace the cover drive but mistimes it towards cover.
Just a bit of tail into the batter, on off and middle, Joe Root negotiates well by blocking it right under his eyes.
Around off, on the back of a length, Joe Root weighs on the back foot and taps it out to the point region.
Keeps the length full, and the line is on middle and leg, Joe Root plays it with soft hands and pushes it to mid on.
On top of middle, on the good length, Harry Brook hops off and dabs it to the mid-wicket region for a quick run.
On the off stump, on a length, Harry Brook blocks it off the back foot.

FOUR! 'Skiddy' is greeted with a glorious boundary! A loosener to start with from Krishna, fuller and on the leg stump. Harry Brook tilts forward and flicks this to the right of mid-wicket for four runs.
Pitched outside leg again, but the length is shortened. Harry Brook steers it past square leg for a single. This partnership moves on to 36 (44) and England trail by 526 runs.
Siraj changes the angle of his attack by coming from around the stumps and Root plays with an open stance to that. Full and outside leg. Root clips it to deep square leg for a single.
Speared full at 136 kph, on the fourth stump, Joe Root strides across and solidly defends it.
Ahh, that kept low and skidded as well. Length, on middle, Joe Root is squared up and manages to bring his bat in front to stab it onto the surface.
FOUR! Helped away! Hands on heads for Siraj! This curves back in a long way from middle. Joe Root lets the ball arrive at him and tickles it to the vacant deep fine leg for a boundary.
Short of a length, around off, Joe Root punches it to cover.

A PEARLER! Quite casual there from Brook! Akash hits the deck hard, and keeps it just outside off. Gets a good bit of bounce as the ball nips in a touch. Harry Brook stays back and lazily pokes at it, playing away from his body, and is beaten past the outside edge.
On off, blocked off the back foot.
Short and going down leg. Brook tries to pull but misses. That kept low on the bounce a bit as well.
Hard length, 141 kph, outside off, punched off the back foot to backward point.
FOUR! Placed to perfection! Good length, angling on the leg stump. Harry Brook covers the line and nudges this into the gap, and along the ground for a boundary at deep square leg.
Back of a length, on off, cutting back in a touch. Joe Root gets right behind it and punches it to the left of cover for a single.
Switches to around the stumps and bangs it short, on the leg stump line. Harry Brook steps down the track to give it a whack but is beaten by the bounce.
Attacks the off stump, full in length, Brook defends it off the inside edge as the ball goes on the bounce to short leg.
A bit full and outside off, worked to the cover region.

SIX! Aggression from Brook! That is some shot! Siraj fires it full and on off, Harry Brook skips down to the pitch of the ball and with no intention of keeping it along the ground, expands his arms and sails it over deep extra cover for a huge six. The 50 is up for England.
On top of middle, on the good length. Harry Brook hangs back and tucks it to short mid-wicket. Washington Sundar with a diving stop to his right.
Fuller and straighter on off, Brook presents a solid front foot block.
Good-length delivery, outside off, Harry Brook places this into the point region for another single.
1 run.
No Ball for overstepping! Aims the off pole, does Deep, on a length, Root lets the ball come at him and taps it off the back foot to short cover for a quick run.

Short of a good length, angling on the leg stump. Joe Root hops across and steers it to the widish deep fine leg. Prasidh Krishna from deep square leg mops it up to his right with a sprint and keeps the batters down to a couple.
Full and on the stumps, Root pushes it down to mid on.

FOUR LEG BYES! Sprayed onto the pads, on a length, Root looks to glance it across but misses and the ball grazes the front thigh pad and deflects to the left of the diving Pant who fails to collect the ball. It races behind him to the fence at deep fine leg.
Full and keeps a bit low, outside off, worked to backward point.
Length, on middle and leg, flicked to deep backward square leg for a brace.
Hard length outside off, Brook taps the ball away towards point.
On a good length and on off, Brook looks to drive straight but gets it again off the inner half of the bat towards mid on.
Short of a length and over middle, nudged away to mid-wicket.

FOUR! Gets it away! Back of a length and around off, Harry Brook steps down the track and tries to bludgeon it away. The bat turns in his hands and the ball goes off the inner half of the blade through mid off. Yashasvi Jaiswal gives a long chase and even puts in the dive but the ball beats him to the fence.

No ball! Good length around off, this one nips back in a fair bit. Harry Brook gets an inside edge onto the pads and the ball goes behind short leg. Another no ball from Siraj and he seems unhappy with the call, but it is clearly a no ball as confirmed on the replay.
No ball! On a good length again around middle, pushed away to mid on and Mohammed Siraj has just over-extended here and bowls a front-foot no ball.
On a good length, attacking middle stump, Brook defends it down to mid on.

Siraj with a slingy delivery, bowling it slightly full and angling it well in towards the stumps. Harry Brook looks to defend down the line but is beaten past the inside edge and gets rapped on the pads. A loud appeal for LBW but turned down by the umpire. Actually the ball has been caught by the fielder at third slip by diving forward and the Indians form a huddle to discuss a potential review. Mohammed Siraj thinks it has hit the pads and Shubman Gill does review it. There seemed to be two noises and the third umpire checks UltraEdge first but finds that the ball went past the inside edge and straight into the pads. Ball Tracking comes up with umpire's call on hitting the wickets and it stays NOT OUT.
Wider on the crease and shorter at the hips, tucked away down to long leg for a single.
Too loose again! A tad short and well outside off, Harry Brook plays away from the body with no foot movement but the ball stays low and goes under the willow.
A bit fuller now, pitching outside off and darting back in, Brook plays it late and with soft hands towards gully.
Wider on the crease and a bit shorter, angled into off, Brook blocks it off.
Length ball, a smidge fuller and honing in on off and middle, Brook stays back and defends it really late.
Good-length delivery around off, Root walks across and clips it away through mid-wicket for one.
Off the pads! Fuller and sliding down leg, Harry Brook looks to flick but the ball brushes the pads and falls short of a diving Rishabh Pant.
On a hard length and over middle, Brook fails to get it away on the leg side.
Brook trying to put some pressure back onto the bowler. Hard length outside off, Brook advances but has to adjust and jams it down towards gully.
Beats the outside edge again! Good length in the channel, slightly wider and shaping away. Harry Brook plays an attempted cover drive but his feet go nowhere and he is beaten once again.
Oh, genuine swing now for Siraj! Relatively full and just outside off, shaping away, Harry Brook tentatively plays at this one and gets beaten on the outside edge.

OUT! EDGED AND GONE AGAIN! Mohammed Siraj gets a well-deserved wicket as Zak Crawley falls and England in deep trouble at 25 for 3. Siraj holds the line as he bowls it in the channel and drags the length a few inches shorter than a good length. Crawley opts to stay put and push at it instead of hopping back and jars at the delivery, inducing an outside edge. The ball goes quickly to first slip, where Karun Nair squats down and reverse-cups it nicely. Crawley looked good but departs for 19 (30).
Zak Crawley c K Nair b M Siraj 19 (30b 3x4 0x6)
Short of a good length over middle and leg, worked away through square leg for a single.

FOUR! Just wide of that catching fielder and goes all the way. Full on middle, angling in, Zak Crawley flicks it firmly but uppishly and to the right of Shubman Gill at short mid-wicket. Gill dives across but the ball goes wide and races away into the fence.
On a good length and around off, Zak Crawley just leans into the delivery and taps it through extra cover for a couple of runs.
Good length, on a tight line around off, solidly defended by Zak.
Hard length around off, cutting back in, Crawley looks to defend off the front foot but gets an inside edge towards short fine leg.
Hits the deck hard and bowls it over middle, Crawley gets half a stride forward and nudges it across to the leg side.

Oh, nearly an outside edge! Full of a good length and in the channel outside off, gets it to nibble away with some additional bounce. Root looks to drive off the back foot but is well beaten. A bit loose from Root.
Back of a length and outside off, Joe Root presses up on his toes and taps it down into the off side just past the strip.
Good length, angling into the pads, flicked away down to deep square leg for a single.
Inside edge! The in-between length on off and middle, slanting in, Zak Crawley plays around it a bit and gets a faint inside edge onto the pads.
Just back of a length and around off, Crawley plays it with a straight bat and defends it down the line.
Down the wrong line, around leg, Root tucks the ball down to long leg and turns the strike over.
On a hard length around the pads, Crawley walks inside the line to flick but misses and wears it high on the pads.
Good length angling down leg, tickled down to fine leg for a single by Root.
Short of a good length angled in from middle, Joe Root presses back and shovels it away through mid-wicket for a couple of runs to get off the mark.
Back of a length and around off, Root gets across to cover the line and blocks it down the pitch.
Hard length again, this time on off and darted in, Root hops up and taps it down to mid on.
Hard length, pitching on middle and angling in a fair bit. Joe Root tries to get inside the line and flick but is beaten past the inside edge and gets hit on the pads.
Back-to-back maidens for India! Bowls this one full and wide, inviting the drive. Zak Crawley plays a solid cover drive but hits it straight to short cover.
Good length around off, angled in and then just straightening, watchfully defended by Zak.
Length ball around off, Zak Crawley stands fairly outside his crease and solidly blocks it off.
Good-length delivery, slanting in from middle, Crawley taps it across to mid-wicket.
Fullish length and outside off, shaping away, Crawley shows the full face of the blade and pats it down to mid off.
Pitches it up on off stump, trying to shape it away, Crawley defends it right under the eyes.
No hat-trick but a double-wicket maiden from Akash Deep. Nagging length in and around off, trying to nip it away. Joe Root leans on and watchfully blocks it into the off side.

OUT! EDGED AND GONE! Wow, what a delivery from Akash Deep and Ollie Pope departs on the very first ball. Akash comes back to over the wicket for the right-hander and serves the ball right up on the off stump, forcing the batter to play at it. Pope makes the mistake of playing across the line and the ball just nips away off the deck and squares him up. The outside edge is found yet again and the ball goes quickly towards second slip. KL Rahul reacts well to his right but fails to pouch it on the first attempt. KL manages to keep his composure and snaffles it on the second attempt. England have been rocked early, 13 for 2 now as the other centurion from the previous match, Ollie Pope, departs for a golden duck.
Ollie Pope c K Rahul b A Deep 0 (1b 0x4 0x6)

OUT! CAUGHT! Back onto the field and straight into the thick of things, is Shubman Gill and what a catch that is! Fine delivery from Akash Deep as he holds the length around the top of the stumps and bowls it in the corridor of uncertainty, gets this one to nip off the deck as well. Ben Duckett hangs back and looks to push at it but the away movement means the outside edge is found and it goes wide of third slip where Gill springs down to his left and takes a stunning catch with both hands. The centurion from the last match departs for a duck and England are 13/1!
Ben Duckett c S Gill b A Deep 0 (5b 0x4 0x6)
Hard length again, on middle and this one slides back in with the angle. Duckett looks to flick but plays all around it and gets hit on the thigh pad.
Goes a bit wider on the crease and bowls it on a hard length around off, Duckett hops back and tucks it wide of mid on.
Pitched-up delivery, in and around off, Ben Duckett defends it on the front foot.
Short of a good length and outside off, gets good carry on that, does Siraj as Crawley shoulders arms.
Good length around the top of off and holding its line, Zak Crawley defends it from the crease.
Lovely length, not all that full and in the channel, swinging it away. Crawley leaves it alone.
Very full and on off, this one shapes away nicely, Crawley pushes it back to the bowler.
Hard length over middle, looking to slant the ball in, Crawley taps it around the corner on the leg side.
Good-length delivery, just outside off and swinging away, Crawley plays it late and with the swing to the left of Ravindra Jadeja. Jadeja makes a sharp stop.
No ball! A hint of swing away from the right-hander. Pitched up in the channel and nibbling away, Zak Crawley stays put and watchfully defends towards gully. Siraj oversteps and a No Ball is called.
Akash immediately goes around the wicket to the left-hander and hones in on the off stump line. Ben Duckett watchfully defends.

Fuller in length again and on the pads, flicked away down to deep backward square leg for a single. Also, it seems like Akash Deep isn't happy with the landing area and both he and Siraj have a chat with umpire Chris Gaffaney, who thinks there isn't much of an issue and Akash walks back to the top of his mark.
FOUR! That's too easy for the batter. Slightly overpitched and around off, Zak Crawley gets a good stride into the ball and punches it back past the bowler for yet another boundary. Top shot!
No ball! Better line now, on off and middle and Crawley blocks it off. However, Akash has overstepped and it will be a No Ball.
On a good length and at the stumps, a bit too straight and Crawley clips it away wide of deep backward square leg for a couple of easy runs.

FOUR! A gorgeous stroke to get going from Zak Crawley. Pitches up around off, looking for some swing but the ball slides right on. Crawley leans on and plays it straight back past the bowler for a boundary to get off the mark.
On the money to begin with! Akash Deep runs in from over the wicket and serves it on a good length on off, angling it in. Zak Crawley gets onto the front foot and blocks it towards mid on.

OUT! STUMPED! Smartly done by Shoaib Bashir and India's long first innings comes to an end! Mohammed Siraj is early to step out of his crease and Bashir sees him coming. Bashir brings out the carrom ball and bowls it into the pitch, darting it down leg. Siraj ends up walking past the ball and Jamie Smith has all the time in the world to dislodge the bails. Siraj falls for 8 (23) as Bashir gets 3 wickets and India end with 587 runs on the board.
Mohammed Siraj st J Smith b S Bashir 8 (23b 1x4 0x6)
Gives it a bit more air and throws it on middle, Prasidh Krishna has a swing at it but gets it off the inside edge towards backward square leg and picks up a single.
Floated up on the stumps, Krishna blocks it off.

Half an appeal for LBW but nothing doing says the umpire. Flighted, but on a dragged length and drifted into the batter. Prasidh Krishna looks to defend but is beaten on the inside edge and gets hit on the pads.
Tossed up on off, Siraj drives on the front foot and through mid on for a run.
Bashir persists with the wide line, flighting it up outside off, Siraj lunges across and defends off the inside edge.
The nip-backer, on a length and on middle. Prasidh Krishna gets across and dabs it to the right of the short leg fielder.
Length, around middle and leg, blocked off the back foot to the leg side.
Good-length delivery, angling on the leg stump, Prasidh Krishna taps it to the leg side. Gets a word of appreciation from Siraj.

Falls just short! Josh Tongue digs it in, short and on off. Prasidh Krishna tries to fend it out off the back foot, but is undone by the extra bounce. The ball lobs off the handle of the bat and falls just ahead of the backward point fielder.
Nagging length, on middle, Krishna opens up and knocks it to the right of the bowler.

Good shot and these are bonus runs for India! Fuller in length, at middle. Prasidh Krishna flicks it through mid-wicket and scampers back for the second run as the mid on fielder chases the ball to the deep.
Flatter and quicker, on off, Mohammed Siraj is solid in defence.
Overpitched around off, Krishna drills it to the right of mid off for a single.
Around off, full, and blocked off.
BEATEN! Flat and quick, just around off, goes straight on with some bounce. Prasidh Krishna draws out his front foot to block, but is beaten on the outside edge.
Full and straight on middle, Krishna defends it watchfully.
Outside off, full and looped up. Siraj goes for the drive but gets an outside edge and the ball rolls to the left of short third. A single taken.

A quick single to end the over. Touch full and around off. Mohammed Siraj plays at it and gets an inside edge. The ball then rolls to the widish mid on region and Siraj calls Krishna through for a quick single.
Slides it way down leg, and Siraj misses to flick. Smith grabs it behind to his left.
Nipping back in on top of middle. Mohammed Siraj hops on the crease and taps it to the right of the bowler.
Wayward down leg, short, Siraj offers no shot and Jamie Smith collects it diving low to his left.
Slants it across the batter, and down the leg side, on a short length, Mohammed Siraj shuffles inside the line and lets it pass.
Full and angling down leg, Mohammed Siraj misses to flick as he gets a bit too across.
Pulls the length back, with some turn into the batter. This is clipped off the back foot by Siraj for a single at deep backward square leg.

FOUR! What a shot! After four blocks, Siraj couldn't resist! Tossed up nicely, full and around off. Mohammed Siraj dances down the track and smashes it gun-barrel straight down the ground for a cracking boundary.
Aims at the sticks, does Bashir, this is full and Siraj brings his bat in front of the pads to block.
Flighted delivery on off, Siraj with a forward defence again.
Spinning in from off, Siraj gets on top of the full ball to block.
Looped up, full and around off, Mohammed Siraj defends it on the pitch.
Length and outside off, driven to point. A maiden from Josh Tongue.
Whoa! An attempted yorker from Josh Tongue, on the middle pole. Prasidh Krishna tries to block it, but inside edges onto the pads and the ball rolls beside the leg stump.
Angling on the off pole, short in length. Prasidh Krishna gets squared up and leaves.
Wild swing and a miss! Straighter and fuller, outside off, Prasidh Krishna with no footwork, swings for the hills, but connects thin air.
Arrowed wayward, way down the leg side, Krishna leaves, and a good diving stop by Jamie Smith to his left.
Cannoned on the leg stump, full, Prasidh Krishna misses the flick and is rammed on the front pad.
Tossed up again, quite full and around off, Siraj leans on and smothers the ball down the pitch.
Tossed up on off and turning in, Siraj watchfully nudges it away to the leg side.
Flighted again, full and outside off, Mohammed Siraj leqans right across trying to defend but is beaten past the outside edge.
Flighted up, quite slow and outside off, Prasidh Krishna waits back well and dabs it past first slip for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! Shoaib Bashir traps Akash Deep and picks up his second wicket of the match. Lobs this one right up on off stump, inviting the big shot again. This time, Akash sits down and tries to heave it away towards cow corner but lofts it down to wide long on. Ben Duckett takes a few steps to his right from long on and pouches it safely India now 574/9!
Akash Deep c B Duckett b S Bashir 6 (13b 1x4 0x6)
Tossed up outside off, inviting the drive, Akash Deep goes after it but misses.

Aims the sticks, does Tongue, full in length. Mohammed Siraj pushes at it but inside edges as the ball nips in. The ball rolls to the off side. Siraj tries to pinch in a single, but the cover fielder sprints towards the ball and restricts Siraj from leaving his crease.
Back of a length and sliding down the leg side. Siraj leaves.
Full around middle. Siraj looks to flick it away to the leg side but gets an inside edge to the forward short leg fielder.

OUT! GONE! CAUGHT! Finally, England get rid of Shubman Gill after a marathon and a record-tumbling knock. Josh Tongue sticks to bowl short and on middle, climbing above the shoulder height of the batter. Shubman Gill stands deep in the crease and shapes up to pull, but fails to keep it along the ground and the ball goes flat and straight to Ollie Pope who is stationed just in front of square leg. A simple regulation catch and Pope does not make any mistake. But a knock worth remembering from the Indian skipper and gets a warm reception from the Edgbaston crowd as he makes his way to the dressing room. Also, a few English players come to him, shake hands and tap on his shoulders as well. Shubman Gill departs on 269 (387).
Shubman Gill (c) c O Pope b J Tongue 269 (387b 30x4 3x6)
Short and shooting off the deck, outside off, Gill lets it be.
Short and on middle, pulled away to deep square leg. Gill denies the single.

Good fielding in the deep! Short and turning in and across the batter to the leg stump. Akash Deep steers it to deep square leg. The fielder from deep mid-wicket sprints and dives to his right to stop the ball, just before the ropes. Two taken.
Length, on off, punched to mid off.
BEATEN! Bashir lands this on a fullish length and gets some grip and bounce into the batter. Akash Deep is flummoxed by that and finds himself in an awkward position. Gets beaten on the outside edge.
Full, around off and middle, Gill leans forward and drills it down to long on for a single. Gill moves to 269, his highest score ever in first-class cricket.
Shortens the length, does Bashir, outside off, Shubman Gill hangs back and cuts it wide of deep backward point for a couple of runs.
Shoaib Bashir is into the attack now. Bowls full and straight, Gill defends.
FOUR! Oh, a good shot from Akash! Josh Tongue continues to bang the ball on the short length, on middle. Akash Deep gets inside the line and half-pulls it to deep backward square leg for a boundary.
Short and around off, Akash offers no shot.

Speared fuller now, on middle. Akash Deep drills it straight back. Josh Tongue on his follow-through sticks his right hand out and misses to get his fingertips as the ball smashes into the stumps at the bowler's end. Even if the ball had deflected, Gill never left his crease at the other end.
A bumper going down leg, Akash Deep ducks under it.
Fired in full and on off, Akash Deep pushes at it and gets it off the inner half of the bat to the leg side.

Tongue starts off with a short ball, outside off, Shubman Gill climbs on the bounce and cuts it square to deep point. Ollie Pope from deep covers, sprints to his let and intercepts the ball. Gill is content with a single.
No run.

This is darted flat and quick by Root, but down leg, Shubman Gill misses to sweep it away and the ball goes well past the left of the keeper, and rolls to the short fine leg region. A bye taken and that will be TEA ON DAY 2!
The length is pulled back a bit, on off, Gill hangs back and knocks it off.
Flatter and fuller, on off, Gill leans on and defends it out.
Full and pushed through on middle, flicked away to square leg.

FOUR! Magnificent! A juicy half volley on off, Shubman Gill plants his front foot out and drives it all along the ground, through covers for a boundary. A lovely free-flowing stroke from the Indian skipper.
Full and sliding on the leg stump. Clipped to short mid-wicket.
Full and around off, defended out by Deep. Survives the last ball.

Oh, that could have been curtains for Akash had the throw been perfect to the keeper. Pitched fuller with an in-drift on middle, Shubman Gill pushes it to the right of mid-wicket and calls his partner through for a single. Akash Deep, however, is a bit late to react and eventually skates off to the batting end. Ollie Pope picks the ball and throws it flat, but wayward to the left of the keeper. Akash makes his ground by putting in a dive and dragging his bat in. Gill gives a bit of an earful to Akash as he expected better from him.
Slightly outside off and full, pushed to short cover.
Same line, same length, blocked off by Gill.
Full and tossed on off, Shubman Gill lunges ahead and pushes it back to the bowler.
On off, spinning in, Shubman Gill goes back and across to knock it to the off side.

Over the wicket now and tossed up full on the pads. Akash Deep looks to block but gets a bit of bat as the ball crashes into the pads. Half an appeal from the English players but there's clearly bat involved.
Stays around the wicket and bowls a bumper, just around leg and Akash Deep manages to get out of the way. Excellent take from Jamie Smith to his left. Root does seem fired up.

OUT! TIMBER! What a delivery and that's come out of nowhere! Joe Root continues from around the stumps to the left-hander and gives it a real rip, tossing it up around middle. The ball seems to drift in and Washington Sundar just looks to defend down the line but the ball lands and turns sharply away from the left-hander, leaving Sundar baffled and goes on to crash into the stumps. Root is absolutely pumped as Sundar departs for a gritty 42 (103), ending a stand of 144 runs for the 7th wicket.
Washington Sundar b J Root 42 (103b 3x4 1x6)
Tossed-up delivery and outside off, Shubman Gill clips it away between mid on and mid-wicket and towards the deep for a run.
Loops this one up and bowls it on middle, Sundar pushes it down to long on for a single.
Darted in, full and on middle and leg, Washy eases it to mid on.
Flighted ball, drifting into the legs, Sundar leans forward and wrists it past square leg for another easy single.
On the shorter side and outside off, tapped away off the back foot to deep cover-point for a run.
Nagging length, wide of the off stump, looking for some turn which isn't there. Gill puts a stride across and leaves.
Floated up, full and just down leg, Sundar works it 'round the corner on the leg side and turns the strike over.
Floated up full and outside off, driven on the up and down to long off for a single.
Wide! Lobbed up again, this time it's even wider and Gill doesn't play at it. The umpire does signal a wide now.
Tossed up, wide outside off, flirting with the tramline. Gill leaves it alone but no wide is called.

FOUR! Put away with ease! Round arm again, slightly short and on leg, Washington Sundar rocks back and across before pulling it away in front of square on the leg side for a boundary. The 550 is now up for India as well.
A lot more round arm from Root, trying to sling it in towards off stump and this one stays low. Sundar manages to block it off.
Slightly flighted on off, angling it in, Sundar leans on defends down the line.
Fuller in length, pretty straight onto the stumps, Sundar plays it to the left of the bowler.
On the pads, turned away in front of square leg and into the deep for a single.
Tossed up on middle and leg, Gill leans on and nudges it to silly mid on.
Good length on the pads, Gill presses back and flicks it down to long leg for one more.
A bit flatter and around middle, tapped across through the mid-wicket region for another single by Sundar.
Bowled well short over leg, tucked away from the crease and through square leg for a single.
Floated up, from around the stumps now and around off, Gill leans on to defend.
Drops it short and bowls it outside off, this one keeps a tad low. Gill backs away and punches it straight to covers.
Flights this one up outside off, Gill lunges across and defends it more off the inside edge towards the leg side.
Flights it fuller and outside off, Sundar spreads on the crease and drives it straight to the short cover fielder.
Pulls the length back, on off, Washington Sundar tucks this to the left of short mid-wicket. Wants a single but Gill sends him back.
Around the stumps to Sundar. Full and sliding on middle, Sundar pushes it to the leg side.
Very slow again, full and on the stumps, Gill takes a giant stride out and flicks it to the right of square leg for a single.
Slow through the air, on middle, Gill clips this with the spin to short mid-wicket.
Joe Root is into the attack now. Bowls it full and spins in from middle. Shubman Gill presses ahead and pushes it back to Root.
Short and at the stumps, pulled away to deep square leg by Gill for a single.
Nice and full, around off, defended out.

Oh, that one gripped! Bashir drops this full and around off. It lands and sharply turns away from Sundar who leans to block, but gets a thick outside edge. The ball goes past the left of the first slip and trickles to the ropes at deep third. It is chased by the short third fielder who saves a run for his side. Three taken.
Slower through the air, spinning in and around off, Shubman Gill rocks back and works it to mid on for a single.
Around off, pushed to cover.
Tossed up, on off, defended straight back by Gill.
Full and around off, angling in, driven away wide of mid off for a single.

EDGED AND FOUR! Shubman Gill won't mind that and he brings up a stellar 250, even surpassing the great Sachin Tendulkar's highest score of 248 and goes 9th on the list of top scores by an Indian batter in Test matches. Nagging length and around off, Gill pokes at it and just a hint of away movement is enough to induce the outside edge and the ball rolls away into the deep third fence.
Around the wicket to the left-hander and slightly full around off. Patted down to covers for a single.
Slightly pitched up and on the pads, Shubman Gill looks to flick but gets a leading edge that goes towards covers and they pick up a single.
Good length on off and middle, angling in, blocked down to the right of mid on.
FOUR! A gentle half volley, wide outside off. Shubman Gill leans across and drives it firmly and square through covers for a boundary. Gill is now just one shot away from bringing up his 250.
Length, around off, blocked off by Sundar.
Length ball just around off. Gill clips it towards mid-wicket for a single.

SIX! Goes all the way! Bashir loops it on a fuller length, around middle and leg. Shubman Gill picks the length early, shimmies down the track, gets his bat underneath the ball properly and lofts it over wide long on for a six.
Slower through the air, full and on off, pushed straight back by Gill.
Drifts it into the batter, on middle, Washington Sundar gets across and nudges it to the left of square leg for a single.
Floats it up, full and on off, Sundar defends it back to Bashir.
Nice and full, straight on off, Gill lunges forward to block.
Length and at the pads. Sundar steers it towards backward square leg for a single.
Touch full and outside off, Washington Sundar places it out to backward point.
Length, on off, pushed straight back.
Darted into the batter, on a length, Sundar keeps it out to the point region.
Back of a length, outside off, Sundar cuts it late to the deep third region for a couple of runs.
Sundar tucks this length ball into the square leg region for a single.

Excellent bit of work from Woakes! Saves one for his side. Short and outside off from Bashir, Shubman Gill goes deep inside the crease and cuts it to the left of the short third region. Chris Woakes from short third gives it a long chase towards the ropes and just about manages to flick the ball in the playing area as he dives over the ropes. Meanwhile, Gill and Sundar almost collide with each other while completing the third, but no harm is done and they complete it before the throw comes in.
Floated fuller and around off, Gill leans ahead and gently taps it back to the bowler.
This stays a tad low on the bounce. Lands around off, and spins in. Shubman Gill negotiates well to block it off the back foot.
Tossed up full and on off, Gill defends it out well.
Around the wicket, flat and quick, short and around off, Sundar stands tall and punches it through mid off for a single.
Back of a length, outside off, Sundar taps it off the back foot, wide of cover-point for a single.
Bowls from well behind the crease, on a length, around off, Sundar works it across to mid on.
Into the line of the stumps, Washington Sundar blocks off.
'Round the stumps, length ball, outside of, Sundar goes inside the crease and dabs it to the left of the keeper.
Full and on middle, Shubman Gill flicks this to the mid on region for a quick single.
In front of the sticks, full, Gill eases it back to the bowler.
On top of the stumps, short-pitched, Washington Sundar hops and bunts it onto the pitch.
Pitched outside leg, on a length, Gill swivels and pulls it to the right of Zak Crawley at long leg for a single.
Short once again, on the leg stump, pulled to backward square leg.

FOUR BYES! When it rains, it pours! That has evaded everyone. Carse bowls from around the stumps and bangs it short, but outside leg. Shubman Gill does not play at it and the ball dies on the bounce and dribbles behind to the left of the keeper. Jamie Smith dives to the left but gets a bad bounce and the ball goes through to the fence behind.
A half-tracker, on the stumps, Gill tucks it to mid-wicket.

FOUR! Smartly played! Carse serves it short and on the leg stump line. Shubman Gill shuffles well outside leg and plays the upper cut over backward point for a boundary. And the 500 also comes up for India with this!
Outside off, on a yard behind fuller length, Gill crouches a bit and cuts it to deep backward point for a single.
Brings the angle into the batter, full in length, Gill flicks it to short mid-wicket. That's been bowled from well behind the stumps by Brook.
Full again, outside off, Gill drives it straight to the cover fielder.
Darted full and on off, Gill presses forward and knocks it to short cover.
Full and on middle and leg, pushed to the right of the bowler.

Hurls it full and on middle, Shubman Gill flicks it past mid-wicket and completes the single. Ben Duckett is after it and chases the ball from wide mid on, but his fumble allows the batter to cross for the second.
A steep bumper from Carse, at 131 kph, over off, Washington Sundar drops his wrists and bat down and arches back to leave. A wry smile from Carse to the batter.
Length, angling into the body. Sundar blocks it off the back foot.
Bashes the hard length again, does Carse, on middle, Washington Sundar gets right behind it and knocks it back to the bowler.
Short of a length, on top of middle. Sundar jumps off the back foot and tucks it to the mid on region.
Sticks to bowling short, on the bodyline, Sundar gets across and pinches this to square leg.
A sharp bouncer, angling on the leg stump line. Washington Sundar hops off the back foot and drops it down to the off side, beside the pitch.
Slightly full and at the stumps, eased away to silly mid on. 12 easy runs off the part timer and Stokes' frustration will just keep growing.

FOUR! And again! Pitched up around middle, Shubman Gill leans right on and punches the straight drive, this time to the right of the stumps at the other end and the ball races away for a third consecutive boundary in the over. Gill moves on to 222, the highest score by any Indian batter in England, beating the previous best of 221 by Sunil Gavaskar from way back in 1979 at The Oval.

FOUR! Beautiful from Shubman! Too full and around middle, Gill gets onto the front foot and drills the straight drive just to the left of the stumps at the other end and the ball rolls away into the fence.
FOUR! Too wide and put away by Gill! Length ball, well outside off, Shubman Gill waits well and reaches out before tapping it wide enough of deep third to pick up a boundary.
Good-length ball and on off, Gill opens the bat face and blocks it to cover-point.
A gentle full ball, around the fifth stump line, Gill gets forward and punches it back to the bowler.

Oh, that could have gone anywhere! Short from Carse, over middle and around chest height. Shubman Gill lifts one leg up and tries to angle the pull but checks his shot and gets a bit of a top edge perfectly over the square leg region and picks up another single.
Shorter in length and around off, Sundar gets up on his toes and angles it down behind backward point and picks up a single.

Sundar has no idea where the ball went! Dug in short again and at the body, Washy is a bit tentative and tries fending it away but the ball takes the bottom side of the arm guard and goes back onto the pads. That could have easily gone back onto the stumps.
Around the wicket now, bowled a tad short and around off, Sundar blocks it off the back foot.
This is short again and angled across the off stump, Sundar drops his hands and leans a touch and lets it through to the keeper.
Dug in short and over middle, Sundar stays compact and hops up before pushing it down to covers.
FOUR! Quicker one, pushed across off stump from around the wicket, Gill stays back and reaches out before angling the bat and guiding it down wide of first slip and into the deep third fence.

FOUR! Reverse-sweep, not for the first time from Shubman Gill in this innings. Fuller one on off and middle, Gill goes for the reverse and brooms it away slightly wide of deep third and into the fence.
Slower and shorter, turning in from around off, Gill gets inside the line a touch and turns it towards mid-wicket.
Flatter delivery around off, Shubman strides across and blocks it off.
Tossed up, full and on middle, Sundar comes forward and pushes it down to long on for one more.
Flighted up on the pads, nudged away around the corner on the leg side for a single.
Down the leg side once again and left alone by Sundar. Tongue might have bowled one too many overs bending his back on every delivery and probably needs a rest.
Banged in short and well down leg, this one doesn't rise up at all and Sundar just watches it go down to the keeper.
Another bumper, trying to attack the bodyline but gets it a bit too leg side and Sundar just moves out of the way.
A sharp bumper, banged in over middle and leg and angling away, Sundar awkwardly sways away from the line of the ball.
Short and wide outside off, Sundar leaves it alone.

There it is, a maiden DOUBLE TON FOR SHUBMAN GILL and what a sensational knock this has been for the Indian skipper. Loose delivery from Tongue, a short ball down leg, Gill gets inside the line and pulls it down to fine leg for a single. Gill takes off the helmet as he gets to the other end. Kneels down, does an aggressive fist-pump in the air, and soaks in the deserved applause from the crowd. The entire Indian dressing room gives a united standing ovation to its skipper. Just the third player after Sunil Gavaskar and Rahul Dravid to score a Test double ton against England in England.
A maiden! Tossed up, full and straight, Sundar lunges to defend.
A bit flatter and angled into the pads, Sundar plays around it and misses the flick, getting hit on the pads.
Flighted ball, full and on off, solily blocked off by Washy.
Nice and full, angling on with the arm into the pads, Sundar nudges it gently into the leg side.
Just drags the length back a few inches and drops it onto middle, Sundar staysback and defends it out.
Floated up on middle, drifting in a bit, Sundar pushes it towards mid on.

Banged in short again, angling across off, Sundar climbs on top of the bounce and smacks the pull towards deep mid-wicket for a single and will keep strike for the start of the next over again, and the crowd will have to wait for Gill to get on strike as he remains on 199.
Short again from Tongue, around leg and this one stays a bit low. Sundar manages to duck under it.
SIX! Sundar having a bit of fun now and toying with Josh Tongue. Even shorter and around leg, Sundar walks to the off side and hooks the ball over fine leg for a biggie. India now move on to 470/6!
FOUR! Nicely played! Short and around the hips, Washington Sundar hops inside the line and flicks it away past fine leg for a boundary. The 50-run stand is up between the two.
Back of a length and around off, blocked down into the off side by Sundar.
This is bowled short and at the bodyline but just sprays it down leg. Sundar hops across and shoulders arms.
Nice and full, around off, Sundar leans on and smothers the ball wide of point for a quick single.
Nagging length, pushed through at the stumps, Sundar watchfully defends.
Tossed up around off, turning away, Sundar makes a leave.
FOUR! Flatter again, angled down leg, Washington Sundar hops back and across the leg stump before dabbing it away down to fine leg for a boundary.
Flatter one at the stumps, blocked off.

Tossed up at the stumps, Gill leans on and drives it down to long on for a single and moves on to 199. This is already the best score by an Asian batter in SENA countries (South Africa, England, New Zealand and Australia), beating the previous best by Tillakaratne Dilshan of Sri Lanka who scored 193 at Lord's. The top 5 list also consists of the likes of Mohammed Azharuddin of India (192 in Auckland in 1990 and 179 in Manchester in 1990) and Hanif Mohammad of Pakistan (187 not out at Lord's in 1967).
Hard length outside off, eased away past point for a single.

Was there a glove involved there? Surely, seemed like it but it didn't carry, so no harm done. Shortish length angled down leg, Gill plays a loose pull and gets the bottom side of the glove and the ball lands short of Jamie Smith.
Good running again! Short of a good length and outside off, Gill reaches out and taps the ball away through backward point and races back for the second run.

FOUR! Oh, deary me! A collision in the deep and hopefully, both fielders are fine. Length ball on the pads, clipped away with stellar timing by Shubman Gill and he gets it perfectly between fine leg and deep square leg. Joe Root runs to his left and Zak Crawley to his right and both slide across but neither can save the ball and crash into each other. Root seems a bit hurt but is good to continue.
A short ball now and around off, angling in, Gill ducks under it.

FOUR! Beautiful! Slightly overpitched and around off, Shubman Gill takes half a stride in front and checks the drive, punching it in between extra cover and mid off for a boundary and he moves into the 190s.
Bowled flatter and on off, Sundar leans on to defend.
Floated up, Gill leans on and pushes it to the bowler's right and gets it down to long on for a single.
Oh, Gill misses out there! A high full toss from Bashir and on middle, Gill just swats it away down to mid-wicket but he could have hit that one anywhere.
Flighted up and around off, defended down the line by Gill.

SIX! Controlled aggression again from Gill and that is a lovely shot. This is tossed up outside off and the drift takes the ball further away. Shubman Gill sees mid off up and decides to step out and just holds his posture before lofting it straight onto the boundary cushion at long off for a six.
On a length, bowled quicker and on off, Gill covers the line and blocks it off.
Hard length on middle and leg, this one sticks in the deck. Washington Sundar pushes at it and gets it just short and wide of a deepish short leg.
Back of a length around off and angling further away, Sundar leaves it alone.
Tongue changes the angle of attack to the left-hander and comes over the wicket. Digs in a short one over off and angles it across. Washy sways away from the line of the ball.
Hard length again and in the channel, Sundar pats it down into the off side.
Hard-length delivery on off, blocked off by Sundar.

Good, positive running! Good length outside off, pushed to the left of covers for a quick single. With that, Shubman Gill moves to 180 and brings up the highest score by an Indian skipper on English soil, beating the previous best of 179 by Mohammad Azharuddin in Manchester in 1990.
Same line, and same length, Sundar gently pushes this to the right of Bashir who collects it.
Around off, spins away slightly, Washington Sundar drives it inside out to the cover fielder.
Full and straight on middle, defended back by Sundar.

A mild appeal for LBW, but not given. Clearly off the inside edge. This is full and spinning in a shy bit from off. Shubman Gill premeditates and tries to play the reverse, but underedges it on the pads and the ball rolls to the short fine leg region. They collect a single.
Slides it onto the pads, on a length, Washington Sundar tucks this to the left of mid-wicket for a single.
Tossed-up delivery, full and on off, Washington Sundar lunges forward and blocks.
Back of a length, around off, tapped off the back foot to the backward point region for a single.
A sharp lifter from Tongue this, short and going down leg. Washington Sundar leaves as he sways away from the line.
Lands it on a good length, outside off, Sundar lets it be.
Fractionally full and just outside off, Shubman Gill presses forward and knocks the ball into the cover-point region for a quick single.
On top of off, hard length, Washington Sundar punches this off the back foot and the ball rolls through the cover region. A single taken.
Shortish delivery, angling on the leg stump. Shubman Gill glances it off the back foot to deep square leg and jogs for a single.
Some turn away from off, on a fullish length. Washington Sundar sees the ball till the last moment and keeps it out on the front foot.
Pitched fuller and in the line of the stumps, Shubman Gill drills this wide of long on for a single.

FOUR! The first boundary of the session. And that's timed and placed to perfection. Quite fuller from Bashir this time around, lands and goes straight around off. Shubman Gill leans forward and drives it through the cover region for a boundary.
Gives the ball some air, and lands it full and on off, Shubman Gill is stubborn with his front foot block.
Darts in on a length, outside off, Sundar cuts it to backward point.
Pitched on middle, Shubman Gill gently flicks this full ball, down to long on for a single.
Nagging length, on top of off, Washington Sundar solidly blocks it off the back foot.
Tongue tries the bouncer from around the stumps, but it flies down leg and Sundar shows no intent to play at it. Lets the ball through to the keeper.
Keeps the stumps into attack, does Tongue, on a length, angling in. Washington Sundar gets right behind it and drops it on the surface.
Shortish delivery, on off, Washington Sundar gets on his toes to dab it onto the pitch with soft hands. Oh, dear! Another No Ball as Josh Tongue has overstepped.

Back of a length, just nipping away from middle a touch, with some uneven bounce. Washington Sundar pushes forward to defend, but plays over the line and is beaten by the bounce, getting rapped on the front thigh pad.
Around the stumps to Sundar. It is a length ball, just outside off, Washington Sundar watches it closely and hangs his bat in the air to leave.
Short, outside off, Shubman Gill gets on the toes and dabs it away to deep backward point for a single.
Full and looped up, Sundar smothers it back to the bowler.
Nice and full, around off, eased into the off side.

Confusion! Almost a run out chance, but Sundar gets back safe. Drags the length back, does Bashir, on the stumps, Sundar lets the ball arrive and tucks it to the square leg region. He sniffs a single and is through for it, but Gill sees Joe Root closing in to his left from mid-wicket, and quickly sends Sundar back on a sharp call.
Nice loopy delivery, on middle, Washington Sundar clips this to short mid-wicket.
Floated up, full and on middle, Sundar defends it out.
Over the stumps, tossed up through the air, full and on off, Shubman Gill takes a giant stride out and places the ball towards backward point. Gets an easy single.

Solidly defended and Washington Sundar manages to see out the final over of the session. Just back of a length and around off, Sundar gets behind the line of the ball and keeps it out on the off side. That will be LUNCH ON DAY 2!

That is a pearler from Josh Tongue but it is well negotiated in the end by Washington Sundar. Tongue serves another bumper, angling it at the batter and bowls it over middle. Sundar gets side on to pull but quickly ducks for cover, almost leaving his gloves hanging up as the ball zips through to the keeper.
Hard length on off, Sundar blocks it down the line.

No ball! Back of a length and around off, Sunda hops back to defend and edges it down to the right of gully. Good stop there from Ben Duckett. Tongue has overstepped in an attempt to really get his speed up.

Oh, that's nasty! Josh Tongue bowls another quick short ball and bowls it right at the batter. Washington Sundar sets up to play at it but the ball keeps a shade low and skids through to smash into the arm guard. That could have been much nastier but Sundar fends it away well.

Lovely delivery! Hard length around off, darted in towards the top of off and just holds its line. Washington Sundar hangs on the back foot and pushes at it but gets an outside edge that goes down towards second slip.
A length ball at the pads, clipped firmly down to deep backward square leg for a single.
Flighted up, a bit slower and drifted in from around middle. Sundar leans ahead to block.
Straighter now, on the stumps nd turned through square leg for a single.
This is looped up wide outside off, enticing the batter. Gill puts a huge stride across and drives it to the left of covers where Joe Root makes a sharp stop.
Fuller and around leg, Washy watchfully clips it away in front of square leg and gets off the mark with a single.
Floated up, fuller and around off, Gill lunges across and eases it down to long on for a single.
Flighted up outside off, looking for some turn, Gill strides across and pushes it away to covers.
On a hard length and outside off, seaming away slightly. Sundar leaves it alone.
Hard length around off, Sundar blocks it off.
Another quick bumper to welcome the new batter. Banged in quick and short over off, Washington Sundar ducks under it well.

OUT! CAUGHT BEHIND! Wow, what a ripper of a delivery and Josh Tongue has given his team a huge breakthrough. England have persisted with the short-ball stuff to Ravindra Jadeja for some time now, but it has all been too comfortable. However, Tongue had the extra pace and bowls a brilliant bumper, banging it halfway down the track and aiming it right around the helmet. Jadeja is hurried by the pace and bounce and tries to fend it away. The ball takes the shoulder of the blade and lobs behind the stumps, where Jamie Smith takes a simple catch to his right. Jadeja departs for a brilliant 89 (137) and India are 414/6 and the 202-run partnership is broken as well.
Ravindra Jadeja c J Smith b J Tongue 89 (137b 10x4 1x6)
On a good length and sliding down leg, Gill gets his hands out in front of the pads and flicks it down to long leg for one.
Hard length over the stumps, pushed down in front of mid-wicket for a quick but easy single.

SIX! Top shot! Bashir comes around the stumps and floats it up full on middle and leg. Shubman Gill gets down on one knee and sweeps it stylishly and aerially over the square leg fence for a biggie. The partnership has now gone past 200 runs.

Oh, hello! Shoaib Bashir brings out the carrom ball and gets it to do something off the deck. Slower through the air and bowled on a length around middle and leg. This one grips and bounces as well as Gill nudges it down to short fine leg. Jadeja wants the single but Gill isn't interested.
Nagging length around off, good energy put into the delivery. Gill leans on to defend.
Slower through the air, Bashir throws it up outside off. Jadeja waits well and taps it behind point for a single.
Quicker one, bowled flatter and at the stumps, nudged away to mid-wicket.

SIX! No long on in place and Ravindra Jadeja makes merry. This is tossed up around off, Jadeja skips down the pitch and hits through the line, lofting it over the ropes for a six. The 400 also comes up for India with that.
